masterball_rewards_dialogue_0: You have received a Master Ball.
masterball_rewards_dialogue_1: The very best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_1_0: Good to see you, %PLAYERNAME%! Question—have you been by the woods at all lately?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_1_1: I ask because a nearby forest has been looking pretty lush lately.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_1_2: It reminded me of some old stories I came across back in my student days.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_1_3: There are accounts from different eras that describe trees flourishing in the forest along with the appearance of a particular Pokémon.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_1_4: I wonder if any of those tales are true. I’ll have to dig into my notes and find the name of the Pokémon they’re referring to.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_2_0: Welcome back! Have you had a chance to observe any of the surrounding locations?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_2_1: Whenever I find myself getting lost in my notes, I like to take breaks near trees in the area.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_2_2: Oh, speaking of my notes—the Pokémon in the stories I was talking about earlier turns out to have been Celebi!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_2_3: And—this is the really juicy part—Celebi is known as the Time Travel Pokémon. It came here from the future by crossing over time!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_2_4: Sounds right out of a myth, right? Let’s keep investigating and see if the phenomenon I observed is connected to Celebi!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_3_0: %PLAYERNAME%! I was just looking for you! Did you turn up anything interesting in your own investigation?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_3_1: I actually think I spotted Celebi in the wild!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_3_2: It seemed like it was bolstering the grass and trees around it—and that matches what’s recorded about it.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_3_3: Its coloring was different than expected, though. What could that mean?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_3_4: Whatever the answer, we ought to keep an eye out for our fantastical forest friend.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_4_0: I’ve been looking inward a lot lately—meditative, even. I wonder if it’s due to Celebi’s presence?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_4_1: They say that it only appears during peaceful times...
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_4_2: Well, if that’s true, I hope it stays with us for a long time!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_4_3: How about you, %PLAYERNAME%? Have you felt inspired by the calm?
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_4_4: It might be nice to spend some time basking in the serenity around us with your buddy!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_5_0: I saw Celebi again! It flew off when I tried to approach, but I found an egg near where I spotted it.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_5_1: According to my research, Celebi is said to leave behind an egg it brought from the future, so I can’t wait to study this one!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_5_2: This is a good sign! We’re going to have another encounter with Celebi—I can just feel it!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_5_3: You keep up the good work exploring—and make sure you’re prepared for when the time comes.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_5_4: It’s no small feat to catch a Mythical Pokémon like Celebi, but I’m sure you have what it takes!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_6_0: Yes! You’ve done brilliantly, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m so proud of you for seeing this task through.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_6_1: And what a worthwhile task it was! Just look at the hue on your new friend there—this is a Shiny Celebi!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_6_2: It’s thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_6_3: And if you ask me, your contribution towards that future will be nothing short of mythical!
masterwork_dialogue_whisper_woods_6_4: Make sure to take some time to celebrate with your new friend, Trainer. And until next time, let’s GO!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_0_0: Thank you for all your help with Gyarados and Celebi, %PLAYERNAME%. Though it seems our work isn’t over yet—Team GO Rocket still has Lugia and Ho-Oh.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_0_1: With the team leaders’ help, we managed to pinpoint Apex Shadow Ho-Oh’s location. For reasons unknown, Team GO Rocket’s keeping the two Pokémon in separate locations.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_0_2: Perhaps they’ve bitten off more than they can chew with these two Legendary Pokémon? In any case, this makes things easier for us: we’ll save these Pokémon one at a time!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_0: Great work saving Apex Shadow Ho-Oh, %PLAYERNAME%! It looks like it knows Sacred Fire, Ho-Oh’s signature move—yet this one’s Sacred Fire is somehow even more powerful!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_1: I wonder what will happen if you purify it. Will it become even stronger?
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_2: I’m going to continue researching this incredible Pokémon. I’ll keep you posted on what I learn.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_3: While I’m off, why don’t you train up your Pokémon and see what friends are available to help with Apex Shadow Lugia.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_4: We’re going to need all the help we can get!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_1_5: The team leaders and I will also continue our investigation into Apex Shadow Lugia’s whereabouts. I hope we’ll know more soon.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_0: Do you have everything you need, %PLAYERNAME%? Potions? Revives? Snacks?
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_1: Saving Apex Shadow Lugia will be an even greater challenge, so be prepared.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_2: The team leaders and I discovered that Team GO Rocket has hidden Apex Shadow Lugia away in a secret hideout, guarded by a gauntlet of Grunts—and standing with them is none other than Giovanni himself.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_3: And while I have you, remember how I said I’d conduct more research into Apex Shadow Ho-Oh?
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_4: Well, it turns out that if you purify it, its Sacred Fire move will become immeasurably powerful.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_5: Apex Purified Ho-Oh might be an incredible ally in our quest to save Apex Shadow Lugia.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_2_6: These may just be some of the toughest battles you’ll face as a Pokémon Trainer yet. But I know you, above all else, are the one most prepared for the challenge.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_3: You saved Apex Shadow Lugia from Team GO Rocket!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_4: Just like Ho-Oh, Apex Shadow Lugia’s Aeroblast attack is more powerful than any I’ve ever seen.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_5: And just like Apex Shadow Ho-Oh, I’m confident that its power will increase even more if you purify it.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_6: Now, I’d say we’re overdue for a celebration! You’ve earned it.
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_7: Your recent accomplishments are no small feat!
masterwork_lugiahoohs_dialogue_3_8: Thanks again for all your help. I’m sure Lugia and Ho-Oh are grateful, too. Until our next adventure...let’s GO!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_01: Exciting news—I just found out Jirachi is in the area!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_02: Hoenn legends say that Jirachi can grant any wish that people desire, though it’s only awake seven days out of a thousand years.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_03: But considering there were Jirachi sightings just a few years ago—hardly a thousand!—I hypothesize there’s something special about this Jirachi.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_04: It sounds like we need to locate the Wish Pokémon for ourselves!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_05: Without a clear starting point, we should cast a wide net.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_06: I recommend we start the search by looking into Pokémon from the Kanto, Johto, and Hoenn regions.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_00_07: Maybe researching one of those Pokémon will give us the lead we need!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_00: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! No Jirachi leads, I’m afraid, but seeing you catch those Pokémon made me think about how much you’ve grown in your journey as a Trainer.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_01: Ah! I’ve got an idea! “I wish we knew where to find Jirachi!”
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_03: Oh well—I suppose Jirachi’s not granting that particular wish. It was worth a shot!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_04: But that’s enough wishing from me. Say...what do you think your Pokémon would wish for?
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_05: To spend some time together? Or maybe to share a tasty snack?
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_01_06: Why don’t you take a moment to get in tune with your Pokémon’s wishes, %PLAYERNAME%, while I noodle on more ways to locate Jirachi.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_00: You and your Pokémon are looking refreshed and ready to continue the search for Jirachi, %PLAYERNAME%!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_01: Something occurred to me while you were away—Jirachi was originally discovered in the Hoenn region, as you may already know.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_02: But it’s not the only elusive Pokémon first discovered in that region.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_03: It shares that honor with Kecleon, the Color Swap Pokémon. Kecleon can change the colors of its body at will to blend in with its surroundings.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_04: There’s one exception—it can’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly. Looking for that distinctive pattern is the key to spotting Kecleon, but even that trick doesn’t make it easy!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_05: I was years into my Pokémon studies before I came across my first Kecleon.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_06: Have you encountered a Kecleon yet? Who knows how many times you’ve been standing right next to one without knowing it!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_02_07: I’ve heard Trainers have had luck finding Kecleon around PokéStops. Maybe Jirachi’s taken up the same proclivity for hiding!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_03_00: You’ve got sharp eyes, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve never seen so many Kecleon in one place. It’s rare to see any Kecleon at all, with their expert camouflaging skills.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_03_01: Unfortunately for us, it seems like Jirachi might be even harder to spot than Kecleon.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_03_02: But I, for one, am undaunted! Keeping your confidence and spirits high is key both in research and in life, I say.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_03_03: Maybe what we need is a little dash of luck to move us ahead.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_03_04: And what’s luckier than a Lucky Pokémon, eh, %PLAYERNAME%?
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_00: Hey there %PLAYERNAME%! Feeling any luckier with your new Pokémon?
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_01: I know I am! I’ve got a good feeling that Jirachi is closer than ever.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_02: Now let’s put that luck to use with some good old-fashioned exploring!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_03: We can take some inspiration from Jirachi’s sleep schedule.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_04: As you know, Jirachi is only awake for seven days out of  a thousand years.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_05: So how about you try dedicating seven days to research? Or catching a thousand Pokémon? I know it’s a lot to ask, but maybe Jirachi will appreciate the perseverance.
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_04_06: Although I hope you’ll be around to help me with my research for a lot longer than a week, %PLAYERNAME%!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_00: %PLAYERNAME%, you did it—you’ve found our elusive Jirachi!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_01: It was no easy task, but you persevered through thick and thin. You’ve done me proud again!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_02: It seems our new friend really is different from the Jirachi observed a few years ago. This is a Shiny Jirachi, as I’m sure you’ve noticed from its unique coloring!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_03: I wonder if it has different habits. Does its sleep schedule differ? What about its temperament?
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_04: Ahem. Sorry about that. It’s hard to contain my excitement when I think about all there is to learn about Pokémon!
masterwork_shiny_jirachi_sr_dialog_05_05: In fact, my fondest wish is that we can keep learning—together!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_0: Ah, %PLAYERNAME%! Glad to have you aboard this expedition. Say, have you ever heard this particular tune?
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_1: Da da da doo, da dee da dum... That’s what I hear in my head when I think of a certain sailor and his Wingull that I met while traveling through the Hoenn region in my younger years.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_2: I believe the tune was originally a sea shanty. Sailors would sing songs like this together on their seafaring adventures to keep morale high and help find a rhythm during certain tasks.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_3: I’m no sailor, but I do find myself feeling luckier after humming it! Haha!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_4: Anyway, we’re here to look into the strange situation we uncovered during your Kanto-themed journey.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_5: I’m talking, of course, about reports of encounters with Mew, the New Species Pokémon. There have been several sightings of a Shiny one recently, which is tremendously exciting!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_6: That means our goal on this expedition is to find not only one of the most elusive Pokémon to ever exist, but a Shiny one at that!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_7: You’ve experienced a lot on your journeys thus far, %PLAYERNAME%. But perhaps the most wonderful thing about Pokémon is that there’s always something new to discover.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_1_8: I hope you’re excited for what’s to come, because I have a feeling it’s going to be a real test of your skills as a Trainer!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_2_0: Wow, %PLAYERNAME%—great work! Your knowledge of the Kanto region is beginning to rival even my own!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_2_1: Our next task is to learn more about Pokémon DNA.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_2_2: I know that sounds pretty heavy on the science, but don’t worry—I’ll take care of that part. All I need you to do is get out there and catch lots of different types of Pokémon!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_2_3: Mew’s DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so to better understand Mew, we should try to understand as much as we can about the genetics of other Pokémon.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_3_0: Incredible work, %PLAYERNAME%! Seeing you learn so much about different Pokémon reminded me of how vast the world of Pokémon truly is.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_3_1: Knowledge is funny in that the more we gain, the more realize how much we still lack. Some might find that frustrating, but for me it’s inspiring!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_3_2: You know, there’s a part in that sea shanty I mentioned before that seems applicable here.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_3_3: I don’t remember the exact words, but the gist is that we should travel across the land, searching far and wide to learn about all the amazing Pokémon there are in the world.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_3_4: Words to live by, I say! Let’s get out there and track down that Shiny Mew, Trainer!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_0: %PLAYERNAME%, you... You did it! You actually found and caught a Shiny Mew!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_1: Has it even sunk in yet? This is a monumental achievement, Trainer. Take a moment to congratulate yourself!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_2: Hm? It’s my achievement as well? Haha! No, no, I just hummed you a shanty and guided you like any Pokémon Professor worth their sea salt would.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_3: But thanks are certainly in order for the Pokémon you’ve befriended on your journey. They played a big part in your research, after all!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_4: The ones you’ve caught, the ones you’ve battled with, and the ones that traveled with you as your buddy—each Pokémon played a critical part in helping you achieve this goal.
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_5: As Trainers, we owe an eternal debt to our Pokémon. After all, we can’t very well be Trainers without them!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_6: A Trainer’s journey is meant to be filled with amazing memories, ambitious dreams, and unexpected adventures. I think this particular journey checked all those boxes pretty handily!
masterwork_sm_dialogue_4_7: I’m sure it won’t be the last to do so, either. Now, until next time...let’s GO!

mega_level_tutorial_hero_body:
Mega Evolution temporarily changes a Pokémon’s appearance and increases its strength. Mega-Evolved Pokémon can be used in Gyms, raids, and Trainer Battles.

You can use only one Mega-Evolved Pokémon at a time.
mega_level_tutorial_page1_body:
• You can now Mega Evolve a Pokémon without using Mega Energy.
• You can still use Mega Energy to Mega Evolve a Pokémon during its rest period.
• New bonuses have been added that will improve the more your Pokémon’s Mega Level increases.

After a Pokémon Mega Evolves, you’ll need to wait a while before it can Mega Evolve again without using Mega Energy. You can also use Mega Energy to Mega Evolve your Pokémon before then.
mega_level_tutorial_page2_body: Using Mega Energy You can always Mega Evolve a Pokémon using Mega Energy even if the Pokémon is in a rest period. The Mega Energy required to do so will depend on the length of the rest period.  Rest Your Pokémon will need to rest after Mega Evolving without using Mega Energy. A Pokémon’s rest periods will become shorter the more it Mega Evolves.
mega_level_tutorial_page3_body:
Mega Energy is unique to each Pokémon species and can be earned using the following methods.
• Win Mega Raids.
• Complete certain research tasks.
• Adventure with a Buddy Pokémon that can Mega Evolve.
mega_level_tutorial_page4_body:
After Mega Evolving, your Pokémon will be fatigued and need time before it can Mega Evolve again without using Mega Energy. You can always Mega Evolve a Pokémon using Mega Energy, even during a rest period.
• A Pokémon’s rest periods will become shorter the more it Mega Evolves.
• The Mega Energy required to Mega Evolve a Pokémon will decrease as the Pokémon’s rest period becomes shorter.
mega_level_tutorial_page5_body: Each Mega-Evolved Pokémon has a Mega Level. When a Pokémon’s Mega Level increases, you’ll get more bonuses, and the period you’ll have to wait before you can Mega Evolve the Pokémon again will be shorter. Each time you Mega Evolve a Pokémon, you work toward increasing its Mega Level.
mega_level_tutorial_page6_body:
When you catch a Pokémon that shares a type with your Mega-Evolved Pokémon, you’ll receive the following bonuses.
• Extra Candy
• Extra XP
• An increased chance of receiving Candy XL

mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_0: What’s that you’ve got, %PLAYERNAME%? Ah! Yes, I see—this appears to be a very old coin.  I picked one up myself, actually. There’s something mysterious about them...
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_1: Professor Willow? Can you hear me?
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_10: All right, %PLAYERNAME%—let’s get cracking! I’d like to find a few more coins, so why don’t we start looking around?
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_11: These coins are a little suspicious, but I can’t help feeling excited all the same! I believe a thorough investigation is in order.
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_12: We’ve got a lot of ground to cover—so I’ll start my search over there! Are you ready? Then let’s GO!
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_2: Oh—hello, Jacq! It was great hearing you speak at the World Pokémon Ecological Society conference the other day!
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_3: Thank you. Your lecture, “Strolling through the World of Pokémon,” was fantastic, too!
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_4: %PLAYERNAME%, this is Jacq. He teaches biology at an academy in the Paldea region.
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_5: It’s very nice to meet you! Hm? Oh! That coin...!
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_6: Hm? Do you know something about this, Jacq?
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_7: I think I might... I know we were supposed to discuss Diglett, but can I get a rain check? This is something that I want to look into!
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_8: Of course! I’ll get right on researching this with %PLAYERNAME%. And I’ll be sure to take a video of the coin and share it with you soon.
mystery_invasion_onboarding_dialogue_9: Thank you! I’ll see you later, then. Happy exploring!

npc_mateo_choice_001:
If you’re keen, you can pick a Gift to share with another Trainer. I’ll give you one from another Trainer in return!

Would you like to exchange Gifts?
npc_mateo_choice_002:
Always great to cross paths with you, my friend! Interested in exchanging Gifts today?

You can choose a Gift to send from the ones I’ve collected from nearby PokéStops, and I’ll give you a Gift from another Trainer in return.
npc_mateo_deny_001: Not to worry! Some other time, then. Come find me at the end of another Route if you change your mind!
npc_mateo_exchange_001: Not to worry! Some other time, then. Come find me at the end of another Route if you change your mind!
npc_mateo_exchange_002: Thanks for making another Trainer’s day! I hope you enjoy your new keepsake too. Till next time!
npc_mateo_intro_001: Heyo, %PLAYERNAME%! Mateo here. Fancy running into you on this Route. Aren’t the great outdoors, well...great? There are so many sights to see and Trainers to meet!
npc_mateo_intro_002: One of my favorite things to do when I bump into a friendly face is to exchange Gifts. It’s my way of connecting Trainers around the world. So, are you up for a little Gift swap?

onboard_short_tos: Pokémon GO is a location-based game. Your location information is collected by this application and may be visible to other users when you take certain actions in the game.
onboard_welcome_screen|1:
Hello there!
I am Professor Willow.
onboard_welcome_screen|2: Did you know that this world is inhabited by creatures known as Pokémon?
onboard_welcome_screen|3: Pokémon can be found in every corner of the earth.
onboard_welcome_screen|4: Some run across the plains, others fly through the skies, some live in the mountains, or in the forests, or near water…
onboard_welcome_screen|5: I have spent my whole life studying them and their geography.
onboard_welcome_screen|6: Will you help me with my research?
onboard_welcome_screen|8: You’ll need to find and collect Pokémon from everywhere.
onboard_welcome_screen|9: Choose your style to start your adventure!

pick_team_desc: To control this Gym, you must pit your skills and your Pokémon in battle against others! Three teams compete for control of Gyms. You must join one of the teams before you can battle.
player_cheating_warning: We have detected activity on your account that suggests you are or someone is accessing your account using modified client software or unauthorized third-party software that accesses Pokémon GO in violation of our Terms of Service. Please be aware that the use of such software can result in the loss of your account. If you have been using such software, we strongly encourage you to stop. If you have accessed certain unauthorized third-party apps or websites, it is also possible that your account may have been compromised. We recommend that you change your password immediately.
player_cheating_warning|a: Warning Notice We have detected activity on your account that indicates you are using modified client software or unauthorized third-party software in violation of our Terms of Service. You may experience degraded gameplay for approximately 7 days. We strongly encourage you to stop this activity. Any further transgressions will result in an account suspension. Visit the Help Center for more information.
player_cheating_warning|b: Warning Notice We have detected activity on your account that indicates you are using modified client software or unauthorized third-party software in violation of our Terms of Service. This is the first Strike against your account. It will last for approximately {0} more days. We strongly encourage you to stop this activity. Any further transgressions will result in an account suspension. Visit the Help Center for more information.
player_level_low: Your Trainer level is too low to do this.
player_suspended_warning: Your suspension term has ended and you are now able access your account. The prior suspension was a result of activity on your account that indicated the use of modified client software or unauthorized third-party software in violation of our Terms of Service. This is your last opportunity to reform your ways. Any further transgressions will result in your account being permanently banned. Visit the Help Center for more information.

poi_power_turorial_1: If you scan this PokéStop or add a photo, PokeStop points will increase. When it levels up it will provide more bonuses depending on its level.
poi_power_turorial_2: When you level up a PokeStop, you can get these bonus and benefits.
poi_power_turorial_7: When you visit the location with your buddy and spin the Photo disk, your buddy gets a heart!
poi_power_turorial_8: At a PokéStop, wild Pokémon will appear more frequently. At a Gym, you’ll have bonus Premier Balls in the Pokémon encounter after you win a Raid Battle.
poi_power_tutorial_1: If you scan this location or add a photo, the location will gain location points. When the location is powered up, it will provide bonuses depending on its level.
poi_power_tutorial_2: Power up a location to get these bonuses.
poi_power_tutorial_7: When you spin the location’s Photo Disc while your buddy is walking with you, your buddy will get a heart!
poi_power_tutorial_8: At a PokéStop, wild Pokémon will appear more frequently. At a Gym, you’ll have bonus Premier Balls in the Pokémon encounter after you win a Raid Battle.

poi_sub_camera_permission_desc: To submit a PokéStop nomination, please grant camera permissions in the device settings menu.
poi_sub_desc_placeholder: Enter the origin, history, or background of this place here.
poi_sub_email_desc: You need a linked email to nominate a PokéStop. Link a Google account in Settings or update your Facebook account with your email to proceed.
poi_sub_failed_error: Nomination submission failed. Please try again.
poi_sub_gallery_permission_desc: To submit a PokéStop nomination using your image gallery, please grant relevant permissions in your device’s settings menu.
poi_sub_guideline_details: Please choose accessible locations, make sure your photos don't include people or animals, and submit detailed titles and descriptions.
poi_sub_help_desc_1: A great PokéStop Photo Disc is high quality, clear, compelling, and descriptive. The photo should show the location clearly, be in focus, and be free of visual obstructions, people, and animals. You must take the photo yourself for it to be eligible, so please do not use images you’ve found online.
poi_sub_help_desc_2: Submit an additional photo of the area surrounding your nomination. This will help reviewers determine whether the PokéStop location is safe and there is enough space for Trainers to play.
poi_sub_image_time_out: Image upload timed out. Please try again.
poi_sub_limit_reached: Your nomination limit has been reached! New nominations may be available in {0} day(s).
poi_sub_more_info_desc: Explain why you believe your PokéStop nomination is important and what Trainers will see there. Effectively communicating these points will help reviewers evaluate your nomination and understand its value.
poi_sub_more_info_placeholder: Enter additional supporting information, which will only be seen by reviewers, here.
poi_sub_more_info_title: Show Why Your Nomination Is Important
poi_sub_nominations_regen: More nominations may be available in {0} day(s).
poi_sub_nominations_zero: You have no nominations at this time.
poi_sub_photo_prev_desc: This photo will be used for your PokéStop nomination.
poi_sub_surrounding_img_desc: This photo will be used to help assess the surrounding area.
poi_sub_title_placeholder: Enter a unique, detailed title here.
poi_sub_tut_desc_1: A PokéStop is an in-game location that encourages Trainers to go outside, discover new places, and connect with people in the community. PokéStops usually contain some kind of civic, educational, or artistic value, whether it’s a cool piece of art or a hidden gem that only the locals know.
poi_sub_tut_desc_2: Submit a name, description, and photo of the location you’ve selected. Your nominated PokéStop will then be reviewed by other Niantic players, so please be thorough and accurate!
poi_sub_tut_desc_3: PokéStops should have educational and cultural value, and their locations should be safe and accessible to pedestrians. Avoid nominating locations at private residences, locations that are seasonal or nonpermanent, or locations that could interfere with emergency service vehicles.
poi_sub_tut_desc_4: Write a concise title and a detailed description of your nominated PokéStop. The title should be an official name when possible. The description should include the history, cultural significance, or educational value of your location. Write the title and description yourself and please do not copy from other resources.
poi_sub_tut_title_2: How Do I Nominate a PokéStop?
poi_submission_success_desc: Thank you for your nomination. You will receive an email with details shortly.
poi_toast_title_desc_badword: Input may not contain URLs, game-specific references, or other disallowed content.
poi_x_submissions_left: You have {0} nomination(s). New nominations may be available in {1} day(s).

pokemon_desc_0001: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
pokemon_desc_0002: There is a bud on this Pokémon's back. To support its weight, Ivysaur's legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it's a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
pokemon_desc_0003: There is a large flower on Venusaur's back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.
pokemon_desc_0003_0169_2: In battle, this Pokémon swings around two thick vines. If these vines slammed into a 10-story building, they could easily topple it.
pokemon_desc_0004: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
pokemon_desc_0005: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
pokemon_desc_0006: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
pokemon_desc_0006_0178_2: This colossal, flame-winged figure of a Charizard was brought about by Gigantamax energy.
pokemon_desc_0007: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
pokemon_desc_0008: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon's toughness as a battler.
pokemon_desc_0009: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
pokemon_desc_0009_0187_2: It’s not very good at precision shooting. When attacking, it just fires its 31 cannons over and over and over.
pokemon_desc_0010: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
pokemon_desc_0011: The shell covering this Pokémon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
pokemon_desc_0012: Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
pokemon_desc_0012_0959_2: Crystallized Gigantamax energy makes up this Pokémon’s blindingly bright and highly toxic scales.
pokemon_desc_0013: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
pokemon_desc_0014: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
pokemon_desc_0015: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.
pokemon_desc_0016: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
pokemon_desc_0017: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
pokemon_desc_0018: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0019: Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
pokemon_desc_0019_0046: Night after night, they sneak into people's homes seeking food. A massive outbreak of them has become an issue of public concern.
pokemon_desc_0020: Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
pokemon_desc_0020_0048: It commands a nest of Rattata. Different nests don't get along, whipping up severe fights over feeding grounds.
pokemon_desc_0021: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
pokemon_desc_0022: Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
pokemon_desc_0023: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
pokemon_desc_0024: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crushing embrace is impossible.
pokemon_desc_0025: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.
pokemon_desc_0025_0598_2: Its Gigantamax power expanded, forming its supersized body and towering tail.
pokemon_desc_0026: If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon's nest.
pokemon_desc_0026_0050: When you rub its cheeks, a sweet fragrance comes wafting out. However, you'll also get a light shock!
pokemon_desc_0027: Sandshrew's body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.
pokemon_desc_0027_0052: The skin on its back is as hard as steel. Predators go after its soft belly, so it clings to the ground desperately.
pokemon_desc_0028: Sandslash's body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.
pokemon_desc_0028_0054: A long, long time ago, it lived in the desert. With its sharp claws fully extended, it can climb right up an iceberg without slipping.
pokemon_desc_0029: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
pokemon_desc_0030: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
pokemon_desc_0031: Nidoqueen's body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
pokemon_desc_0032: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon's notice.
pokemon_desc_0033: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
pokemon_desc_0034: Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
pokemon_desc_0035: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
pokemon_desc_0036: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
pokemon_desc_0037: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
pokemon_desc_0037_0056: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their –58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
pokemon_desc_0038: Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe's mind. This Pokémon is said to live for a thousand years.
pokemon_desc_0038_0058: Some said that deities visited mountains where Ninetales live, so in times long past, no one was allowed to go into those mountains.
pokemon_desc_0039: Jigglypuff's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
pokemon_desc_0040: Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokémon's eyes, it is quickly washed away.
pokemon_desc_0041: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.
pokemon_desc_0042: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
pokemon_desc_0043: During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
pokemon_desc_0044: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
pokemon_desc_0045: Vileplume's toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That's why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
pokemon_desc_0046: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
pokemon_desc_0047: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
pokemon_desc_0048: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
pokemon_desc_0049: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
pokemon_desc_0050: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
pokemon_desc_0050_0060: The need to dig through volcanic rock in the ground has made them more powerful than the Diglett of other regions.
pokemon_desc_0051: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
pokemon_desc_0051_0062: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
pokemon_desc_0052: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
pokemon_desc_0052_0063_2: The pattern that has appeared on its giant coin is thought to be the key to unlocking the secrets of the Dynamax phenomenon.
pokemon_desc_0052_0064: A royal house that flourished in the distant past brought it here from another region. Meowth is both selfish and prideful.
pokemon_desc_0052_2335: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
pokemon_desc_0053: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
pokemon_desc_0053_0066: Its round face is a symbol of wealth. Persian that have bigger, plumper faces are considered more beautiful.
pokemon_desc_0054: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
pokemon_desc_0055: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. This Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
pokemon_desc_0056: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
pokemon_desc_0057: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
pokemon_desc_0058: Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokémon won't forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.
pokemon_desc_0058_2792: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
pokemon_desc_0059: Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this Pokémon's body is its source of power.
pokemon_desc_0059_2793: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
pokemon_desc_0060: Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokémon's spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
pokemon_desc_0061: The surface of Poliwhirl's body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
pokemon_desc_0062: Although it’s skilled in a style of dynamic swimming that uses all its muscles, for some reason it lives on dry land.
pokemon_desc_0063: Abra sleeps for 18 hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
pokemon_desc_0064: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0065: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
pokemon_desc_0066: Machop's muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
pokemon_desc_0067: Machoke's thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
pokemon_desc_0068: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
pokemon_desc_0068_0815_2: The Gigantamax energy coursing through its arms makes its punches hit as hard as bomb blasts.
pokemon_desc_0069: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
pokemon_desc_0070: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
pokemon_desc_0071: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
pokemon_desc_0072: Tentacool's body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
pokemon_desc_0073: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokémon's outburst creates rough waves around it.
pokemon_desc_0074: The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this Pokémon's heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
pokemon_desc_0074_0068: Geodude compete against each other with headbutts. The iron sand on their heads will stick to whichever one has stronger magnetism.
pokemon_desc_0075: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokémon eats its way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
pokemon_desc_0075_0070: Graveler's entire body is tinged with electricity due to the stones it likes to eat. It's very quick-tempered.
pokemon_desc_0076: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
pokemon_desc_0076_0072: It shoots large rocks that are charged with electricity. Tremendous electric shocks are flung out across the whole area of impact.
pokemon_desc_0077: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
pokemon_desc_0077_2336: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon’s horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.
pokemon_desc_0078: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
pokemon_desc_0078_2337: Little can stand up to its psycho cut. Unleashed from this Pokémon’s horn, the move will punch a hole right through a thick metal sheet.
pokemon_desc_0079: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
pokemon_desc_0079_2582: Although this Pokémon is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke's diet.
pokemon_desc_0080: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
pokemon_desc_0080_2583: A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0081: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
pokemon_desc_0082: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0083: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
pokemon_desc_0083_2338: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.
pokemon_desc_0084: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
pokemon_desc_0085: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokémon if it's being wary—it may decide to peck you.
pokemon_desc_0086: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
pokemon_desc_0087: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
pokemon_desc_0088: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
pokemon_desc_0088_0074: Brought to Alola to solve the garbage problem, Grimer seems to relish any and all kinds of trash.
pokemon_desc_0089: From Muk's body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokémon's body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
pokemon_desc_0089_0076: What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so don't get too close.
pokemon_desc_0090: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
pokemon_desc_0091: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
pokemon_desc_0092: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
pokemon_desc_0093: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
pokemon_desc_0094: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
pokemon_desc_0094_1044_2: Rumor has it that its gigantic mouth leads not into its body, filled with cursed energy, but instead directly to the afterlife.
pokemon_desc_0095: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
pokemon_desc_0096: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
pokemon_desc_0097: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
pokemon_desc_0098: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
pokemon_desc_0099: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.
pokemon_desc_0099_0873_2: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokémon’s left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
pokemon_desc_0100: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.
pokemon_desc_0100_2728: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
pokemon_desc_0101: Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.
pokemon_desc_0101_2735: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
pokemon_desc_0102: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
pokemon_desc_0103: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.
pokemon_desc_0103_0078: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself dizzy, too.
pokemon_desc_0104: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
pokemon_desc_0105: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokémon's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
pokemon_desc_0105_0080: When it beats opponents with its bone, the cursed flames spread to them. No amount of water will stop those flames from burning.
pokemon_desc_0106: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
pokemon_desc_0107: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
pokemon_desc_0108: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
pokemon_desc_0109: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pokémon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
pokemon_desc_0110: Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
pokemon_desc_0110_0944: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
pokemon_desc_0111: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This Pokémon may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
pokemon_desc_0112: Rhydon's horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokémon's hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don't leave a scratch.
pokemon_desc_0113: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokemon_desc_0114: Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
pokemon_desc_0115: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokémon's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.
pokemon_desc_0116: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
pokemon_desc_0117: Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this Pokémon's poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
pokemon_desc_0118: Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokémon with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don't let your guard down around this Pokémon—it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
pokemon_desc_0119: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokémon's body coloration is at its most beautiful.
pokemon_desc_0120: Staryu's center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
pokemon_desc_0121: Starmie's center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
pokemon_desc_0122: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
pokemon_desc_0122_2339: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.
pokemon_desc_0123: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokemon_desc_0124: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
pokemon_desc_0125: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
pokemon_desc_0126: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
pokemon_desc_0127: Pinsir is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This Pokémon's movements turn sluggish in cold places.
pokemon_desc_0128: This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokemon_desc_0128_3006: This Pokémon has a muscular body and excels at close-quarters combat. It uses its short horns to strike the opponent’s weak spots.
pokemon_desc_0128_3007: When heated by fire energy, its horns can get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Those gored by them will suffer both wounds and burns.
pokemon_desc_0128_3008: This Pokémon blasts water from holes on the tips of its horns—the high-pressure jets pierce right through Tauros’s enemies.
pokemon_desc_0129: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokemon_desc_0130: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokémon's wildly violent nature.
pokemon_desc_0131: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
pokemon_desc_0131_0322_2: Over 5,000 people can ride on its shell at once. And it’s a very comfortable ride, without the slightest shaking or swaying.
pokemon_desc_0132: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.
pokemon_desc_0133: Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokémon to evolve.
pokemon_desc_0133_1092_2: Gigantamax energy upped the fluffiness of the fur around Eevee’s neck. The fur will envelop a foe, capturing its body and captivating its mind.
pokemon_desc_0134: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the ability to freely control water.
pokemon_desc_0135: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
pokemon_desc_0136: Flareon's fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokémon's body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_0137: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
pokemon_desc_0138: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
pokemon_desc_0139: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
pokemon_desc_0140: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.
pokemon_desc_0141: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
pokemon_desc_0142: Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
pokemon_desc_0143: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
pokemon_desc_0143_0199_2: Gigantamax energy has affected stray seeds and even pebbles that got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow to a huge size.
pokemon_desc_0144: Articuno is a Legendary Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
pokemon_desc_0144_2801: Its feather-like blades are composed of psychic energy and can shear through thick iron sheets as if they were paper.
pokemon_desc_0144_g: Its feather-like blades are composed of psychic energy and can shear through thick iron sheets as if they were paper.
pokemon_desc_0145: Zapdos is a Legendary Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
pokemon_desc_0145_2800: When its feathers rub together, they produce a crackling sound like the zapping of electricity. That’s why this Pokémon is called Zapdos.
pokemon_desc_0145_g: When its feathers rub together, they produce a crackling sound like the zapping of electricity. That’s why this Pokémon is called Zapdos.
pokemon_desc_0146: Moltres is a Legendary Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
pokemon_desc_0146_2799: This Pokémon’s sinister, flame-like aura will consume the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.
pokemon_desc_0146_g: This Pokémon’s sinister, flame-like aura will consume the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.
pokemon_desc_0147: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
pokemon_desc_0148: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
pokemon_desc_0149: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
pokemon_desc_0150: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon's body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.
pokemon_desc_0151: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
pokemon_desc_0152: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
pokemon_desc_0153: Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
pokemon_desc_0154: The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
pokemon_desc_0155: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
pokemon_desc_0156: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
pokemon_desc_0157: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
pokemon_desc_0157_2786: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui’s center.
pokemon_desc_0158: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
pokemon_desc_0159: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
pokemon_desc_0160: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
pokemon_desc_0161: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
pokemon_desc_0162: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
pokemon_desc_0163: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth's rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
pokemon_desc_0164: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
pokemon_desc_0165: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid's scent.
pokemon_desc_0166: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as its energy.
pokemon_desc_0167: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web's strands.
pokemon_desc_0168: Ariados's feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokémon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
pokemon_desc_0169: If this Pokémon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it's proof that Crobat has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
pokemon_desc_0170: Chinchou lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This Pokémon flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.
pokemon_desc_0171: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This Pokémon produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
pokemon_desc_0172: Pichu charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0173: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokemon_desc_0174: Igglybuff's vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokémon gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.
pokemon_desc_0175: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
pokemon_desc_0176: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.
pokemon_desc_0177: Natu cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet with this Pokémon's eyes, it will stare back intently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away to safety.
pokemon_desc_0178: Xatu stands rooted and still in one spot all day long. People believe that this Pokémon does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in the future.
pokemon_desc_0179: Mareep's fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
pokemon_desc_0180: Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokemon_desc_0181: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon to send signals back and forth with others far away.
pokemon_desc_0182: When Bellossom gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This Pokémon's dancing is renowned in the southern lands.
pokemon_desc_0183: Marill's oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water's surface, it's a sure indication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.
pokemon_desc_0184: Azumarill's long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pokémon can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
pokemon_desc_0185: Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.
pokemon_desc_0186: The curled hair on Politoed's head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokémon earns from its peers.
pokemon_desc_0187: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
pokemon_desc_0188: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
pokemon_desc_0189: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
pokemon_desc_0190: Aipom's tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokemon_desc_0191: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
pokemon_desc_0192: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
pokemon_desc_0193: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
pokemon_desc_0194: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
pokemon_desc_0194_3009: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
pokemon_desc_0195: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.
pokemon_desc_0196: Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokémon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.
pokemon_desc_0197: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon's waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
pokemon_desc_0198: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
pokemon_desc_0199: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.
pokemon_desc_0199_2584: A combination of toxins and the shock of evolving has increased Shellder’s intelligence to the point that Shellder now controls Slowking.
pokemon_desc_0200: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
pokemon_desc_0201: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
pokemon_desc_0202: If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other's endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. Trainers need to beware of this habit.
pokemon_desc_0203: Girafarig's rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
pokemon_desc_0204: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
pokemon_desc_0205: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell's inside cannot be seen.
pokemon_desc_0206: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
