pokemon_desc_0706_2791: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
pokemon_desc_0707: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
pokemon_desc_0708: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
pokemon_desc_0709: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
pokemon_desc_0710: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
pokemon_desc_0711: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
pokemon_desc_0712: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
pokemon_desc_0713: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
pokemon_desc_0713_2795: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
pokemon_desc_0714: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
pokemon_desc_0715: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
pokemon_desc_0716: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
pokemon_desc_0717: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
pokemon_desc_0718: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
pokemon_desc_0719: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
pokemon_desc_0720: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
pokemon_desc_0720_2652: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
pokemon_desc_0721: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
pokemon_desc_0722: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.
pokemon_desc_0723: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
pokemon_desc_0724: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.
pokemon_desc_0724_2785: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
pokemon_desc_0725: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
pokemon_desc_0726: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it's feeling good. When it isn't feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
pokemon_desc_0727: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
pokemon_desc_0728: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It's quite the acrobatic fighter!
pokemon_desc_0729: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
pokemon_desc_0730: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
pokemon_desc_0731: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
pokemon_desc_0732: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
pokemon_desc_0733: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
pokemon_desc_0734: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
pokemon_desc_0735: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
pokemon_desc_0736: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
pokemon_desc_0737: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.
pokemon_desc_0738: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.
pokemon_desc_0739: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
pokemon_desc_0740: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
pokemon_desc_0741: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
pokemon_desc_0741_2679: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
pokemon_desc_0741_2680: This Oricorio has drunk bright yellow nectar. When it sees someone looking glum, it will try to cheer them up with a dance.
pokemon_desc_0741_2681: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It gets so caught up in its dancing that it sometimes doesn’t hear its Trainer’s orders.
pokemon_desc_0741_2683: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Some dancers use its graceful, elegant dancing as inspiration.
pokemon_desc_0742: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes' movements and make fools of them.
pokemon_desc_0743: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
pokemon_desc_0744: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!
pokemon_desc_0745: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
pokemon_desc_0745_2684: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
pokemon_desc_0745_2685: It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn’t like. It doesn’t seem to mind getting hurt at all—as long as it can finish off its opponent.
pokemon_desc_0745_2686: This strange form is the result of its evolving at dusk. It’s very rare in Alola.
pokemon_desc_0745_midday: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
pokemon_desc_0745_midnight: It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn’t like. It doesn’t seem to mind getting hurt at all—as long as it can finish off its opponent.
pokemon_desc_0746: When it's in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.
pokemon_desc_0746_school: Called “demon of the sea” by some, when Wishiwashi are injured in battle and their numbers dwindle, they become a regular school.
pokemon_desc_0746_solo: When it's in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.
pokemon_desc_0747: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they're cut off. After a good night's sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
pokemon_desc_0748: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn't affect Toxapex in there, so it's very comfortable.
pokemon_desc_0749: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
pokemon_desc_0750: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
pokemon_desc_0751: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
pokemon_desc_0752: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn't watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
pokemon_desc_0753: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
pokemon_desc_0754: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it's dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0755: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.
pokemon_desc_0756: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
pokemon_desc_0757: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn't deal well with Spinda, since it's always reeling.
pokemon_desc_0758: It punishes Salandit that couldn't bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
pokemon_desc_0759: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
pokemon_desc_0760: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.
pokemon_desc_0761: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It's usually a fruitless attempt.
pokemon_desc_0762: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They're quite painful when they smack you!
pokemon_desc_0763: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
pokemon_desc_0764: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
pokemon_desc_0765: Oranguru don't get along with each other, so they're always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.
pokemon_desc_0766: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
pokemon_desc_0767: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
pokemon_desc_0768: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.
pokemon_desc_0769: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
pokemon_desc_0770: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.
pokemon_desc_0771: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you'll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!
pokemon_desc_0772: There's danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
pokemon_desc_0773: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
pokemon_desc_0773_disc: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
pokemon_desc_0773_normal: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
pokemon_desc_0774: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
pokemon_desc_0774_exposed: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
pokemon_desc_0774_meteor: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
pokemon_desc_0775: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
pokemon_desc_0776: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.
pokemon_desc_0777: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!
pokemon_desc_0778: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon's rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.
pokemon_desc_0779: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
pokemon_desc_0779_busted: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.
pokemon_desc_0779_disguised: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
pokemon_desc_0780: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they're in danger, so their moms don't have to worry.
pokemon_desc_0781: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.
pokemon_desc_0782: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.
pokemon_desc_0783: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they're a popular item.
pokemon_desc_0784: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
pokemon_desc_0785: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
pokemon_desc_0786: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
pokemon_desc_0787: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula'ula controls plants.
pokemon_desc_0788: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
pokemon_desc_0789: Whether or not it's a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it's in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
pokemon_desc_0790: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
pokemon_desc_0791: In writings from the distant past, it's called by the name “the beast that devours the sun."
pokemon_desc_0792: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
pokemon_desc_0793: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0794: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
pokemon_desc_0795: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
pokemon_desc_0796: They've been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
pokemon_desc_0797: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
pokemon_desc_0798: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
pokemon_desc_0799: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
pokemon_desc_0800: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn't devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
pokemon_desc_0800_2718: This is its form while it is devouring the light of Solgaleo. It pounces on foes and then slashes them with the claws on its four limbs and back.
pokemon_desc_0800_2719: This is its form while it’s devouring the light of Lunala. It grasps foes in its giant claws and rips them apart with brute force.
pokemon_desc_0801: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
pokemon_desc_0802: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
pokemon_desc_0803: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
pokemon_desc_0804: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
pokemon_desc_0805: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
pokemon_desc_0806: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.
pokemon_desc_0807: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
pokemon_desc_0808: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
pokemon_desc_0809: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
pokemon_desc_0809_2324_2: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
pokemon_desc_0810: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
pokemon_desc_0811: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
pokemon_desc_0812: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
pokemon_desc_0812_0000_2: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom’s stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
pokemon_desc_0813: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.
pokemon_desc_0814: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
pokemon_desc_0815: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
pokemon_desc_0815_0000_2: Infused with Cinderace’s fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
pokemon_desc_0816: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.
pokemon_desc_0817: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
pokemon_desc_0818: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
pokemon_desc_0818_0000_2: Gigantamax Inteleon’s Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
pokemon_desc_0819: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
pokemon_desc_0820: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.
pokemon_desc_0821: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
pokemon_desc_0822: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
pokemon_desc_0823: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
pokemon_desc_0823_0000_2: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
pokemon_desc_0824: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.
pokemon_desc_0825: It barely moves, but it's still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
pokemon_desc_0826: It's famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
pokemon_desc_0826_0000_2: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémon’s intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
pokemon_desc_0827: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
pokemon_desc_0828: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
pokemon_desc_0829: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
pokemon_desc_0830: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
pokemon_desc_0831: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
pokemon_desc_0832: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
pokemon_desc_0833: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
pokemon_desc_0834: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
pokemon_desc_0834_0000_2: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
pokemon_desc_0835: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
pokemon_desc_0836: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
pokemon_desc_0837: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
pokemon_desc_0838: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
pokemon_desc_0839: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_0839_0178_2: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon’s flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_0840: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.
pokemon_desc_0841: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
pokemon_desc_0841_0000_2: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
pokemon_desc_0842: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
pokemon_desc_0842_0000_2: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
pokemon_desc_0843: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
pokemon_desc_0844: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
pokemon_desc_0844_0000_2: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
pokemon_desc_0845: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.
pokemon_desc_0845_gorging: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn't really bothered.
pokemon_desc_0845_gulping: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.
pokemon_desc_0845_regular: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.
pokemon_desc_0846: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.
pokemon_desc_0847: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
pokemon_desc_0848: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
pokemon_desc_0849: When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
pokemon_desc_0849_2463: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.
pokemon_desc_0849_2463_2: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
pokemon_desc_0849_2464: When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
pokemon_desc_0849_2464_2: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
pokemon_desc_0850: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
pokemon_desc_0851: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
pokemon_desc_0851_0000_2: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
pokemon_desc_0852: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
pokemon_desc_0853: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
pokemon_desc_0854: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
pokemon_desc_0854_antique: The swirl pattern in this Pokémon's body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
pokemon_desc_0854_phony: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
pokemon_desc_0855: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
pokemon_desc_0855_antique: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
pokemon_desc_0855_phony: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
pokemon_desc_0856: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
pokemon_desc_0857: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
pokemon_desc_0858: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
pokemon_desc_0858_0000_2: This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
pokemon_desc_0859: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
pokemon_desc_0860: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it's trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
pokemon_desc_0861: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
pokemon_desc_0861_0000_2: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar’s terrain.
pokemon_desc_0862: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
pokemon_desc_0863: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
pokemon_desc_0864: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.
pokemon_desc_0865: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.
pokemon_desc_0866: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
pokemon_desc_0867: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
pokemon_desc_0868: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
pokemon_desc_0869: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
pokemon_desc_0869_0000_2: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon’s body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
pokemon_desc_0869_caramel_swirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a bitter flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_lemon_cream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sour flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_matcha_cream: The moment it evolved, it took on an aromatic flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_mint_cream: The moment it evolved, it took on a refreshing flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_rainbow_swirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a complex flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_ruby_cream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sweet and tart flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_ruby_swirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a mixed flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_salted_cream: The moment it evolved, it took on a salty flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokemon_desc_0869_vanilla_cream: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
pokemon_desc_0870: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.
pokemon_desc_0871: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
pokemon_desc_0872: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
pokemon_desc_0873: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_0874: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
pokemon_desc_0875: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
pokemon_desc_0875_ice: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
pokemon_desc_0875_noice: The ice covering this Pokémon's face has shattered, revealing a slightly worried expression that many people are enamored with.
pokemon_desc_0876: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
pokemon_desc_0876_female: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
pokemon_desc_0876_male: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
pokemon_desc_0877: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
pokemon_desc_0877_full: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
pokemon_desc_0877_hangry: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
pokemon_desc_0878: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
pokemon_desc_0879: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
pokemon_desc_0879_0000_2: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
pokemon_desc_0880: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
pokemon_desc_0881: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
pokemon_desc_0882: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
pokemon_desc_0883: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
pokemon_desc_0884: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
pokemon_desc_0884_0000_2: It’s grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
pokemon_desc_0885: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
pokemon_desc_0886: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
pokemon_desc_0887: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
pokemon_desc_0888: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
pokemon_desc_0888_crowned: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0888_default: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
pokemon_desc_0889: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
pokemon_desc_0889_crowned: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
pokemon_desc_0889_default: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
pokemon_desc_0890: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
pokemon_desc_0891: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
pokemon_desc_0892: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
pokemon_desc_0892_2723_2: People call it the embodiment of rage. It’s said that this Pokémon’s terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.
pokemon_desc_0892_2724_3: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won’t even twitch.
pokemon_desc_0892_rs: It's believed that this Pokémon modeled its fighting style on the flow of a river—sometimes rapid, sometimes calm.
pokemon_desc_0892_ss: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
pokemon_desc_0893: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
pokemon_desc_0894: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
pokemon_desc_0895: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
pokemon_desc_0896: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
pokemon_desc_0897: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.
pokemon_desc_0898: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
pokemon_desc_0898_ice: According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents’ wounds after battle.
pokemon_desc_0898_shadow: It’s said that Calyrex and a Pokémon that had bonded with it ran all across the Galar region to bring green to the wastelands.
pokemon_desc_0899: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
pokemon_desc_0900: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.
pokemon_desc_0901: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
pokemon_desc_0902: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
pokemon_desc_0903: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
pokemon_desc_0904: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
pokemon_desc_0905_2802: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
pokemon_desc_0905_2803: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
pokemon_desc_0906: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
pokemon_desc_0907: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
pokemon_desc_0908: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
pokemon_desc_0909: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
pokemon_desc_0910: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.
pokemon_desc_0911: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.
pokemon_desc_0912: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
pokemon_desc_0913: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
pokemon_desc_0914: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
pokemon_desc_0915: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.
pokemon_desc_0916_2981: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
pokemon_desc_0916_2982: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
pokemon_desc_0917: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.
pokemon_desc_0918: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
pokemon_desc_0919: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
pokemon_desc_0920: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
pokemon_desc_0921: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
pokemon_desc_0922: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
pokemon_desc_0923: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
pokemon_desc_0924: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
pokemon_desc_0925_2983: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
pokemon_desc_0925_2984: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
pokemon_desc_0926: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.
pokemon_desc_0927: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
pokemon_desc_0928: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
pokemon_desc_0929: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
pokemon_desc_0930: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0931_2985: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
pokemon_desc_0931_2986: The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
pokemon_desc_0931_2987: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They’ll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
pokemon_desc_0931_2988: This Pokémon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
pokemon_desc_0932: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
pokemon_desc_0933: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
pokemon_desc_0934: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
pokemon_desc_0935: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
pokemon_desc_0936: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
pokemon_desc_0937: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
pokemon_desc_0938: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
pokemon_desc_0939: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
pokemon_desc_0940: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
pokemon_desc_0941: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
pokemon_desc_0942: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.
pokemon_desc_0943: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
pokemon_desc_0944: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
pokemon_desc_0945: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
pokemon_desc_0946: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0947: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
pokemon_desc_0948: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
pokemon_desc_0949: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
pokemon_desc_0950: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
pokemon_desc_0951: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
pokemon_desc_0952: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
pokemon_desc_0953: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
pokemon_desc_0954: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
pokemon_desc_0955: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
pokemon_desc_0956: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
pokemon_desc_0957: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
pokemon_desc_0958: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
pokemon_desc_0959: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
pokemon_desc_0960: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
pokemon_desc_0961: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
pokemon_desc_0962: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
pokemon_desc_0963: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
pokemon_desc_0964_2989: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
pokemon_desc_0964_2990: This Pokémon’s ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
pokemon_desc_0965: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
pokemon_desc_0966: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
pokemon_desc_0967: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
pokemon_desc_0968: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
pokemon_desc_0969: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
pokemon_desc_0970: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
pokemon_desc_0971: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0972: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
pokemon_desc_0973: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
pokemon_desc_0974: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
pokemon_desc_0975: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
pokemon_desc_0976: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
pokemon_desc_0977: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
pokemon_desc_0978_2991: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
pokemon_desc_0978_2992: This species’ differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
pokemon_desc_0978_2993: Bird Pokémon are its main prey. This Pokémon knows it’s weak, so it hunts with a partner.
pokemon_desc_0979: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
pokemon_desc_0980: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
pokemon_desc_0981: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
pokemon_desc_0982_2994: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
pokemon_desc_0982_2995: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
pokemon_desc_0983: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
pokemon_desc_0984: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
pokemon_desc_0985: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
pokemon_desc_0986: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0987: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
pokemon_desc_0988: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
pokemon_desc_0989: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
pokemon_desc_0990: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.
pokemon_desc_0991: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0992: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
pokemon_desc_0993: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_0994: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.
pokemon_desc_0995: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
pokemon_desc_0996: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
pokemon_desc_0997: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
pokemon_desc_0998: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
pokemon_desc_0999: This Pokémon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
pokemon_desc_1000: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
pokemon_desc_1001: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_1002: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
pokemon_desc_1003: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_1004: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
pokemon_desc_1005: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
pokemon_desc_1006: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
pokemon_desc_1007_2996: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
pokemon_desc_1008_2997: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0003_0001: In order to support its flower, which has grown larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs have become stronger.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0006_0002: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0006_0003: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0009_0001: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0015_0001: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0018_0001: With its muscular strength now greatly increased, it can fly continuously for two weeks without resting.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0065_0001: Having traded away its muscles, Alakazam's true power has been unleashed. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0080_0001: Having been swallowed whole by Shellder, Slowbro now has an iron defense. It's pretty comfortable in there, too.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0094_0001: Mega Evolution has made it possible for Gengar to access other dimensions. Its entire body is brimming with strange power.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0115_0001: When the mother sees the back of her Mega-Evolved child, it makes her think of the day when her child will inevitably leave her.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0127_0001: After Mega Evolution, it becomes able to fly. Perhaps because it's so happy, it rarely touches the ground.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0130_0001: It zooms out of the water at Mach speeds. Even large ships caught in its path are split cleanly in two!
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0142_0001: Mega Evolution awakened some dormant genes, bringing back the sharp rocks that once covered Aerodactyl's entire body.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0150_0002: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint a hundred meters in two seconds flat!
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0150_0003: Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0181_0001: Massive amounts of energy intensely stimulated Ampharos's cells, apparently awakening its long-sleeping dragon's blood.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0208_0001: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth's core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0212_0001: It stores the excess energy from Mega Evolution, so after a long time passes, its body starts to melt.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0214_0001: It can grip things with its two horns and lift 500 times its own body weight.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0229_0001: Houndoom's entire body generates heat when it Mega Evolves. Its fearsome fiery breath turns its opponents to ash.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0248_0001: The effects of Mega Evolution make it more ferocious than ever. It's unclear whether it can even hear its Trainer's orders.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0254_0001: The leaves growing on Sceptile's body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0257_0001: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémon's wrists burn.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0260_0001: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0282_0001: Gardevoir has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its Trainer, this Pokémon is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0302_0001: It blocks any and all attacks with its giant-sized gemstone. However, the stone's a heavy burden, and it limits Mega Sableye's movements.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0303_0001: Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0306_0001: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pokémon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0308_0001: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémon hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0310_0001: Too much electricity has built up in its body, irritating Manectric. Its explosive speed is equal to that of a lightning bolt.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0319_0001: The moment it charges into its opponent, sharp spikes pop out of Sharpedo's head, leaving its opponent with deep wounds.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0323_0001: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémon's back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0334_0001: Altaria dances and wheels through the sky among billowing, cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear voice, this Pokémon makes its listeners experience dreamy wonderment.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0354_0001: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0359_0001: Normally, it dislikes fighting, so it really hates changing to this form for battles.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0362_0001: When it spews stupendously cold air from its broken mouth, the entire area around it gets whited out.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0373_0001: It puts its forelegs inside its shell to streamline itself for flight. Salamence flies at high speeds over all kinds of topographical features.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0376_0001: Its intellect surpasses its previous level, resulting in battles so cruel, they'll make you want to cover your eyes.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0380_0001: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0381_0001: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent and understands human speech.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0382_0001: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0383_0001: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0384_0001: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0428_0001: Mega Evolution awakens its combative instincts. It has shed any fur that got in the way of its attacks.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0445_0001: Its arms and wings melted into something like scythes. Mad with rage, it rampages on and on.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0448_0001: Its aura has expanded due to Mega Evolution. Governed only by its combative instincts, it strikes enemies without mercy.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0460_0001: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0475_0001: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0531_0001: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
pokemon_desc_tmpevo_0719_0001: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

The GO Transporter requires GO Transporter Energy to send Pokémon to Pokémon HOME. GO Transporter Energy charges over time. Tap here to learn more about sending Pokémon to Pokémon HOME.
pokemon_ibfc_desc_0877: This Pokémon will transform when it uses a Charged Attack. When in Hangry Mode, Aura Wheel changes to a Dark-type attack.
