quest_special_dialogue_bagon_0_1: I was totally absorbed in my investigation of a most curious phenomenon in the area. Maybe you’ve noticed it yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_0_2: You know—the large boulders all over and the pieces of rock that look like they were broken off?
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_0_3: Perhaps you can help put some fire to all the smoke. Would you mind canvassing the area and letting me know if you find anything noteworthy?
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_1_0: Aha! Looks like Bagon, the Rock Head Pokémon, is responsible for the recent rocky wreckage.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_1_1: Bagon aspire to one day soar through the sky. As if trying to dispel their frustration over their inability to do so, they slam their hard heads against huge rocks, shattering them into pebbles.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_1_2: In fact, there are some theories that suggest this head-bashing behavior stimulates cells that affect their evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_1_3: Fascinating, isn’t it? Let’s test the theories out and evolve a Bagon!
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_2_0: And what have we here, %PLAYERNAME%? Well, well, it’s Shelgon, the Endurance Pokémon! Excellent work.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_2_1: Shelgon’s shell is iron-hard and repels enemy attacks. When it’s waiting to evolve, it often hides away in a cavern.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_2_2: And while it’s shut up in its shell, I hear it still dreams of the day it’ll be able to fly.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_2_3: Why don’t we give your Shelgon a helping hand to see what new heights—literally—it can reach?
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_3_0: Impressive! You helped Shelgon’s dreams come true!
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_3_1: Salamence are overjoyed that they can finally take wing. They fly all over the place and usually don’t land until they’re completely exhausted and need to sleep.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_3_2: I must say, this does open up all kinds of questions about what else Dragon-type Pokémon are capable of. It’s really inspiring.
quest_special_dialogue_bagon_3_3: And while I don’t recommend you bang your head into rocks to make your dreams come true, I’m sure the sky’s the limit for you too, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_battle_weekend_1_: Where will you focus your efforts, Pokémon Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_0_0: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! Have you happened to do any exploring today?
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_0_1: It’s quite the sight, let me tell you! It’s lousy with Bellsprout out there!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_0_2: They tend to prefer hot and humid places, but right now they seem to be everywhere.
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_0_3: And you know, there’s still plenty for us to learn about the Flower Pokémon. Would you be a pal and catch one for us to study?
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. And what a great specimen you’ve brought!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_1_1: Did you know that despite their slender frames, they can move lightning fast to catch insects? One more reason to be glad we’re not bugs!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_1_2: But there’s more for us to learn about this fascinating Pokémon! Drop by again after you’ve evolved your Bellsprout into Weepinbell.
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_1_3: I’ll leaf through my Weepinbell research notes so I’m ready for you when you get back!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_2_0: Hey now, that’s got to be the Weepinbell of the ball! Let me take a closer look.
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_2_1: Aha! You see that large hook on its rear end? Weepinbell tend to use that to hook themselves on tree branches when they sleep.
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_2_2: In other words, if you see your Weepinbell yawning, find it a tree on the double!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_2_3: But there’s no time for us to be snoozing. How about you evolve Weepinbell into a Victreebel and bring it back here?
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_3_0: Hey, you’re victree-orious! Vic-tree...riffic? Ahem. Let’s have a look at your Victreebell, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_3_1: These large, plant-like Pokémon live in huge colonies, deep within the jungle. No one who’s visited has returned to tell the tale. That’s sure foreboding!
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_3_2: Although if I put my professor cap on and think about it, how do we know about the colonies unless someone DID make it back?
quest_special_dialogue_bellsprout_3_3: There’s something to ponder! In the meantime, thanks for letting me observe your Victreebel. I’m sure you’ll be fast friends in no time—just watch out for that prey-dissolving acid!
quest_special_dialogue_bidoof_branch_que: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Just who I wanted to see. I just received a unique research request regarding a particular Pokémon, and I think you’re the perfect Trainer to help me with it.
Let’s warm up with a few tasks first, and then we can dive into the meat of it!
Welcome back, Trainer. I have a few more details to share about the research request I received.
A favorite of new and experienced Trainers alike, Bidoof, the Plump Mouse Pokémon, has been appearing more often of late. Intriguing, no?
Now, before we continue, I have a very important choice for you to make. Will you focus your research on Bidoof or the Plump Mouse Pokémon?
Is this a trick question? Who could say! My only advice is to follow your heart. Besides, it’s hard to go wrong when Bidoof is your only option!
Great choice, Trainer! For some reason, I just knew you’d pick Bidoof. Don’t ask me how!
Bidoof is known for its two large front teeth. Much like Rattata’s teeth, Bidoof’s teeth are continually growing.
Speaking of teeth, I have a few tasks that you can sink yours into now!
Wonderful choice, Trainer! I had a feeling you’d pick the Plump Mouse Pokémon. Don’t ask me why!

Otherwise known as Bidoof, this Normal-type Pokémon is far from ordinary! While only about a foot tall, Bidoof is powerful. It can chew through boulders with its incisors—a feat that makes my jaw hurt to even think about.

Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. Hopefully you got a few good snapshots of Bidoof while conducting your research! I always enjoy seeing the snapshots Trainers take of Pokémon, and I can never get enough of Bidoof!
Now—according to the research request we received, we must choose to focus our efforts on a Pokémon that has nerves of steel or a Pokémon that nests alongside water.
I know what you’re thinking: choosing between Bidoof and Bidoof isn’t easy. But, then again, the most important research rarely is!
You’re going with Bidoof, huh? I like your style, %PLAYERNAME%.
Bidoof isn’t just cute to look at—it’s more agile and active than it appears! Nothing can perturb it, making it an excellent member of your team.
I think we could all learn from that steadiness. Channel your inner Bidoof so you can steel your nerves, too!
You choose Bidoof, eh? I never doubted it for a second.
Bidoof often live in groups by the water where they make their nests. I recall that Bibarel, Bidoof’s Evolution, makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud.
A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby. Fascinating, don’t you think?
Thank you, %PLAYERNAME%, for assisting me with this special assignment. I think we all learned that there’s more than meets the eye when it comes to Pokémon—especially Bidoof!

As a thank-you for your hard work, the team leaders and I prepared a gift for you to help show the world your love and knowledge of the indelible Bidoof. I hope you wear it with the pride it deserves.
Why don’t you put it on and enjoy a nice walk with your Bidoof? You never know what you might discover! Now, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_0: Phase one, Razz Berry documentation: complete. Phase two, Pinap Berries.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_1: Ah. %PLAYERNAME%. My apologies—I didn’t see you there. I’ve been preoccupied with completing my latest research report.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_2: Early findings are promising, and I’m eager to discuss the results with Professor Willow.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_3: But I must admit I’m having the slightest difficulty sourcing materials for the next step.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_4: I’ve been so absorbed that I haven’t found a moment to shoo off the Team GO Rocket Grunts nearby. What’s more, they appear to have increased in number.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_5: Nevertheless, these are my issues to resolve. What can I help you with today? It’s rare for you to stop by.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_6: Professor Willow suggested you check on me? Well, I appreciate the thought, but it’s quite unnecessary.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_0_7: Everything is under control here, so please, feel free to focus on your own studies. Now, where to source additional Berries...
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_0: Hm? I’m certain these Pinap Berries weren’t here earlier. And you’ve returned, %PLAYERNAME%? Then I suppose this was your doing.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_1: You didn’t need to trouble yourself, but this does take one thing off my to-do list. Curious about how I’ll use them?
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_2: As you may know, my field of study includes Pokémon Evolution.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_3: I’m currently investigating whether feeding a Pokémon various Berries immediately prior to it evolving has any influence on its physiology.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_4: Speaking of which, the next step of this project is to see a Pokémon evolve. I’ll need to be on my way so I can locate one that’s ready.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_1_5: Let’s continue our discussion another time, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_0: Did it occur to you to evolve your Pokémon because of what I said earlier, %PLAYERNAME%? Thank you.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_1: You’ve saved me quite a bit of time. I now have just about everything I need to get back on track.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_2: The end goal of my research? To learn more about Pokémon, of course. There’s no end to that endeavor, as Professor Willow might say.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_3: On a personal level, I’d be satisfied if my research led to more insight on Lapras.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_4: Lapras are able to understand human speech and are very intelligent. Their intellect and good nature are why I have one as my partner Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_5: Yet to the best of our knowledge, they do not evolve. I’d like to understand why.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_6: I’ve been working on hypotheses as to why some Pokémon are able to evolve while others are not, but that is a far longer-term project.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_2_7: Perhaps I speak from a place of bias, but I think you’d do well to have a Lapras accompany you on your travels too, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_3_0: I hope you and Lapras make all manner of discoveries together, %PLAYERNAME%—just like the discoveries you’ve helped me make today.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_3_1: Thanks to your timely assistance, I can share my report far earlier than I initially anticipated.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_3_2: You’ve shown me today why Professor Willow always calls you his hero.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_3_3: You’re an observant friend and Trainer who has a knack for sensing when others are in need, even if they don’t see it themselves.
quest_special_dialogue_blanche_apr23_3_4: I suppose that makes you my hero too, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_0_0: What a pleasure to see you, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_0_1: Go ahead and take a deep breath in! Smell that sweet scent wafting in the air?
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_0_2: There’s no deceiving a Pokémon Professor’s nose! That lovely aroma’s all the proof we need that the Grass-type Bounsweet must be nearby. And in great numbers, by the scent of it!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_0_3: Now go on, follow your nose! Try and bring a Bounsweet back so we can study it!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_1_0: I’d recognize that smell of success a mile away, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve happened on a bounty of Bounsweet!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_1_1: Here’s a fact: we’re not the only ones interested in Bounsweet. Bird Pokémon are always after them, too!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_1_2: One fact isn’t enough for you? Well, did you know that Bounsweet secrete a sweet—and delicious—sweat? Now you do! I sure wish I smelled that good!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_1_3: Ahem. In any event, why don’t you head out and catch some more so we can keep our sweet new friends safe?
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_2_1: Now that we’re acquainted with the delightful Bounsweet, let’s familiarize ourselves with its Evolution, Steenee.
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_2_2: Keep a sharp eye out for a Steenee performing its signature twirl. When they spin like that, they’re spreading their amazing scent far and wide.
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_2_3: Just a whiff will give you a surge of happiness, in fact. So what are you waiting for, %PLAYERNAME%? We’ve got joy to...well, enjoy!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_3_1: But make sure you keep your guard up!
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_3_2: Tsareena’s kick can hit hard enough to take out even the toughest kickboxing champ.
quest_special_dialogue_bounsweet_3_3: Anyhow, thanks for all the assists today, %PLAYERNAME%. Stay sharp and keep well out of kicking distance!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_0_0: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! Look around—have you ever seen so many Bulbasaur?
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_0_1: Personally, I’ve only witnessed a gathering like this once before. It was some time ago, and there were so many Trainers out and about catching all the little Seed Pokémon they could find.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_0_2: In fact, seeing all these Bulbasaur has me feeling quite nostalgic!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_0_3: It also reminded me of an important scientific tenet: there’s always more to learn! And I never tire of researching Pokémon, no matter the species.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_0_4: In that spirit, what do you say we do some research on Bulbasaur, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_0: Welcome back, Trainer. That’s a downright adorable Bulbasaur you’ve caught!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_1: Did you know that Bulbasaur uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back to grow?
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_2: I’d love to have a built-in snack backpack. It would keep my stomach quiet in the field, that’s for sure! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_3: As you may know, Bulbasaur’s Evolution—Ivysaur—gains strength when it’s exposed to sunlight.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_4: That sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger. It would be lovely to witness that phenomenon myself, for old time’s sake.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_1_5: While you go off and evolve your Bulbasaur, I’ll continue following this pack of Bulbasaur I’ve been observing. They appear to be on the move!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_2_0: Goodness me, look at the size of that Ivysaur! Well done, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_2_1: If memory serves, the bud on Ivysaur’s back produces a sweet aroma when it starts to swell, indicating the flower’s about to bloom.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_2_2: Have you gotten a whiff of that scent yet? If you do, your Ivysaur may be getting ready to evolve!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_2_3: Now, remember that pack of Bulbasaur I was following? A handful of Ivysaur have recently emerged from a nearby forest to join them.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_2_4: They all seem to be heading in the same direction... But what’s their destination, I wonder? Let’s go see if we can’t dig up some answers, hm?
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_0: Welcome back %PLAYERNAME%. Hold on—is that a Venusaur with you?! It must be my lucky day.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_1: You see, the Bulbasaur and Ivysaur I was following led me to a grove where a Venusaur was resting. There was an unusual scent in the air that seemed to calm the Pokémon that had gathered.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_2: I’ve read that Venusaur sometimes produces a scent that attracts other Pokémon, so I surmised that’s what was occurring.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_3: In fact, the way the Bulbasaur and Ivysaur gathered around Venusaur reminded me of how Lure Modules work to attract Pokémon via scent.
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_4: Now, let’s talk Venusaur. Did you know it can Mega Evolve?
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_5: Take this Venusaur Mega Energy and try Mega Evolving your new friend. You’ll learn more by experiencing Mega Venusaur’s power for yourself!
quest_special_dialogue_bulbt_3_6: There are so many things we can learn from Pokémon, and researching them can lead us to even more exciting discoveries. I hope you enjoyed yourself during today’s scientific excursion!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%, you’ve been such a help in conducting Field Research and Special Research!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_0_1: I have a feeling that there’s so much more about this world that we’ve yet to discover, and I’m glad I can count on you to see it through.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_0_2: I’ve been doing some experiments of my own, and I suspect that I’m onto a further exciting discovery about another Mythical Pokémon that’s rarely seen.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_0_3: Would you mind completing these tasks while I conclude my studies?
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_1_0: Wow, you and your Pokémon have some amazing power! But according to my most recent data, it seems that the Mythical Pokémon I’m tracking only appears in times of peace.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_1_1: Also, from what I’ve gathered, it seems fond of forests and lush greens. Would you mind exploring this further, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_2_0: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%! I feel we’re getting closer to this Mythical Pokémon. I wonder if we can find some more friends for it by hatching some Eggs.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_2_1: Ah, and maybe you could put that Sun Stone you’ve earned to good use as well?
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_3_0: Oh wow, is that an Eevee you’ve caught? Perfect timing!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_3_1: Did you know that this Pokémon’s unstable genetic makeup enables it to take on one of several different Evolutions?
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_3_2: I’ll bet if you spend some time with it during the day, you’ll be able to evolve your Eevee into an Espeon—a Psychic-type Pokémon just like the Mythical Pokémon I’m researching!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_4_0: Oh wow, is that an Eevee you’ve caught? Perfect timing!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_4_1: Wait... Have we...had this conversation already? I’m getting a funny feeling in the back of my mind—like we’ve been here before.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_4_2: %PLAYERNAME%, would you spend some time with this Eevee during the night? I think you’ll be able to see an intriguing evolved form as a result.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_4_3: I wonder if this funny feeling will recur...
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_5_0: %PLAYERNAME%, I have some exciting news! That funny feeling hasn’t returned, but I did some important reading and learned that the Mythical Pokémon we’re researching has the ability to travel across time!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_5_1: Maybe that’s why all of this is occurring...or recurring... Maybe this Pokémon is nearby?!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_5_2: I suggest that you collect samples over the course of the next week and experiment with some Evolution items to see whether that feeling occurs again.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_5_3: While you’re at it, do you have any Pinap Berries? My research could benefit from more data on their use. Return with that, and you can have these exotic Silver Pinap Berries!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_6_0: This data is so helpful. Thank you! I’ll use it to explore my theory.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_6_1: While you were in the field, I made more headway in learning about this Mythical Pokémon, and it seems that its mere presence causes grass and trees to flourish.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_6_2: I think if you catch more Grass-type Pokémon, this elusive time-traveling Pokémon will reveal itself!
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_7_0: %PLAYERNAME%, what an amazing experience! The appearance of the Mythical Pokémon Celebi is thought to be a sign that a bright and shining future awaits us.
quest_special_dialogue_celebi_7_1: You’ve come a long way in your research, and I must say you’re inspiring me to discover even more Pokémon. Until next time, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_0_0: Ah, %PLAYERNAME%! Just the Trainer I was looking for.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_0_1: So you’ve also noticed the sudden uptick in Chansey roaming around today. It’s rare to see so many of them—they’re usually quite elusive!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_0_2: Did you know Chansey are said to bring happiness to any Trainer lucky enough to catch one?
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_0_3: Perhaps that’s why they’ve gathered—to bring us both an extra helping of happiness!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_0_4: Say, why don’t you try befriending one? With Chansey by your side, I bet joyful things won’t be far behind!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%. You seem happier already!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_1: Have I mentioned that Chansey eggs are both rich in nutrients and extremely delicious? They’re considered quite the high-class ingredient in the culinary world.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_2: Chansey evolve from Happiny, the Playhouse Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_3: Happiny love round white things and are known to carry egg-shaped rocks in imitation of Chansey. They’re much too small to lay their own eggs.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_4: If Happiny gets along well with someone, it will give them its rock. Tell me that isn’t the cutest thing you’ve ever heard!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_1_5: Like Happiny, Chansey can also evolve. Try evolving Chansey—and let me know when you do!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_2_1: Some say only Chansey that share a strong bond with their Trainer can evolve. If that’s true, you should be very proud!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_2_2: Blissey, like Happiny and Chansey, is very kindhearted.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_2_3: Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy fur coat and will rush to the side of the forlorn—no matter how far away they may be—to share an egg of happiness.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_2_4: Eating even one bite will bring a smile to any face.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_2_5: I’m grinning at the thought! And it looks like your Blissey is equally excited to get back out there and spread more happiness. I’ll leave you to it and will see you again in a bit, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_3_0: What blissful buddies you two have become!
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_3_1: I’d say we’ve proven our earlier hypothesis—all these Chansey made today’s research an especially joyous job.
quest_special_dialogue_chansey_3_2: And now that we’re finished, I’m famished. It’s time for me to go encounter an omelet. See you later!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I hope you and your fellow Trainers have been taking care of yourselves. Remember to take a break every now and then to do something you really enjoy! I like to go on short walks, myself.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_1: In fact, I was out for a stroll with my Buddy Pokémon earlier when I heard a strange crackling sound.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_2: Upon further inspection, I realized it was a large group of Charmander gathered in an open field! The source of the noise was the soft crackling of their tail flames.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_3: Seeing so many Charmander at once was highly unusual, though this wasn’t the first time I’ve witnessed such a gathering...
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_4: Well, whatever the reason, this is the perfect chance to learn more about Charmander!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_0_5: Would you mind giving me a hand by catching some, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_chart_1_1: While you were out in the field, I looked through some research focused on Charmander and its Evolutionary line and came away with some interesting information.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_1_2: For starters, Charmander is also known as the Lizard Pokémon and seems to be fond of hot things. You can tell how a Charmander is feeling by looking at the flame burning at the tip of its tail. What a fascinating Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_1_3: Hmmm... Perhaps those Charmander I ran into while walking were gathered to enjoy the sun? We may be able to learn more by evolving one.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_1_4: Charmander’s evolved form is Charmeleon—but be careful when evolving Charmander! Charmeleon is known for its fiery temper!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_2_0: That’s a fine Charmeleon you’ve got with you, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_2_1: Known as the Flame Pokémon, Charmeleon is hotheaded by nature and is constantly seeking out worthy opponents for battle.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_2_2: When it finally encounters a worthy foe, it becomes so excited that the flame at the tip of its tail flares up and turns a bluish-white color.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_2_3: The easiest way to calm a Charmeleon down is by winning a battle. That sure sounds like a certain team leader I know!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_2_4: Now, did you know Charmeleon can evolve? Not only that, but its evolved form, Charizard, is also known as the Flame Pokémon! Come back and see me once you’ve evolved your Charmeleon.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_3_0: Congrats, Trainer! Your Charmeleon has now become the Flame Pokémon Charizard!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_3_1: Charizard is a truly amazing Pokémon. Its wings can carry it close to an altitude of 4,600 feet, and its fiery breath packs such great heat that it can melt almost anything!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_3_2: While all that raw power seems intimidating, Charizard never turns its flames on any opponent weaker than itself.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_3_3: What a superb display of control! It’s amazing to see how this Pokémon chooses to take on only the mightiest of opponents!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_3_4: They say the key to a successful partnership is a powerful bond, Trainer, so why not celebrate by spending a little time with your new Charizard?
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_0: I can see you’re really putting an effort into strengthening the bond between you and your Pokémon, %PLAYERNAME%. Did you know that that bond can become a source of power for certain Pokémon? That’s right—I’m talking about Mega Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_1: Mega Evolution is the result of a strong connection between a Pokémon and its Trainer. Charizard is unique not only because it can Mega Evolve but also because it has two different Mega-Evolved forms!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_2: Its two Mega Evolutions, Mega Charizard X and Mega Charizard Y, each come with their own strengths.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_3: It’s said that the overwhelming power dwelling within Mega Charizard X is so intense that it turns its body black and causes blue flames to spill from its mouth.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_4: Other research suggests that Mega Charizard Y uses its bond with its Trainer as the source of its power, resulting in speed and maneuverability greater than that of a fighter jet’s.
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_5: Simply amazing! I can’t wait to see how Trainers use these Mega Evolutions in their Gym battle strategies!
quest_special_dialogue_chart_4_6: Thanks again for your help, %PLAYERNAME%. I’ll be in touch as soon as I have more exciting research to share!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Watch your step, there are—ow—broken rocks all over today.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_0_1: I’ve been too occupied sweeping them up to find the cause, so I’m hoping you can help me figure out where they’ve come from. As with most odd occurrences, I suspect a Pokémon may be behind this.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_0_2: Speaking of odd occurrences, I saw a shooting star last night! There’ve been more and more of them lately—always beautiful sights. Maybe some of these rocks are bits of meteor!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_0_3: Anyway, I won’t keep you, %PLAYERNAME%. Go see what Pokémon are out today, and think about which ones might be inclined to shatter rocks.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Judging by the Pokémon you’ve caught, I’m guessing you think Chespin’s the cause of the broken rocks.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_1_1: You know what they say: “If the shell fits!” You know, when Chespin flex the quills on their heads, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_1_2: Pretty impressive, considering that the quills are usually soft.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_1_3: And speaking of the wooden shell on its head—that thing’s so thick that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze Chespin!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_1_4: Luckily for us, they’re good-natured Pokémon...even if they might have been having some fun with the local boulders. Help Chespin evolve and I’ll tell you more, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_2_0: Well done! That’s a strong-looking Quilladin, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_2_1: See how the shape of its shell has changed? It relies on that sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks, and then counterattacks with sharp quills.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_2_2: Even so, they are very kind and won’t start fights.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_2_3: It’s a quality that I imagine makes them ideal first partner Pokémon for Trainers starting out in the Kalos region—where Chespin, Quilladin, and Chesnaught were first discovered!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_2_4: Speaking of Chesnaught, how about you help Quilladin evolve so we can observe one ourselves?
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_0: Now that is one fine-looking Chesnaught, %PLAYERNAME%! Great job!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_1: Those quills on its back are bigger than ever, and when it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_2: But just like Quilladin, this strapping Pokémon has a heart of gold. It will even shield its allies from danger with its own body.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_3: Now that’s what I call a reliable partner!
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_4: And I know you’ll look after Chesnaught in turn. That’s just the kind of Trainer you are, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_chespin_3_5: Thanks for spending another exciting day researching Pokémon with me! I’ll be in touch soon!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%, hi! It’s pretty hot out here, don’t you think? The heat must be coming from all the Cyndaquil running about!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_0_1: Are you familiar with it? It’s a Fire-type Pokémon known for its timid nature.
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_0_2: Since they scare easily, they’re usually found curled up in a little ball—and they’ll flare the flames on their backs to protect themselves when attacked!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_0_3: Why don’t you grab a pocket fan to stay cool and try to catch one of these fascinating Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_1_0: That’s quite a Cyndaquil you’ve befriended, %PLAYERNAME%! You’re on fire—er, not literally, thankfully.
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_1_1: Let me reward you with some fun tidbits! Did you know that a Cyndaquil’s flames burn hottest when they’re startled?
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_1_2: And its Evolution, Quilava, will turn its back on opponents just to show off how ferociously its fire blazes!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_1_3: Let’s evolve your Cyndaquil into a Quilava. While I’m not jumping at the idea of making it even hotter around here, I AM eager to study the variance in flame intensity as they evolve.
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_2_0: Amazing work, %PLAYERNAME%! Now, let’s take a closer look at your Quilava. You’re on a hot streak!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_2_1: As I mentioned, Quilava tend to use the heat of their flames to intimidate foes. Those flames burn even stronger when it prepares to fight!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_2_2: Your Quilava seems like a real firebrand! I bet it’ll be even more of a force to be reckoned with once it evolves.
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_2_3: On that note, let’s turn the thermostat up to max—evolve your Quilava into Typhlosion! There’s learning to be had!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_3_0: Oh! I was wondering why I was feeling so toasty, but now I see—you’re back with Typhlosion! Let’s take a moment to marvel at its raw power.
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_3_1: When a Typhlosion’s rage peaks, it gets so hot that it’ll send anything that touches it up in flames!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_3_2: I’m pretty sure my eyebrows are getting singed, but it’s totally worth it for an up-close encounter with such an awe-inspiring Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_cyndaquil_3_3: You never disappoint, %PLAYERNAME%. Until our next adventure—stay cool!
quest_special_dialogue_dailyincense_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I just developed this new type of Incense—Daily Adventure Incense.
quest_special_dialogue_dailyincense_0_1: One Daily Adventure Incense lasts for 15 minutes and stays active only while you’re moving. Most importantly, though, this Incense can attract almost any Pokémon you’ve encountered before—even Legendary Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_dailyincense_0_2: I’ll give you one Daily Adventure Incense each day, so don’t be afraid to go out on some adventures! In fact, why not start one now? Try to catch as many Pokémon as you can!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_0_0: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! We’ve come to the end of the year once again...
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_0_1: And it looks like some familiar Pokémon from earlier this year are reappearing, too!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_0_2: Do you think they’re here to celebrate the year’s end with us?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_0_3: I hope you’ll take a moment to reflect on all the ways you’ve grown and the adventures we had these last 12 months.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_0_4: We achieved the impossible, created legends, and discovered so much about ourselves! Which moment are you most proud of?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. Wow, just look at all the Pokémon you’ve caught! Up for another challenge?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_1_1: Will you evolve a few of them for me? I’d say you’ve evolved plenty yourself, as a Trainer, this year. Especially after all that time with Hoopa.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_1_2: What mischief it made this year—remember when it summoned all those Legendary Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_1_3: The bond between Trainer and Pokémon can change so much more than just a Pokémon’s appearance.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_1_4: Just something to think about as you evolve your Pokémon today!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_2_0: With a new year just around the corner, I can’t help but look back. What can we learn from the histories of places, Pokémon, and our fellow Trainers?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_2_1: That reminds me—have you heard about the strange door I found recently? I have a feeling we’re in for quite an adventure!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_2_2: I wonder what mysteries hide behind that door. What can this relic tell us about the past—and our shared future...?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_2_3: Sorry, where were we? Ah, yes! Be sure to catch lots of Pokémon, study how they evolve, and maybe work on improving your Poké Ball throws, too. Let’s end the year awash in new knowledge!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_3_0: You’ve made it to the end, %PLAYERNAME%! Here’s a reward for all your hard work. Consider it a token of my gratitude as well, for all you’ve done for me this year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2021_3_1: I look forward to our adventures together next year! Are you ready? Then let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_0: Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! Great to see you! I always feel a little nostalgic at the end of the year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_1: So I thought we could look back on everything we’ve done over the last twelve months.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_2: For starters, you’ve been putting that Daily Adventure Incense to great use... You’ve encountered Zorua and been caught up in Ditto's shenanigans...
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_3: And that’s just the beginning! Doesn’t remembering your accomplishments get you energized for more?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_4: It does for me, and maybe Pokémon are feeling energized by the season too—look how many are out there today!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_5: I wonder if Pokémon perceive time like we do? Hmm... This could be a good topic for next year’s World Pokémon Ecological Society conference.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_0_6: As for you, you should go for a stroll and think about all the amazing things you’ve done, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_0: You’ve brought a jolly bunch of Pokémon with you, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_1: Seeing all of them gets me thinking—remember how lucky we were to meet so many Pokémon first discovered in the Alola region?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_2: We even encountered all of the island guardians! I’d never seen them in person before—had you?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_3: It just goes to show that the more time we spend exploring the world, the more exciting sights we’ll see.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_4: What’s that? “Even if that sight’s on the other side of an Ultra Wormhole?”
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_5: Ha ha! Very true, even if the experience was a little stressful. But I think it was worth it in the end, especially since we made a new friend—Rhi!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_1_6: Speaking of which, why don’t you pay Rhi a visit? In the meantime, please let me take a closer look at some of those Pokémon you’ve caught.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_0: Seasonal greetings, %PLAYERNAME%.  Is this appropriate to say? I have only learned of “seasons” after coming to this world.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_1: You have been busy today. What has occupied your attention?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_2: Reminiscing with Professor Willow? I am told that is a fitting activity for this time of the...day?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_3: No–year. I apologize. Tracking time by the sun’s passage is new to me, although I do find it fascinating.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_5: As a member of the GO Ultra Recon Squad, I’ve journeyed through countless dimensions to learn more about the nature of Ultra Beasts and Ultra Wormholes.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_6: I can confidently say that a world as vibrant and radiant as yours is quite rare.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_7: As rare as making a friend as kind as you, %PLAYERNAME%. Your aid has been invaluable, both in acclimating me to this world and in containing the Ultra Beasts.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_8: Our time together has been well-spent, from my perspective. If you are amenable, I would enjoy continuing our collaboration. Are you free right now?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_2_9: I would like to observe as you catch some Pokémon. Your accuracy is remarkable, and I suspect I could learn something watching you.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_3_1: That’s another day of research done. Thank you for choosing to spend it with me—and with Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_3_2: This year has had its challenges, as they all do. But no matter what obstacles we face, I know I can rely on you to help overcome them...and that thought always brightens my day.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_3_3: I hope that the time you’ve spent with me and with Pokémon has also been a source of joy, because you yourself bring joy to so many.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2022_3_4: In fact, if I could make a wish right now, it’d be for our next year to be just as amazing as this one. And with you around, hey—I’m sure it will be. See you again soon, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_0_0: Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! Can you believe we’re already approaching the year’s end?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_0_1: But what a year it’s been! Rife with surprises, discoveries—and so many Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_0_2: In fact, I think I saw some familiar Pokémon while I was out walking earlier. Perhaps they’ve gathered to celebrate with us.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_0_3: Why don’t you get out there and try to catch a few?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_0: We’ve certainly crossed paths with some fascinating Pokémon this past year, haven’t we, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_1: I’ll never forget the moment I finally witnessed Kecleon’s masterful camouflage firsthand.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_2: And how about when we encountered all those Pokémon first discovered in the Paldea region?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_3: Watching those Bombirdier soaring overhead was a thrill and a half!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_4: Which Pokémon were you most excited to encounter this year, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_1_5: Who knows—the best may still be yet to come!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_2_1: I was just reminiscing about all the ways we’ve connected with fellow Trainers this past year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_2_2: From showcasing our favorite Pokémon to partying up with friends and taking on challenges together, it feels like our community has never been more connected.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_2_3: Do you ever stop while exploring a Route to think about all the other Trainers who’ve walked that same path? All the incredible adventures they’ve had and the ones they have ahead?
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_2_4: As we explore today, let’s appreciate the wonderful community we’re part of and the friends we’ve made this year. Let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_3_1: You should be incredibly proud of what you’ve achieved this year. I know I am!
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_3_2: And yet, something tells me you’re only getting started.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_3_3: Wherever our journey takes us next, I’m grateful to be by your side.
quest_special_dialogue_dec2023_3_4: But enough about the future. Let’s get back out there and enjoy the present!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_0: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s so great to see you. Can you believe this year is already coming to a close?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_1: It’s almost as if Pokémon in the wild can feel it, too. A few seem to be appearing in greater numbers than usual!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_2: Strangely enough, the Pokémon appearing more frequently at the moment seem to be the same as those that did so previously throughout this year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_3: Seeing all these Abra, Rhyhorn, and Piplup in the wild is making me a bit nostalgic. We’ve had quite a year, haven’t we?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_4: As you venture out to catch these Pokémon, I think it might be nice to reminisce on some of the highlights from this year and how much you’ve grown as a Pokémon Trainer along the way.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_0_5: Who knows—you might even surprise yourself!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_0: Great job catching all those Abra, Rhyhorn, and Piplup, Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_1: As you were doing that, I was busy thinking about all we’ve accomplished together this year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_2: We discovered the secrets of trade Evolution and met a vast variety of Pokémon originally discovered in the Unova region.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_3: We even encountered Legendary Pokémon like Tornadus, Thundurus, Reshiram, Zekrom, Landorus, and Kyurem!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_4: Then there were the Pokémon originally discovered in the Galar region. I was particularly excited to see Galarian Ponyta, Galarian Rapidash, and Sirfetch’d!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_5: Oh! And who could forget the mysterious appearance of Mega-Evolved Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_6: Hard to believe we fit all that into one year, eh, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_1_7: Anyway, I’ve rambled on long enough. It’s time for you to get back out there and catch some more Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_0: Ah—Weedle, Gastly, and Seedot. The stars of some memorable days this past year! I still get a bit jumpy at the sight of acorns. Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_1: Gastly gave us a bit of a fright as well. Remember?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_2: OOOooooOOOoooo... BOO! Haha, sorry—I couldn’t help it.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_3: You know, Gastly isn’t the only gaseous thing we saw in abundance this year.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_4: That’s right—I’m talking about Team GO Rocket taking to the sky in balloons! An almost cartoonish mode of transportation, and yet surprisingly effective.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_5: You know, if the members of Team GO Rocket weren’t so devoted to villainy, their assets and energy would likely make them great allies.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_6: I hope that world comes to be someday.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_7: Ah, pardon my wistfulness. I tend to get more and more pensive as the day wears on. Does that happen to you as well?
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_2_8: Perhaps you can ponder that while you go out and catch more Pokémon, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_0: It’s certainly been an interesting year, hasn’t it, %PLAYERNAME%? I can’t remember another one like it, and I’ve seen a few!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_1: But despite all the ways it’s challenged us, I can’t help but think that it’ll make future experiences feel even more precious and special.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_2: After all, no matter what happens, we’re all on this Pokémon journey together—every Trainer, regardless of where they are in the world.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_4: So when the going gets tough, remember that you’re not in this alone. And while bad days are inevitable, I like to think they make the good ones that much sweeter.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_5: I hope today has been one of the good ones for you!
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_6: The world is ever changing, %PLAYERNAME%. What doesn’t change, however, is the fact that we have each other and our Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_7: And as the mysterious world of Pokémon continues to grow, so do we—as Trainers, as a community, and as people.
quest_special_dialogue_dec20cd_3_8: So here’s to a year for the books—and many more exciting ones to come!
quest_special_dialogue_deino_0_0: It appears their aggression is primarily fueled by necessity...
quest_special_dialogue_deino_0_1: Ah! Greetings again, Pokémon Trainer. You have found me mid-observation. An astounding amount of these Pokémon are present today—Deino, is it?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_0_2: Bereft of sight, their first instinct is to bite. I have experienced this firsthand—but do not fret. The pain was minimal.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_0_3: This world is replete with unique Pokémon. Though I wish to study them all, today’s focus will be on Deino alone.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_0_4: May I borrow some moments from you, Pokémon Trainer? I would welcome your expertise in this endeavor.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_1_0: Thank you for your assistance, Pokémon Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_1_1: Deino tackle and bite at their surroundings. Even in darkness, they find novel ways to navigate the world...
quest_special_dialogue_deino_1_3: Ahem. Do you think the Deino seek anything in particular? Sustenance, perhaps?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_1_4: I see. It is normal in your world to feed Berries to Pokémon when attempting to catch them. Hmm... Deino may not be able to see, but I wonder how well they can smell and taste.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_1_5: I wish to investigate the acuity of these senses by seeing how Deino respond to Berries. Will you assist me, Pokémon Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_2_0: How dee, Pokémon Trainer. I have observed you sending Gifts to your friends affixed with charming decorations. Stuckums, is it? No? Ah—stickers. What is the function of these adornments?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_2_1: I see... So they are primarily decorative, but can also communicate certain sentiments. There seems to be much comradery among the Pokémon Trainers in this world.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_2_2: Deino may bite and tackle each other, but perhaps what appears aggressive and unfriendly is simply an interaction we do not understand. Putting yourself in the mind of a Pokémon can illuminate new perspectives, do you not think?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_2_3: Hm? Your Professor Willow would also share his observations of the Pokémon you encountered? I hope you find my musings equally helpful.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_2_4: If I may muse further: I am eager to observe Deino’s Evolution. Its physical changes may inform its behavior.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_0: Astounding. You have shown me yet another wonder of this world, Pokémon Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_1: I did not anticipate Deino would gain an additional head when it evolved to Zweilous—though I cannot discern if either head can see.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_2: The two heads appear quite quarrelsome—particularly regarding food. Ah—be calm! There are Berries for all mouths!
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_3: Zweilous could learn much from the friendship you and I share. Perhaps it will do so as you travel together.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_4: I have learned recently that Zweilous can evolve into a Pokémon called Hydreigon. Will it gain yet more heads? Will it trade quarrels for kindness?
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_5: Thank you for accompanying me in my investigation today, Pokémon Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_deino_3_6: I presumed the mysteries of the Ultra Wormholes and Ultra Beasts would be my primary focus here—but the Pokémon of your world hold many mysteries of their own.
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Say, have you observed anything strange on your travels lately?
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_0_1: I’ve been getting reports of a mysterious energy gathering around the world. This seems different than anything we’ve seen before.
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_0_2: I’m eager to figure out what’s going on. Are you up for a little exploration?
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_0_3: Take a look around the area and let me know what you find!
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_1_0: Good Graveler, that Wooloo is massive!
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_1_1: This must be a Dynamax Pokémon! Just imagine how much fabric you could make with all that wool. Let me know if you give it a spin!
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_1_2: Ahem. Dynamax Pokémon have powerful techniques called Max Moves that can be enhanced with Max Particles.
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_1_3: Why don’t you start collecting Max Particles while I research these moves?
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_2_0: Check out that enhanced Max Move! I wouldn't expect any less from a Trainer such as yourself.
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_2_1: And have you noticed the Dynamax Pokémon appearing at Power Spots, those incredible energy sources you encountered?
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_2_2: This is a great opportunity to observe your Dynamax Wooloo in action.
quest_special_dialogue_dmax_ftue_2_3: You can test its Max Moves against another Dynamax Pokémon. Give it a GO!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_0: Hey, %PLAYERNAME%, great timing! Fancy doing a little investigation?
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_1: All these Ultra Wormholes we’ve encountered lately have got me thinking. Ultra Space is fascinating, sure, but there are places closer to home that still beg to be explored—like the fabled island of Dragonite!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_3: Once, a Dragonite saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite. Doesn’t that sound like something, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_4: Imagine the unique ecosystem that island would have! It’d be a veritable treasure trove for scientific inquiry.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_5: Questions are already rattling around in my head: what do Dragonite use their horns for? How quickly can they move in water? What kind of Berries do they—
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_6: Whoops. I’m getting ahead of myself. First, we need to do some baseline research on the Pokémon in question.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_7: We might even find some clues about this Dragonite paradise!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_0_8: Let’s start by observing Dratini, which can evolve into Dragonair and then Dragonite, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_0: Whoa! Look at how many Dratini you’ve caught, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_1: Did you know that in the past, Dratini was so rarely glimpsed that some called it the “Mirage Pokémon”?
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_2: And yet here you are with a whole host of them. They seem real enough to me!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_3: You know, I read a report recently that a small colony of Dratini was found living underwater.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_4: That would suggest that Dratini and its Evolutions like to live in groups.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_1_5: And if that’s true...then the island of Dragonite could be real after all! First, though, we should learn more about Dratini’s Evolution, Dragonair.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_2_1: Dragonair’s mystical appearance always leaves me in awe. In fact, this Pokémon is known for its gentle aura.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_2_2: Some even call it divine! And for good reason—see the crystalline globes on its head and tail? Dragonair can use them to freely control the weather.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_2_3: I bet that’d come in useful if you had, say, an island full of Dragonite that you wanted to keep hidden. Or if you were constantly forgetting your research notes outside on rainy days...
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_2_4: But that’s a me problem. Next, let’s help Dragonair evolve into the star of today’s studies—Dragonite!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_1: Just like Dratini and Dragonair, Dragonite is an extremely rarely seen Pokémon. How lucky we are that we can study one today!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_2: Dragonite is known as “the sea incarnate.” Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_3: Luckily for us, it’s typically a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them—like that shipwrecked man I mentioned earlier today.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_4: Why don’t we set sail and get looking for that island? Dragonite’ll surely bail us out if things go sideways!
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_5: I’m joking, I’m joking. Thanks for humoring me today, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_6: Even without weighing anchor, we learned more about Pokémon and found new ways to look at facts we already knew. I’d say that’s time well spent.
quest_special_dialogue_dratini_cdc_3_7: Though to be fair, I’d say that about any time we spend together. Heh. I’ll be in touch again soon, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Have you noticed an increase in Ghost-type Pokémon appearing lately? Because I sure have.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_0_1: I was conducting some research in my lab recently when I felt a chill run up my spine—almost like something was watching me from the shadows.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_0_2: I whirled around to face my uninvited guest and saw a Pokémon floating eerily in the corner! Apparently startled by my gaze, it flew through the wall and escaped into the great outdoors. I haven’t seen it since.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_0_3: Based on my brief glimpse of it and its quick escape, I believe my visitor was Duskull, the Requiem Pokémon. It’s known to silently sneak up on its prey by making itself invisible. It also has the ability to slip straight through thick walls.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_0_4: Naturally, my goal now is to learn more about Duskull. Can you lend me a hand? Hopefully we can come to understand why it was sneaking around my lab!
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_1_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Great work researching Duskull. While you were out, I actually had another eerie encounter in my lab.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_1_1: I saw Duskull slipping through a wall to scare me again, so I shouted, “BOO!” before it could and turned the tables. It fled back through the wall—but then it reappeared and looked at me expectantly.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_1_2: Thus began an impromptu game of peek-a-boo! It made me realize that Duskull may not get many chances to play with others because people are so quick to startle at its appearance. Makes you a bit sad, doesn’t it?
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_1_3: I wonder what else we can learn about Duskull. I know: Why don’t you try evolving your Duskull into Dusclops? Also known as the Beckon Pokémon, Dusclops apparently sucks everything in as if it were a black hole—so be careful of its mouth!
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_2_0: Wait, %PLAYERNAME%, you did WHAT? I was so sure I told you NOT to feed a Berry to Dusclops... But maybe I said the opposite by mistake? Yeah, my bad on that one.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_2_1: But it just ate the Berry normally, huh? No danger of you getting sucked in as well? Fascinating... O-oh, and, er, quite relieving! Yes, glad to see you back in one piece.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_2_2: Now, let’s learn more about Dusclops’s Evolution, Dusknoir. Known as the Gripper Pokémon, it’s said to steal people and Pokémon away at the behest of transmissions from the spirit world.
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_2_3: No one knows whether Dusknoir has a will of its own. Sounds like a Pokémon ripe for researching! Could you evolve your Dusclops for me so we can learn more?
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_3_0: Hey there, Trai— AAAH! G-G-G-GHOST! Behind you! It’s— Wait. Is that Dusknoir? Hah, sorry about that. It’s my first time seeing one!
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_3_1: No matter how spooky they may seem, we have to remember that Ghost-type Pokémon are Pokémon all the same. They’re looking for friends just like the rest of us!
quest_special_dialogue_duskt_3_2: Thanks for your help today, %PLAYERNAME%. I hope to see you and your Dusknoir again soon!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_1: Not sure if you’ve noticed, but there seems to be a huge influx of Eevee, the Evolution Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_2: Some theorize that the key to the mysteries of Pokémon Evolution lies within Eevee’s genetics.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_3: I can understand that hypothesis—after all, Eevee can evolve into EIGHT Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_4: I sure wish I were as adaptable as Eevee!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_5: I don’t even have eight different outfits. I basically wear this lab coat all the time—even to formal events!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_6: Anyway, perhaps by researching Eevee, we’ll unravel even more mysteries of Pokémon Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_0_7: I can’t wait to get started! Let’s GO learn about Eevee!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_1_0: Great work with your research on Eevee, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_1_1: According to my findings, Eevee’s irregular DNA gives it the ability to evolve into many different Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_1_2: For example, it has three Evolutions originally discovered in the Kanto region: the Water-type Vaporeon, the Electric-type Jolteon, and the Fire-type Flareon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_1_3: Isn’t it fascinating that Eevee can evolve into Pokémon of such different types?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_1_4: As you work on your Eevee research, perhaps you might learn more about these Pokémon. Good luck!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! I see you’ve gotten a Vaporeon, a Jolteon, and a Flareon!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_1: These incredible creatures are capable of some impressive feats.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_2: Did you know that Vaporeon can melt away into water?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_3: Or that Jolteon can blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_4: And that Flareon breathes fire that is over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_5: Isn’t it amazing that all three of these Pokémon evolve from Eevee?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_6: Perhaps there’s something besides genetics that gives Eevee so much potential.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_7: Let’s do some more research to learn more about Eevee. At certain times of the day, this Pokémon can evolve into Pokémon originally discovered in the Johto region: the Psychic-type Espeon and the Dark-type Umbreon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_2_8: If you keep up your research, you might find them as well!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! Looks like you’ve gotten yourself an Espeon and an Umbreon!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_1: The Psychic-type Espeon can use the fine hair on its body to sense air currents and predict its enemies’ next move. It usually evolves from Eevee during the daytime.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_2: As for the Dark-type Umbreon, it evolves from Eevee during the nighttime. It’s said that Umbreon’s rings glow yellow under the full moon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_3: Who would’ve thought that something like the time of day could affect Pokémon Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_4: It’s wonderful to delve even deeper into the mysteries of Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_5: Let’s keep it up by researching Eevee’s Evolutions that were originally discovered in the Sinnoh region.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_6: The Grass-type Leafeon and Ice-type Glaceon seem to have evolved in order to adapt to their environment.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_3_7: Why don’t you research these Pokémon next?
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_1: I see you’ve managed to get a Leafeon and a Glaceon! Congratulations!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_2: The vastly different environments in the Sinnoh region appear to have caused the adaptable Eevee to evolve into a Grass-type Pokémon and an Ice-type Pokémon. It’s inspiring to see how resilient this little Pokémon can be!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_3: We might not uncover all the secrets of Pokémon Evolution today, but I think we can learn a lot about ourselves through Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_4: Researching Eevee today has taught me there are so many paths in life to choose from.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_5: I hope that Eevee can inspire you to find the one that suits you best.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_6: But enough of this professor’s ramblings. Eevee is known to have just one more Evolution—the Fairy-type Sylveon, which was originally discovered in the Kalos region.
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_7: This Pokémon has ribbonlike feelers that it uses to calm others. Sylveon evolves from Eevee when it reaches a certain level of friendship and trust with its beloved Trainer. Knowing that almost brings a tear to my eye!
quest_special_dialogue_eevet_4_8: I hope you have the good fortune of crossing paths with a wonderful Pokémon like Sylveon sometime soon.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m really glad to see you.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_1: I’ve been dealing with some strange power outages in my mobile lab and wanted to investigate what could be causing them.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_2: It didn’t take me long to find the cause. Seems as though a group of Electabuzz decided that the mobile lab’s electricity would make an excellent snack.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_3: Electabuzz seem to be appearing in higher numbers, which could lead to more outages.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_4: Do you think you could catch some of these Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_elect_0_5: The research would be valuable, and I’d be grateful to have my power restored!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_1_1: Thanks for the assistance—I really appreciate it! While you were out catching Electabuzz, I did some research on this Pokémon’s Evolutionary line.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_1_2: Did you know that Electabuzz evolves from Elekid?
quest_special_dialogue_elect_1_3: A weak electric current flows between Elekid’s horns. Be careful, Trainer! Sticking a hand between its horns will shock you!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_1_4: Hmm... I wonder whether Spark has tried that with his Buddy Pokémon...
quest_special_dialogue_elect_1_5: Anyway, let’s keep researching these Electabuzz and make sure they aren’t snacking on any electricity meant for other uses!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_2_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%. I think we have enough data on Electabuzz.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_2_1: Also known as the Electric Pokémon, it loves to feed on strong electricity. That explains why so many Electabuzz were attracted to my mobile lab.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_2_2: Electricity runs across the surface of Electabuzz’s body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_2_3: Simply amazing! Let’s continue our research. Go ahead and use a Sinnoh Stone to evolve Electabuzz into Electivire!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_2_4: I can’t wait to see what electrifying facts we’ll learn about that Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_0: I just don’t ever know whether they find my jokes funny... Should I take a comedy class?
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_1: OH! I didn’t see you there, %PLAYERNAME%. I see you’ve evolved your Electabuzz into Electivire like I asked. Thank you!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_2: According to the Pokédex, as Electivire’s electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_3: When in battle, Electivire pushes the tips of its two tails against its foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power. I guess you could say its opponent is in for a shock!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_4: Be careful with this Pokémon when battling with it—that’s a lot of power you’re dealing with!
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_5: With the lights back on in the mobile lab, I’m going to head back and wrap up some other projects.
quest_special_dialogue_elect_3_6: Thank you again for all your help, and until next time, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_electric_rd_mar24: Great to see you, %PLAYERNAME%! We’ve got all sorts of Pokémon to catch—and plenty of research that needs doing—ahead of us. I can’t wait to get started!
Which of these Pokémon are you looking forward to encountering the most?
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_1: Oh, hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Sorry you caught me mid-yawn. I was up late reading the newest Pokémon Researcher’s Weekly.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_2: There was a fascinating article about Fennekin, and coincidentally, they’re all over the place today!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_3: Did you know Fennekin are filled with energy after eating twigs? If that worked for me, I would’ve made myself a plate of scrumptious sticks to get through my reading last night.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_4: But why read about Fennekin when we can make our own observations!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_5: What kind of twigs do Fennekin prefer? Do you think each Fennekin has a unique preference?
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_0_6: Think on those questions while you observe the Fennekin in the area, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_1_1: Have you gathered any promising information? I see you’ve at least gathered some promising Fennekin!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_1_2: They sure are cute and fluffy, but I’d be careful about getting too close. Their roomy ears vent blistering hot air.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_1_3: Hmm... These fine Fennekin don’t look like they have any twigs on them.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_1_4: Maybe we’ll get a better view of some sprigs with Fennekin’s Evolution, Braixen. Instead of snacking on twigs, they stick them in their tails.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_1_5: If you’re curious why, bring one by and I’ll tell you all about it!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_2_1: I’ll tell you about that twig, as promised.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_2_2: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets it alight. It uses the flame to send signals to its allies.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_2_3: What do you suppose Braixen communicate about? Maybe where to find the most energizing stick snacks?
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_2_4: These Pokémon’s cleverness with tools doesn’t stop there. Braixen’s Evolution, Delphox, can use branches to see into the future.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_2_5: I’m no Delphox, but I sure see a Delphox in your future!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_0: Looks like my prediction came true, %PLAYERNAME%! That Delphox of yours is downright delightful!
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_1: Delphox gaze into the flame at the tip of their branches to achieve a focused state, allowing them to see into the future.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_2: And when they use their psychic power, they can generate a fiery vortex, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_3: It’s a wonder their branches don’t catch fire! Could Delphox be using their psychic powers to protect their branches?
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_4: If you continue observing your Delphox, perhaps you’ll find the answer.
quest_special_dialogue_fennekin_3_5: But until then, thanks for spending another day researching with me. See you later, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_0_1: Personally, mine is going swimmingly. Or perhaps…flappingly? You see, an enormous flock of Fletchling has gathered nearby.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_0_2: I heard some Pokémon chirping up a storm, so I went to investigate and found Fletchling as far as the eye can see!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_0_3: Fletchling is known as the Tiny Robin Pokémon, and it’s typically quite amiable and easy to train. Send it into battle, though, and you’ll quickly see its more ferocious side!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_0_4: A fascinating little Pokémon. But as glad as I am to see it here, it’s quite odd for so many to gather in one place.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_0_5: Would you mind conducting some research so we can better understand what’s going on?
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_0: Great work, Trainer. Looks like you’ve got your very own Fletchling to join you on your journey!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_1: Did you know that Fletchling’s body is always warm? In fact, Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with this Pokémon in their beds. How about that?
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_2: I’m always fascinated to learn about how Pokémon and their Trainers work and live together. And it never hurts to know how to cope on cold nights, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_3: Anyway, Fletchling evolves into the Fire- and Flying-type Pokémon Fletchinder.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_4: Known as the Ember Pokémon, Fletchinder is exceedingly territorial and aggressive.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_5: It’s also incredibly fast. Its speed from takeoff puts it easily among the fastest of all bird Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_1_6: When you’re ready, why don’t you try evolving your Fletchling into Fletchinder? I’d love to witness that famous speed firsthand!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_0: That’s a mighty fine Fletchinder you have there, %PLAYERNAME%. Congratulations!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_1: Naturally, I’ve been busy as well. In fact, I have some information you may find useful as you train Fletchinder.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_2: You see, Fletchinder is known to expel embers from its beak to set grass on fire. Then, it pounces on the bewildered prey that flee the flames.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_3: Pretty intense, huh? Best not to wing it during training, if you catch my draft—er, drift.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_4: Try not to let any fires Fletchinder starts get out of hand, too. We’re all responsible for caring for our environment, after all!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_5: With that said, there are still a few more tasks I’d like you to complete in aid of our research.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_2_6: Chief among those is to obtain a Talonflame, the evolution of Fletchinder. They’re said to have simply magnificent wings! Do you think you could evolve your Fletchinder, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_flett_3_1: I know I’ve put you through your paces today, but it’s all paid off in the end! You’re now the proud Trainer of Talonflame, the Scorching Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_3_2: Talonflame is known to shower embers from the gaps between its feathers during the heat of battle. It then takes to the air, reaching speeds of up to 310 mph.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_3_3: Remember how I mentioned Talonflame’s wings before? Fire can’t pass through them, so they were used to outfit firefighters way back when.
quest_special_dialogue_flett_3_4: Amazing stuff! I’m always impressed by this brave bird. The two of you will no doubt accomplish great things—and at great speeds!
quest_special_dialogue_flett_3_5: Thanks for your help today, Trainer. I hope you had as much fun as I did!
quest_special_dialogue_flock_together_rd: Great to see you, %PLAYERNAME%! We’ve got all sorts of Pokémon to catch and research that needs doing. I can’t wait to get started!
Which of these fine feathered friends are you hoping to spot?
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_0_0: Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s great to see you.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_0_1: Speaking of being seen, I’ve been getting the feeling that something’s watching me while I’ve been out walking.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_0_2: I’m fairly certain my mystery observer is a Pokémon, but I haven’t the froggiest what it could be.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_0_3: I suppose there’s only one way to know for sure...
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_1_1: Your investigation went better than I could have possibly hopped. What a delight to see Froakie up close!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_1_2: Froakie secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take from attacks.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_1_3: If you think that’s cool, just wait till you see Froakie’s Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_1_4: Why don’t you try evolving Froakie for yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_1: Frogadier’s swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in only a minute!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_2: On top of that, Frogadier can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control. Quite the skill set, wouldn’t you say?
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_3: I tend to associate bubbles with baths, personally—I never would have thought to use them to cover pebbles!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_4: Frogadier’s pretty impressive, but I’ve heard its Evolution is even more so.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_5: Will you help me study it, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_2_6: Let’s put a spring in our step!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_3_0: Wow—you made quick work of that, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_3_1: Greninja can create throwing stars out of compressed water. When it throws them at high speed, they can even split metal in half!
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_3_2: Quite the upgrade from Frogadier’s bubble-coated pebbles, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_3_3: Thanks for helping me learn more about Froakie and its Evolutions, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_froakie_3_4: Between Greninja’s grace and your skills as a Trainer, I’m sure the two of you can overcome any obstacle. Maybe even split it in two! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_galarian_mrmime_0: %PLAYERNAME%! It’s so great to see you! The strangest things have been happening lately.
You see, I begin each day with a Pinap Berry and coffee for breakfast, then head outside my lab to take in the crisp morning air before starting my research.
A couple days ago, however, I stepped outside and slipped on a sheet of ice right outside the entrance of my lab! Coffee—spilled. Pinap Berry—squished. Day—ruined.
At first, I thought the ice formed because it was an especially chilly day, but it was in fact nowhere near cold enough to create a sheet of ice that thick!
For my sake—and my breakfast’s—can you help me research Ice-type Pokémon to see whether we can discover anything? *sniffle* My poor breakfast...
quest_special_dialogue_galarian_mrmime_1: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! We’ve learned quite a bit about Ice-type Pokémon, and it looks as if you’ve caught a few interesting ones!
I feel like we’re getting closer to finding out the cause of my breakfast’s untimely demise. Oh! There’s something I forgot to mention.
That very evening—after an incredibly sad, breakfast-less day—I was trying to cheer myself up by dressing in my comfiest pajamas and drinking a cup of herbal tea before tucking into bed.
As I lay there, ready to count Mareep and fall asleep, I was suddenly awoken by some unnerving tapping outside my lab! It sounded like...tap-dancing?
I was simply too comfortable in bed—and too frightened—to get up and check. All I could do was lie there and hope the tapping would end soon.
I now believe source of that tapping was the same Pokémon that created the sheet of ice in front of my mobile lab.
Can you investigate some Pokémon related to making peculiar sounds? Let’s see whether we can get closer to solving this case before it goes cold.
quest_special_dialogue_galarian_mrmime_2: ... ... ... OH! %PLAYERNAME%, you scared me. I was a bit distracted thinking about the tap-dancing I heard last night, as well as the shadow I saw pass by my window.
Oh, I didn’t mention that last part? Yes, it was quite an unnerving experience! Anyway, let me take a look at all the research you’ve done.
Oh! OH! Oh my goodness! All right, I think I know the source of these strange occurrences now.
I believe the culprit is the Galarian form of the Barrier Pokémon—Mr. Mime!
