quest_special_dialogue_magmt_1_6: As adorable as Magby is, though, field studies have shown that whenever it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils. Still doesn’t stop me from trying to hug it!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_1_7: Anyway, %PLAYERNAME%, you should try evolving your Magmar! Check in with me again before you do, though—I’ll have more hot tips for you then.
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_2_1: Soon, you’ll have yourself a Magmortar, the Blast Pokémon. Exciting stuff!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_2_2: Watch out for the ends of its arms, though—they can produce fireballs as hot as 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit! Yowch!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_2_3: Can you imagine if you could blast fireballs out of your arms? Fwoosh! Fwoosh! Hahaha! Hey, that’s pretty fun! Fwoosh!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_2_4: There I go getting fired up about Pokémon again. Get it? “Fired up”? Haha, my hot streak continues!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_2_5: Anyway, with this Sinnoh Stone and the Magmar Candy you’ve acquired, you should be able to evolve your Magmar into Magmortar pretty soon—so keep up the great work, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_3_0: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%! Looks like you’ve got your very own Magmortar.
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_3_1: Magmortar, like Magby and Magmar, tends to live in volcanos.
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_3_2: Its body can even take on a whitish hue from the intense heat generated by the fireballs it shoots from the ends of its arms!
quest_special_dialogue_magmt_3_3: Wow, learning about Magmar and its Evolutionary line has really lit a fire in my heart. I need to get back to my research, pronto!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_0_1: Is it just me, or are our surroundings looking...fluffier than usual today? It must be all these Mareep around!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_0_2: Mareep might look tantalizingly soft, but a word of warning before you go in for a hug—static electricity builds up in their fluffy coat, so touching one will give you quite a shock!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_0_3: In lieu of a Mareep cuddle, how about a Mareep huddle? Let’s put our heads together and see what we can learn about this wonderful Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_1_1: Let’s take a closer look at the Mareep you just caught.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_1_2: Did you know that it stores air in its wool coat, allowing it to stay cool when it’s hot and warm when it’s cold?
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_1_3: In the warm months, its fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_1_4: Then, when cool weather blows in and brings dry air with it, Mareep’s wool doubles in size and the tip of its tail glows slightly.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_1_5: Say, why don’t you help a few Mareep evolve so we can learn more about Flaaffy, too?
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_0: Well done, %PLAYERNAME%! Those are some happy-looking Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_1: Flaaffy’s fluffy fleece can store lots of electricity.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_2: So much, in fact, that it has developed patches of rubbery skin that don’t conduct electricity. This helps protect Flaaffy from being electrocuted.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_3: Like Mareep, Flaaffy’s tail is a great indicator of how much electric charge it has stored. When its coat is fully charged, its tail lights up.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_4: Flaffy’s Evolution, Ampharos, also has an impressive tail...but let’s not get ahead of ourselves!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_2_5: I’ll tell you more about that after you’ve helped Flaaffy evolve.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_0: Wool-hoo, %PLAYERNAME%! That is one dazzling Ampharos!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_1: Did you know the tip of Ampharos’s tail shines so brightly that it can be seen from space? That’s no tall tale! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_2: This Pokémon’s light has been treasured by people since ancient times. It acts as a beacon for the lost—and in the olden days, people used it to send signals back and forth across great distances.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_3: It’s no wonder Ampharos is known as the Light Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_4: I just know it’ll shine bright in all your wonderful adventures together, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_mareep_3_5: Thanks for spending the day learning with me. I’ll see you next time!
quest_special_dialogue_may22_alola_branc: %PLAYERNAME%! Good to see you. How’ve you been? Rested and relaxed, I hope?

I’ve been full of energy since I saw Tapu Fini. And as I thought more about that encounter, I realized that over these past few months, we’ve been seeing quite a few Pokémon that were first found in Alola.
And you—you’ve even been lucky enough to see all four of Alola’s island guardians!
I can’t say I’m completely free of envy, but I’m glad you were able to have those experiences.
After all, we professors owe much of our learning to adventurous Trainers like yourself!
I wonder if our friendship would be as fruitful if our roles were reversed... I’d sure like to hope so! Haha!
Keep exploring, %PLAYERNAME%. You never know what you might find!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Look at that—you’ve caught all of Alola’s first partner Pokémon!
They make for quite the iconic trio.
Let’s continue our Alola-inspired research today!
Which of Alola’s islands piques your interest the most, %PLAYERNAME%?
So you’re interested in Melemele Island, eh? No surprise there—it’s one of my favorites as well.
Though perhaps that isn’t saying much... They’re all my favorites, really! Haha!
As we’ve discussed, Melemele Island is where many Trainers in Alola begin the region’s island challenge.
There’s even a Trainers’ School there, where aspiring young Trainers can make friends and study up on all things Pokémon.
In the spirit of Melemele Island, why don’t you go meet some new Pokémon and send some Gifts to your friends?
So you’re interested in Akala Island, eh? No surprise there—it’s one of my favorites as well.
Though perhaps that isn’t saying much... They’re all my favorites, really! Haha!
As I mentioned before, Akala Island offers a variety of geological features, including a volcano, fishing spots, and even waterfalls!
I like to take a stroll when my mind gets mired in a problem, and it sounds like Akala Island would be a great place for that.
In that spirit, why don’t you take a stroll yourself? I’ll be here when you get back.
So you’re interested in Ula’Ula Island, eh? No surprise there—it’s one of my favorites as well.
Though perhaps that isn’t saying much... They’re all my favorites, really! Haha!
As we’ve discussed, Ula’Ula Island is home to Mount Lanakila, the highest peak in all of Alola! But did you know the summit of Mount Lanakila also houses Alola’s very own Pokémon League?
It’s a place many Trainers aspire to reach, and doing so requires forging powerful bonds with Pokémon.
In that spirit, why don’t you head out and find some new Pokémon partners, %PLAYERNAME%?
So you’re interested in Poni Island, eh? No surprise there—it’s one of my favorites as well.
Though perhaps that isn’t saying much... They’re all my favorites, really! Haha!
Did you know that Poni Island is home to the Battle Tree, Alola’s preeminent battle facility? Strong Trainers gather there to test their teams against each other.
I’ve heard you can even meet some Pokémon League Champions there on occasion! The things I could learn from them...
In the spirit of Poni Island—and as an act of public service—why don’t you test your battling skills against Team GO Rocket, %PLAYERNAME%?
I don’t know about you, but I’ve had a great time getting to learn more about Alola, its Pokémon, and even its guardian deities.
If there’s one thing I love about Pokémon, it’s that there’s always something new to learn!
But to be honest with you, I was hoping we’d have a better idea by now of what attracted Alola’s guardian deities here.
They usually spend their time protecting Alola, so what could’ve spurred them to come here?
Could it be that they sensed something dangerous nearby that may threaten Alola? It would have to be something extraordinary—maybe even beyond our current understanding of Pokémon.
Another daunting yet fascinating question for us to tackle together, %PLAYERNAME%.
Whatever comes next, I know the two of us will overcome it.
For now, continue your island research. I’ll keep trying to spot the guardian deities!
I’ll be in touch again soon. For now, let’s GO!
Welcome back! Did your friends like their Gifts?
Welcome back! How was your adventure? Did you see anything new? You’ll have to tell me all about it!
Welcome back! Let me take a look at the Pokémon you’ve returned with... I bet with some training, you and your Pokémon would be ready to take on Alola’s Pokémon League yourselves!
Welcome back! I knew you’d have no trouble with Team GO Rocket. You never do!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_3: Sorry. I’ve just been feeling kinda burnt out lately.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_4: I hate to say it, but my battling techniques have gotten stale. I need to reignite my inner fire somehow.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_5: Wait—I’ve got an idea! Professor Willow’s always talking about how great you are at Pokémon battles.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_6: How about letting me see some of that passion in action? Watching you battle might be just what I need!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_7: You’ll help me out, yeah? Nice. I knew you’d agree, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_0_8: Let’s make sure our teams are in top shape, then we’ll get to it.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_1_1: My team’s raring to see you and your Pokémon blaze into the fray!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_1_2: So. Where should we start? There’s plenty of options—take on a Gym, battle with friends, go a couple rounds in the GO Battle League...
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_1_3: You and I could even go head-to-head!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_1_4: Oh—I’ve got it! See that Team GO Rocket Grunt over there?
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_1_5: Let’s take ’em down. We can save whatever Pokémon they’ve got their hands on and flex your battle skills at the same time!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_2_1: Didja see how fast that Grunt ran off? Hah! You smoked ’em.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_2_2: Speaking of Grunts, they’ve been acting weird lately. The last few I battled acted off after I beat ’em. Usually they throw a huffy quip at me before sulking off.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_2_4: Rrrgh... Think I need to up the intensity? Maybe have Ponyta give ’em a good Stomp at the end?!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_2_5: Anyway. Enough analyzing—that’s Blanche’s thing. Let’s get back to battling. Why don’t we find a Gym you can take on.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_1: My mind’s ablaze with new ways to train.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_2: Thanks for helping me find my fire!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_3: I should probably be the one teaching you stuff, but you know plenty already.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_4: Does that mean you’re looking to take up the reins of team leader yourself? Hah, I could get behind that!
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_5: You know, you really gave me the inspiration I needed—I’d say that’s pretty heroic.
quest_special_dialogue_may23_candela_3_6: All right. Enough talk. Ponyta and I are off to get in some training. See you later, %PLAYERNAME%! And you better be ready to battle the next time you see me.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I think I’ve got an exciting adventure for you. I’ve been working on something...BIG.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_1: Recently, we observed a large number of Weedle appearing in the wild. I wanted to investigate that phenomenon further.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_2: After a day of research, I saw something sparkling in the tall grass near where the Weedle were gathering.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_3: It turned out to be a smooth, stonelike object with a symbol etched into it. It glowed with an energy I’ve never encountered before!
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_4: I’d seen that symbol before in documents about Mega Evolution that I received from my colleague in Kalos, Professor Sycamore. That led me to believe that the object was somehow related.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_5: After digging further into the documents, I theorized that Pokémon can Mega Evolve using the energy from the object I found, which I named Mega Energy.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_6: It also occurred to me that the object I found might be related to Weedle.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_0_7: Now that I’ve caught you up on my BIG discovery, let’s get started on some research. We’ll need a Weedle—I think that Pokémon has mega potential!
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! Let’s document our findings for other Trainers.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_1: Now, Weedle can’t Mega Evolve, but its final Evolution, Beedrill, can.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_2: My theory is that there is Mega Energy for different Pokémon and that each Pokémon needs a certain amount of Mega Energy to Mega Evolve.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_3: It also seems that Mega-Evolved Pokémon return to normal once their Mega Energy is depleted.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_4: It may be difficult to gather the Mega Energy needed to Mega Evolve a Pokémon for the first time. However, it seems that once a Pokémon has Mega Evolved, it requires less Mega Energy to do so again.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_5: Maybe it’s because Mega Evolution strengthens a Trainer’s bond with their Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_1_6: Let’s continue this investigation. How about you evolve your Weedle to its final Evolution and see whether you can find enough Mega Energy to Mega Evolve your new Beedrill.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_0: Again, you never cease to amaze me, %PLAYERNAME%. I think you and Beedrill are going to be great partners.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_1: I’ve learned that some other Pokémon can Mega Evolve, too.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_2: While I’ve been able to confirm only a few, I’m sure we’ll discover more in time. At this point, you should be able to Mega Evolve your Beedrill, if you’re ready.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_3: Now, I’m sure you are going to ask, “Professor Willow, how do I get Mega Energy for other Pokémon?”
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_4: Well, don’t worry, Trainer. Mega Venusaur, Mega Charizard, and Mega Blastoise are appearing in Mega Raids all around the world. It appears you can get Mega Energy by challenging those Mega-Evolved Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_5: Why don’t you Mega Evolve your Beedrill and battle with it in Mega Raids? There seem to be benefits to battling in raids alongside Mega-Evolved Pokémon for both you and your fellow Trainers.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_2_6: I’m curious to see what effect Mega-Evolved Pokémon have on other Pokémon when they battle together. Why don’t you give it a try!
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_0: I dare say, this was a successful research project! It looks like you were able to acquire some Mega Energy by battling those Mega-Evolved Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_1: I’ve documented that you and your Mega-Evolved Pokémon can do many other things together, too.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_2: I hope to see you and your Mega-Evolved Pokémon battling at Gyms, challenging other Trainers, combating Team GO Rocket, and, of course, taking some snapshots to send back to yours truly.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_3: Mega-Evolved Pokémon are extremely powerful, so I think it’s best that we don’t bring our new friends into the GO Battle League just yet, at least until more research is done.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_4: I wanted to give you a token of my appreciation for all your hard work on this project—a Mega Bracelet!
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_5: In other regions, Trainers use Mega Bracelets to help their Pokémon Mega Evolve. Based on my research into Mega Energy, it seems you won’t need a Mega Bracelet to Mega Evolve your Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_6: However, I thought a Mega Bracelet would be a trendy way to show off your Mega Evolution skills.
quest_special_dialogue_megabee_3_7: You can check it out when you want to change up your look. I hope you accept this gift with my sincerest thanks for a job well done.
quest_special_dialogue_megav3_branch_que: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%!
I have something exciting planned for you today—you could even say it’s a mega surprise! Haha!
I still have a few loose ends to wrap up, though.
While I finish my preparations, how about you take a quick survey of the area and see what Pokémon are out and about today?
I’ll be ready by the time you’re back.
Ah, good—you’re back. I’ve just finished getting everything ready.
Have you tried to Mega Evolve a Pokémon lately?
Something about Mega Evolution caught my attention recently, so I was hoping you could help me investigate.
Let’s take a closer look at Mega Evolution, from beginning to end.
First, let’s choose which of these Pokémon you’d like to be the star of our research, %PLAYERNAME%!
Once we’re done, our understanding of Mega Evolution will be second to none.
So, you’ve chosen Venusaur, the Seed Pokémon!
Venusaur absorbs solar energy as nutrition. By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun’s rays, it fills its body with power.
While I fetch Venusaur, how about you go out and catch a few Pokémon as a warm-up. Don’t forget to power them up, too.
You’ll have an even more formidable team by your side in no time!
So, you’ve chosen Charizard, the Flame Pokémon!
Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
While I fetch Charizard, how about you go out and catch a few Pokémon as a warm-up. Don’t forget to power them up, too.
You’ll have an even more formidable team by your side in no time!
So, you’ve chosen Blastoise, the Shellfish Pokémon!
The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
While I fetch Blastoise, how about you go out and catch a few Pokémon as a warm-up. Don’t forget to power them up, too.
You’ll have an even more formidable team by your side in no time!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Now that we’re fully warmed up, let’s tuck into our research on Mega Evolution.
Some theorize that a strong bond between a Trainer and a Pokémon is the key to Mega Evolution. We’ve also seen that Mega Energy can play a role.
However, I noticed recently that if you Mega Evolve your Pokémon once using Mega Energy, you won’t need to use Mega Energy to Mega Evolve that Pokémon again.
Let’s Mega Evolve Venusaur and see if that’s true for ourselves, %PLAYERNAME%!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Now that we’re fully warmed up, let’s tuck into our research on Mega Evolution.
Some theorize that a strong bond between a Trainer and a Pokémon is the key to Mega Evolution. We’ve also seen that Mega Energy can play a role.
However, I noticed recently that if you Mega Evolve your Pokémon once using Mega Energy, you won’t need to use Mega Energy to Mega Evolve that Pokémon again.
Let’s Mega Evolve Charizard and see if that’s true for ourselves, %PLAYERNAME%!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Now that we’re fully warmed up, let’s tuck into our research on Mega Evolution.
Some theorize that a strong bond between a Trainer and a Pokémon is the key to Mega Evolution. We’ve also seen that Mega Energy can play a role.
However, I noticed recently that if you Mega Evolve your Pokémon once using Mega Energy, you won’t need to use Mega Energy to Mega Evolve that Pokémon again.
Let’s Mega Evolve Blastoise and see if that’s true for ourselves, %PLAYERNAME%!
What a magnificent Mega Venusaur, %PLAYERNAME%!
Let’s keep growing: why don’t you take on a Raid Battle with your mighty Mega Venusaur? There may even be a Team GO Rocket Grunt lurking about, looking for a battle.
Mega-Evolved Pokémon are powerful allies. Their strength in battle is unmatched!
I’m sure there’s more to learn about Mega Evolution, so why stop now? Let’s GO!
What a commanding Mega Charizard, %PLAYERNAME%!
Let’s keep our fire burning: why don’t you take on a Raid Battle with your mighty Mega Charizard? There may even be a Team GO Rocket Grunt lurking about, looking for a battle.
Mega-Evolved Pokémon are powerful allies. Their strength in battle is unmatched!
I’m sure there’s more to learn about Mega Evolution, so why stop now? Let’s GO!
What a brilliant Mega Blastoise, %PLAYERNAME%!
Let’s keep our progress flowing: why don’t you take on a Raid Battle with your mighty Mega Blastoise? There may even be a Team GO Rocket Grunt lurking about, looking for a battle.
Mega-Evolved Pokémon are powerful allies. Their strength in battle is unmatched!
I’m sure there’s more to learn about Mega Evolution, so why stop now? Let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s great to see you, as always.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_1: I’m feeling especially refreshed today, as if a pleasant island breeze was following me. Maybe it’s the freshly squeezed Pinap Juice I had for breakfast?
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_2: Or maybe it’s because more and more Pokémon first discovered in the Alola region have been coming to visit me lately!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_3: Do you know about the Alola region, %PLAYERNAME%? It’s a cluster of tropical islands, each with unique scenery and Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_4: Alola even has Pokémon whose appearances are different than their counterparts in other regions. You may have encountered some of them before!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_0_5: Why don’t you try looking for some Pokémon that were first discovered in Alola while I rustle up another glass of juice? I’m sure we have a lot to learn about our visitors!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_1_0: Good timing, %PLAYERNAME%! I just finished my juice.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_1_1: Thanks for looking into the Alola region’s Pokémon! You’re as diligent as ever.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_1_2: Let me take a look at what you’ve discovered. Hmm... It seems many of the Pokémon you just met can be found on Alola’s Melemele Island.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_1_3: Melemele Island is where many of Alola’s Trainers begin their island challenge. It’s very fitting that the Pokémon you just met are also some of the first that young Trainers in Alola meet, too!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_1_4: Now, let’s have a little more fun! Could you take a few snapshots of your new Pokémon friends or feed them some Berries, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_2_0: Back already, %PLAYERNAME%? You and your Pokémon already seem to be closer. But who doesn’t love a good Pinap Berry? Speaking of, maybe it’s time for another glass of juice...
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_2_1: Delicious juice aside, did you know that each island in the Alola region has its own Island Guardian? Melemele Island’s guardian deity is Tapu Koko.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_2_2: Why do I bring this up? Well, while you were away, I was looking for a clean glass and caught a startling yellow flash out of the corner of my eye!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_2_3: The lightning-wielding Tapu Koko is known to fly faster than the eye can follow. With so many other Pokémon found on Melemele Island appearing, could it be that Tapu Koko is visiting as well?
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_2_4: Could you look around and see if you can spot Tapu Koko, %PLAYERNAME%? I’m eager to know if what I saw was truly the Land Spirit Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! What’s that? You were able to see Tapu Koko? That’s incredible!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_1: And would you believe it: Spark was just here, raving that he’d seen Tapu Koko, too! So it is in the area after all. What an exceptional discovery, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_2: I wonder why Tapu Koko is here. Tapu Koko is said to be a Pokémon brimming with curiosity—but, naturally, island guardians tend to stay on their respective islands. The fact that one of them is here may mean something is amiss...
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_3: Or did someone do something to anger it? I’ll have to do some more research before I can say anything for sure.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_4: Do you think we’ll get a chance to meet the other island guardians, %PLAYERNAME%? Wouldn’t that be something.
quest_special_dialogue_melemele_3_5: I guess we’ll just have to wait and see. Until then, let’s kick back and enjoy a little R and R with our new friends!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_0_0: Hey, %PLAYERNAME%! Have you run into any Pokémon wearing fun costumes recently? I’ve seen quite a few around my mobile lab.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_0_1: It reminded me how freeing it can be to express yourself in different ways. Personally, I’m a big fan of turning up my tunes and shredding on the air guitar!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_0_2: Others, like Spark, are really into taking snapshots of Pokémon and the world around them. I wonder how those Pokémon feel when they wear those costumes.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_0_3: Sounds to me like some research is in order!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_1_0: Welcome back, Trainer! I was digging through some old files while you were out when I began to hear a strange melody coming from somewhere nearby.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_1_1: I ran out to investigate, and in my haste, I ended up bumping straight into Blanche, who’d been sorting through some Berries.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_1_2: Blanche was none too pleased to see those Berries scattered on the ground, but the costumed Pokémon that rushed in to gobble them up sure seemed thankful. Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_1_3: Seeing them relish those Berries gave me an idea. Cooking food can be a terrific way to express yourself, and giving food to those we care about is one of the most heartfelt things we do for one another.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_1_4: I wonder how different Pokémon react to different foods. While I go on a Berry run, why don’t you do some research on how Pokémon feel after eating?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_0: Thanks for completing those research tasks, Trainer! Reading the results of your research made my heart full—and my stomach rumbly! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_1: Ah, by the way! I heard that mysterious melody again while I was collecting Berries. I think it may be the product of a certain Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_2: I wasn’t able to look into it further at the time—my hands were quite full with Berries—but I’m hoping we can investigate it together soon.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_3: For now, could you continue researching how people and Pokémon express themselves?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_4: For many Trainers and their Pokémon, battling is a primary outlet of self-expression. In fact, Candela believes that the feelings she shares with her Pokémon can directly influence the outcome of a battle.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_2_5: Why don’t you go out and see for yourself? I’ll be cheering you on from here!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_3_0: Welcome back, Trainer. Did you learn anything about expressing yourself in battle?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_3_1: While you were out, I managed to track that mysterious melody to a location nearby. I think the source may be none other than Meloetta, the Melody Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_3_2: Did you know that its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_3_3: Maybe if we find a way to express ourselves through song as well, you’ll be able to catch Meloetta’s attention! What do you say, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_4_0: Well done, %PLAYERNAME%! I knew you’d find a way to catch Meloetta’s attention.
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_4_1: They say many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that Meloetta produces, and it’s not hard to see why. Self-expression through song is a truly powerful thing!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_4_2: I think this would be a fine opportunity for you to partner with Meloetta and share who you are with your friends. I’m sure Meloetta would be happy to learn more about you, too!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_5_0: Da da da dooo... Da dee doo, dee da dee dum...
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_5_1: Oh, %PLAYERNAME%—I didn’t see you there! I was just rocking out to one of my favorite songs. After so much research on how people express themselves, I felt compelled to indulge in a bit of self-expression myself!
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_5_2: Whether it’s serving looks or serving lunch, a Pokémon battle or battle of the bands, there’s no limit to the ways you can express who you are. What’s your method of choice, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_meloetta_5_3: Maybe you’re still figuring it out—and that’s totally fine. Everyone’s journey is unique! Whatever the case, you have my support—and Meloetta’s, too. Now, let’s get out there and show the world who we are!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%, it’s always great to see you! I’m sure you know this, but your help in progressing my research has been essential to major breakthroughs in my work.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_1: That’s why I’ve come to talk to you again. You probably already know what I’ll be asking!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_2: I need your assistance in learning more about the newly discovered Pokémon that has really sent me and other Pokémon researchers into quite a tizzy.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_3: Can you believe an undiscovered Pokémon just appeared out of the blue? You can imagine how everyone is talking about it!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_4: I was checking a nearby habitat when I ran into a nest of them, and I was so excited, I dropped my camera! Don’t worry, though... I’m sure the repairs won’t cost me too much at the shop...
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_5: Although each Pokémon turned out to be a Ditto using the move Transform, that didn’t put a damper on my day!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_6: So many Ditto taking on this unique Pokémon form must mean that the real Pokémon is truly out there, just waiting to be found.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_0_7: Let’s get to work, %PLAYERNAME%! I know we don’t have much to go on, but I’m confident your hard work can only bring us good fortune!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_0: Thanks, %PLAYERNAME%! I think that will be enough to help me properly conduct calculations based on the data you’ll gather in the field.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_1: While you were out, I scanned some academic journals to see if any of my fellow researchers have encountered a Pokémon matching the description of the species I saw, but I didn’t have much luck.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_2: But I do have a hunch! Given that this Pokémon has been unseen until just recently, I think it’s safe to say that we’re tracking another Mythical Pokémon, like Mew and Celebi.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_3: If I’m right and this elusive Pokémon is a Mythical Pokémon, we should be able to draw it out by creating specific conditions under which it thrives.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_4: But let’s step back for a minute, before we take a step forward. Or many steps forward, in this case! Great fieldwork starts with a walk. Could you complete a few tasks for me?
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_1_5: Also, remind me to contact my mentor, Professor Oak. I’m certain his brilliant mind will have something to lend to all this...
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_0: %PLAYERNAME%, I gave Professor Oak a call, and he pulled through! He says that the Pokémon is called Meltan! I think the name has a nice ring to it—don’t you?
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_1: Professor Oak got this information through an ancient text found in his archives, which included the appearance of Meltan.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_2: What luck! Did you know that when Professor Oak was my instructor, he was my role model? And he still is!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_3: He and I are of the same opinion that Meltan is a Mythical Pokémon, so I really think we’re on to something!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_4: Still, a name alone isn’t going to get us very far... Perhaps the Ditto know something we don’t?
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_5: I think that if we find Ditto, we’ll be able to figure out how they acquired this curious transformation, and maybe that will lead us to Meltan.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_2_6: Observation will be the best way forward, so let’s roll up our sleeves and get to work!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_3_0: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%! The Ditto you’ve helped me analyze indeed has transformed into Meltan before. In fact, it was able to use Transform and let me analyze Meltan up close!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_3_1: This Ditto was very helpful, even though it couldn’t replicate some of the finer details. It seems the memory of Meltan is fading away...
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_3_2: But I have good news! I was able to tell that Meltan has a liquid-metal body with a nutlike head and a tail that looks like a power cord. Judging from the appearance, it may be an Electric- or Steel-type Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_0: Great news, %PLAYERNAME%! Thanks to all the data you’ve collected, I was able to make a detailed study of the differences between Electric-type Pokémon and Steel-type Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_1: Thankfully, the Ditto was able to use Transform one more time! It took me some time to figure out it was attracted to all my metal equipment.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_2: Then I realized that it was copying every aspect of Meltan, including its behavioral patterns. Given the Ditto’s behavior, I believe Meltan is capable of assimilating metal by melting metal objects. What an interesting ability!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_3: I can now say that, according to my research, Meltan is a Steel-type Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_4: I think our next step is to study more Pokémon that have similar characteristics. Can you complete the following tasks to learn more about Pokémon with fluid body surfaces or stomach acid strong enough to melt metals?
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_6: Oh, and one more thing—Professor Oak is also studying a Ditto in his own lab that is able to Transform into Meltan. With our parallel research, I think we’ll be able to make some breakthroughs soon!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_4_7: By the time you complete all the research tasks, I should be able to circle back to you with the latest development.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_5_0: Just in the nick of time, %PLAYERNAME%! With careful study of the Ditto that I sent him and the small amount of documented Meltan encounters, Professor Oak was able to solve more mysteries related to this Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_5_1: Meltan very well may have split from a Pokémon named Melmetal, which has been recorded even less than Meltan. Never before have we seen a Mythical Pokémon that can divide into multiple, independent Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_5_2: This explains why the world saw a simultaneous appearance of so many Ditto disguised as Meltan.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_5_3: Professor Oak and I have made a guess as to how Meltan can re-form back into Melmetal—because Meltan have bodies similar to molten metal, they have a unique ability to merge and trigger an Evolution into Melmetal!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_5_4: Do you know what Pokémon we should research next? You’re bright, %PLAYERNAME%, so I know you know the answer! I need you to collect data on Pokémon for which several parts can come together and act as one.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_6_0: Wow, I’m impressed! %PLAYERNAME%! Your data has arrived just as I’ve finished putting pieces of evidence together to learn Melmetal’s place in history.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_6_1: According to these records, Melmetal was once regarded as a sacred being in a secluded community deep inside a wooded land that was rich with magnetite-bearing sedimentary rock.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_6_2: People there developed ways to make unique tools out of metal shed by Melmetal. Without such metal, they couldn’t have made these tools back then.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_7_0: I just received an important piece of news, %PLAYERNAME%! Remember the ancient text? It seems that a mysterious box was also excavated from the same site where the ancient text was found.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_7_1: There was nothing in the box except a rusty lump of metal that bears interesting similarities to Meltan.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_7_2: Perhaps exposing the box to this vast natural environment could cause something enigmatic to happen, resulting in Meltan changing states as well.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_7_3: Exposing this metal to the open air could have had an entirely different effect on what’s inside the box, but we won’t know until we try it.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_7_4: We may be able to find a clue about the lump of metal by delving into the world of ancient Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_8_0: I was right, %PLAYERNAME%! This artifact is truly Meltan! We did it!
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_8_1: Of course, the reason for Meltan’s presence inside this mysterious box can only be guessed. Maybe the people who glorified and worshiped Melmetal decided to keep it safe when the Pokémon somehow split itself apart.
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_8_2: Doing so could have been thought of as the only way for the people to ever meet Melmetal again. That warms the heart a little, doesn’t it, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_8_3: Make sure you give Meltan plenty of chances to see the vast world we live in by venturing out and exploring! Who knows what will happen from here...
quest_special_dialogue_meltan_8_4: Enjoy exploring, %PLAYERNAME%, and I’m sure we’ll be in touch soon!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%, how are you? It’s been a while, hasn’t it? You’ve become quite the Trainer!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_0_1: I wanted to ask for your help. As you know, I study Pokémon and their habitats. I’ve learned a lot over the years, but recently, I’ve found some hints of something mysterious.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_0_2: I was wondering if you would help me investigate what's going on.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_0_4: First things first, let’s calibrate my instruments to your area.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_1_0: Great. Thanks, %PLAYERNAME%! Now I should be able to detect anything out of the ordinary.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_1_1: I believe we need to be on the lookout for a Mythical Pokémon! Mythical Pokémon are extremely rare and unique, and many consider their existence to be mere rumor.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_1_2: Could you help get my equipment set up around your local habitat? This’ll be a great time to take your buddy out to explore a bit and hatch some Eggs!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_2_0: Incredible! This confirms my initial suspicion. I think we’re seeing evidence of Mew!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_2_1: A Pokémon found in a jungle far to the south that was thought to have been extinct. It is so rare that many experts say that it is a myth. %BREAK%Only a few people have seen it worldwide. Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_2_2: My colleagues in Kanto, including my instructor, Professor Oak, spent a long time studying Mew. It looks like our findings match theirs!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_2_3: According to our research, Mew was said to be observed using moves of all kinds. This observation has led some of us to say that Mew is the ancestor of all Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_2_4: Perhaps by studying Pokémon in battle, we’ll learn more!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_3_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! This will help point us in the right direction.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_3_1: Did you know Mew is said to hold the genetic codes of all Pokémon? Mew’s secrets could be a link to understanding the mystery of Pokémon growth and Evolution!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_3_2: Let's study some Pokémon Evolution to learn more about Mew!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_4_0: Amazing. Just amazing! Isn’t Evolution wondrous? I learn something new every time I see it!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_4_1: With the data we’ve collected so far, I should be able to pinpoint Mew’s location! It looks like...
quest_special_dialogue_mew_4_2: Yes, it looks like Mew has visited your area recently! Hmm... Interesting. If that's the case, someone should have reported a sighting...
quest_special_dialogue_mew_4_3: Maybe Mew is hiding or disguised as another Pokémon? Let's study some other Pokémon that use these tricks and the best ways to catch them!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_5_0: Thank you, %PLAYERNAME%! With your help, I’ve determined that Mew is invisible!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_5_1: Let's collect some data to build a tool to find it. I have an idea... I’ll need you to study some powerful Pokémon up close to help me out!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_6_0: Nice! My prototype is functioning well. I’ve upgraded your AR camera with the new ability to see invisible Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_6_1: The final step is to lure out Mew. Mew is said only to appear to those who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to meet it...
quest_special_dialogue_mew_6_2: Let’s show Mew what a great Trainer you are and how excited we are to see it!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_7_0: We found Mew! Awesome! This is an experience to remember forever.
quest_special_dialogue_mew_7_1: Now you can see why I love studying Pokémon so much! The whole world is out there to discover. So go have some fun!
quest_special_dialogue_mew_7_2: My assistants and I will request some Special Research from you in the future. Stay in touch!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_0: Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve caught me at a curious time. You see, I was just out for a walk, thinking about how much I’d love to see a Mudkip, when—wouldn’t you know it—I came across a whole mess of them!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_1: Did you know that Mudkip sleep by burying themselves in soil at the water’s edge? Sounds adorable, right?
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_2: One of the many things that’s always impressed me about Mudkip is how strong it is in spite of its size.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_3: When faced with a tight situation in battle, Mudkip will unleash its amazing power. It can even crush rocks much bigger than itself!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_4: It would be less than ideal if all these Mudkip were to do that right now... And yet, the researcher in me is curious to see it happen! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_0_5: Anyway, what do you say we do a bit of research on Mudkip, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. I see you’ve brought a Mudkip with you—nice work!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_1: Using the fin on its head, Mudkip senses the flow of water to keep track of what’s going on around it.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_2: I got a bit too close during my observations earlier, and those Mudkip splashed mud all over my coat! Which actually got me thinking about Mudkip’s Evolution, Marshtomp.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_3: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made Marshtomp’s legs sturdy.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_4: And because it’s used to such slippery surfaces, Marshtomp can quickly overwhelm foes mired in mud.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_1_5: While I clean my coat off, why don’t you try evolving your Mudkip so you can see Marshtomp firsthand, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_0: I knew I should’ve brought an extra coat with me... Ah! Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. That’s a very sturdy-looking Marshtomp you have with you.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_1: Don’t you think it’s inspiring how Pokémon thrive in all sorts of environments? Mudkip and Marshtomp seem like an especially versatile bunch.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_2: Now, I have some exciting news. I caught a glimpse of some Swampert—Marshtomp’s Evolution—while you were away!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_3: Swampert can not only break boulders into pieces with one swing of its arms, but it can also predict storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_4: I tend to get so engrossed in my research that I lose track of my surroundings, so having a Swampert around might be just what I need.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_5: ...What’s that? I could just try to pay a bit more attention myself? Well, I suppose that’s an option... But not quite as fun, don’t you think? Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_2_6: Why don’t you try evolving your Marshtomp, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_0: Wow, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s hard to believe that Swampert of yours was once a tiny, adorable Mudkip. Pokémon really are incredible!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_1: Swampert tend to make nests near beautiful beaches, and it’s strong enough to tow a large ship.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_2: I guess you know which Pokémon to bring with you on your next beach vacation, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_3: You know, the last time I saw Mudkip appearing en masse like they are today, I also saw all manner of Trainers out exploring and researching, too.
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_4: It always fills me with joy to see everyone having fun with Pokémon. I hope you’ve enjoyed yourself today as well!
quest_special_dialogue_mudkt_3_5: As for me, I think it’s time I stomp on home. I’ll be in touch!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_0: Hmm... It’s not like they sprouted legs and walked off, so what could have—
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_1: Oh, %PLAYERNAME%! Sorry, I didn’t notice you there. I’m trying to figure out where my Pinap Berries went. Maybe you could help me figure it out!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_2: You see, Pinap Berries have been particularly abundant around here as of late. I’ve never seen so many growing at once!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_3: It’s like the soil’s been filled with nature’s energy.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_4: Pinap fan that I am, I picked a basketful to juice and set it down right over there, but I got distracted reading this paper on regional differences in Slowpoke.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_5: And when I turned around, the whole basket was empty!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_6: I suppose now I have a wonderful excuse to go for a stroll and gather more...but all the same, I’m curious why they vanished in the first place.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_0_7: While I pick more Berries, %PLAYERNAME%, can you poke around and see if any Pokémon in the area might be responsible?
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_1_1: Excuse my sudden wobbling. I take it you’ve found yourself some Noibat! Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_1_2: For the record, even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to Noibat’s ultrasonic waves!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_1_3: At any rate, I think you’ve found our culprit, since fruits are its favorite foods. That must be why they swiped my Pinap Berries! Well, I’m always more than happy to share with Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_1_4: But there’s a silver lining to finding our Berry bandit—now we’ve got the perfect Pokémon to research today.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_1_5: See if you can attract more Noibat with Pinap Berries, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_2_0: Well done, %PLAYERNAME%! Those Noibat sure look happy.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_2_1: I suppose Noibat and I share an appreciation for Pinap Berries, huh? And it’s no phase, I assure you—Noibat’s love of fruit persists even after evolving into Noivern.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_2_2: Although Noivern have a violent disposition, if you give them a nice ripe fruit that they love, they will suddenly become tame.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_2_3: Y’know, there’s an idea—why not help your Noibat evolve into Noivern, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_2_4: I reckon the Pinap Berries you fed them will keep that temper of theirs at bay!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_0: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%! I must say, your Noivern looks pretty chipper.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_1: My research says that this Pokémon is often aggressive and will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark. Yikes!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_2: Luckily for us, your Noivern looks quite fond of you! I’m sure you’ll continue to be great friends, even if you don’t have its beloved fruits on hand.
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_3: Thanks for spending the day learning with me. It’s always fun when we find something we have in common with Pokémon, don’t you think?
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_4: Of course, I’m talking about a love of Berries—not sharing a cruel disposition!
quest_special_dialogue_noibat_3_5:
I hope you’d agree with that, right, %PLAYERNAME%?
...Right?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_0: Hi there! It’s so nice to meet you, %PLAYERNAME%. My name is Professor Willow. I’m a Pokémon researcher, and I’ll be guiding you on your journey—and what a journey it shall be!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_1: You’ll also be helping me with my research along the way. So really, we’re more like colleagues!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_2: First things first—let’s go over how to catch Pokémon, make a Curveball Throw, and transfer Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_3: You can catch Pokémon with Poké Balls.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_4: If you throw a Poké Ball at the center of the Pokémon and time your throw just right, you can even achieve a Nice, Great, or Excellent Throw!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_5: Curveball Throws are advanced throws that can help you grow even more as a Trainer. To make a Curveball Throw, spin the Poké Ball as you throw it.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_6: It’s OK if you don’t get it at first. That’s what practice is for!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_7: Once you’ve caught some Pokémon, you can keep them in your Pokémon storage or transfer them to my mobile lab in exchange for Candy.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_0_8: I’ll explain more about Candy later. For now, how about you go catch some Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_0: Hello again, %PLAYERNAME%! How was catching Pokémon? Not too bad after the first few tries, right?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_1: Soon, you’ll be making Excellent Curveball Throws as easily as a Goldeen swims in water!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_2: Next, I’d like to talk to you about an item that I’ve created called Incense.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_3: It emits a fragrance that is irresistible to Pokémon, making them come to you, instead of having you go to them! Handy, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_4: If you know you’re going to be out adventuring for a while, using Incense can really boost the amount of Pokémon you encounter. It’s one of my favorite items.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_5: Speaking of items, have you heard of Berries? There are several different types that Pokémon enjoy eating, and they each have different effects.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_6: For example, Nanab Berries calm Pokémon down, making it easier for you to aim a Poké Ball at them.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_1_7: How about you give these items a try? Go ahead and use an Incense to attract Pokémon. Then, use Nanab Berries to help you catch them!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_0: Hello again, %PLAYERNAME%! Great work using Incense and Berries to help you catch Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_1: If you’re ever running low on Berries or Poké Balls, you can visit PokéStops to get more.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_2: Spinning the Photo Disc at a PokéStop can grant you those items as well as other goodies. You can also get Field Research tasks by doing so, which you can complete to encounter Pokémon or receive items.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_3: PokéStops are usually located at interesting places, like a monument, a public park, or a local café.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_4: They encourage Trainers to explore the world around them. Isn’t that exciting?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_2_5: Why don’t you go do some exploring? Who knows—you might discover some interesting places!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_0: Welcome back, Trainer! I just returned from a stroll myself. One thing I love about Field Research is how it always manages to take me to new and exciting locations.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_1: I hope you get to learn a bit more about the world around you as you seek out different PokéStops!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_2: And as fun as that will be, it’ll be even more fun if you bring along a Buddy Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_3: Building strong relationships with your Pokémon is pivotal to being a good Trainer—and choosing a Pokémon to be your buddy is a great way to do just that!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_4: You can choose any Pokémon to be your Buddy Pokémon. It can even walk alongside you while you’re out exploring!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_5: To get your buddy to join you on your adventures, give it some treats, such as Berries.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_6: You can boost your friendship with your Buddy Pokémon even further by playing with it, taking photos of it, and battling with it.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_7: Eventually, your Buddy Pokémon can even become your Best Buddy and gain a Best Buddy ribbon! You’ll also earn additional Candy when you walk around with it.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_3_8: We’ll cover the importance of Candy later, but for now, how about you pick out a Buddy Pokémon and spend some time with it?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Wow, your Buddy Pokémon’s looking pretty pleased! Seeing your bond grow stronger warms my heart.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_1: Keep taking care of your Pokémon to make your relationship flourish!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_2: I see you’ve earned some Candy while exploring with your buddy, too. It’s now time to learn how you can get more Candy, as well as what you can use it for.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_3: You can earn Candy by catching, transferring, and adventuring with Pokémon. You can then use that Candy to power up and evolve your Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_4: You’ll also need Stardust, which you can earn by catching Pokémon, hatching Eggs, completing research, and opening Gifts.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_5: Evolving Pokémon helps you fill out your Pokédex and learn all about your Pokémon’s potential. There are even some Pokémon that evolve in unique ways.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_6: Be sure to check the Pokémon in your Pokémon storage to learn more about how to evolve them. You’ll also be able to power up your Pokémon there.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_7: If you need help figuring out which Pokémon to power up and evolve, you can ask your team leader to appraise your Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_4_8: You should have some Candy and Stardust from completing previous research tasks. How about you use them to evolve and power up some Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_0: Incredible work, %PLAYERNAME%! Your Pokémon look stronger than ever. Did you learn anything new while evolving and powering up your Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_1: When I see a Pokémon discover new possibilities within itself, it makes me feel like I’m capable of anything, too!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_2: But as exciting as that all is, there’s just as much to learn about Pokémon in some of their earliest forms, too.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_3: Next, we’re going to discuss Eggs and Pokémon that can hatch from them.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_4: You can get 2 km, 5 km, and 10 km Eggs by spinning PokéStops, and you can get 7 km Eggs by opening Gifts from your friends.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_5: To hatch these Eggs, you’ll need to place them in an Incubator and travel the indicated distance.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_6: If you want to hatch Eggs even faster, Super Incubators decrease the distance required to hatch Eggs. Be sure to use these Incubators wisely.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_7: You’ll be able to get Eggs in other ways, too.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_8: For example, you can get Strange Eggs by defeating Team GO Rocket Leaders. As you go on your Trainer journey, you’ll have opportunities to take on Team GO Rocket and obtain these Eggs.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_5_9: You should have a handful of Eggs already. How about you get to hatching some?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_6_0: Look at all the Eggs you’ve hatched, %PLAYERNAME%! What an accomplishment.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_6_1: Being a dedicated Trainer takes quite a bit of work, wouldn’t you say? Even so, you can’t forget to have fun along the way.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_6_2: You’ll see in your Item Bag that you have a camera. You can use this camera to take snapshots of your Pokémon and commemorate all sorts of moments and memories.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_6_3: You can take a snapshot when encountering wild Pokémon, when viewing your Pokémon in your Pokémon storage, and when interacting with your buddy.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_6_4: How about you give it a shot? A...snapshot, that is. Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_0: %PLAYERNAME%, I’ve been looking through the photos you took, and I have to say, I’m quite impressed!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_1: Have you considered moonlighting as a Pokémon photographer? You certainly have the chops for it!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_10: An important part of battling effectively is using attacks that are super effective against the Pokémon defending the Gym.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_11: Different Pokémon and their attacks have different types, and those types have weaknesses to other types. For example, Fire-type Pokémon are weak against Water-type attacks.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_12: I’d like for you to try using supereffective attacks when battling at a Gym. Try using Charged Attacks of different types to see which ones work best.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_13: Let’s see what you’re made of, %PLAYERNAME%! Get out there and battle in some Gyms.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_2: Do you recognize these structures? I’m sure you’ve come across them in your photographic forays.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_3: They’re called Gyms, and they’ll prove to be quite important in your Trainer journey.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_4: Gyms are always one of four colors, depending on which team controls them.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_5: Red Gyms are controlled by Team Valor, led by the headstrong Candela. Blue Gyms are controlled by Team Mystic, headed up by the analytical Blanche.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_6: Yellow Gyms are controlled by Team Instinct, whose proud leader is the incomparable Spark. He’s known for following his gut.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_7: Gray Gyms are neutral, meaning that no team controls them.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_8: If a Gym is controlled by your team, you can assign a Pokémon to defend it. Gyms can have up to six Pokémon defending them at a time.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_7_9: If a Gym is controlled by another team, you can battle to try to claim it. Find a Gym that’s controlled by a different team, and give battling a shot!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_0: How was your Gym experience, %PLAYERNAME%? A unique kind of workout, isn’t it? Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_1: Anyhoo, did you notice that at some Gyms, you were faced with a single Pokémon instead of Gym defenders?
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_2: Those Pokémon are called Raid Bosses, and you can challenge them in Raid Battles!
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_3: In Raid Battles, you can battle alongside friends and other Trainers to challenge a Raid Boss.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_4: These Pokémon are formidable foes, indeed. Sometimes, you can find certain Pokémon only as Raid Bosses.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_5: Before entering a Raid Battle, make sure to power up your Pokémon! Stocking up on lots of Candy and Stardust will allow you to bring powerful teams to Raid Battles.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_6: Power up some Pokémon, then try taking on a raid. If you don’t succeed, you can team up with other Trainers.
quest_special_dialogue_onboard_sr_8_7: You’ll never know what you’re capable of until you try, right?
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m hoping you can help me with something. You see, I was out for a walk recently and noticed several trees covered in slash marks—and I think I know what made them.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_0_1: There’s a Pokémon called Oshawott—the Sea Otter Pokémon—that keeps a scalchop on its stomach that it can detach and use as a blade. I’ve seen a lot of Oshawott around lately, so I’m thinking they may be our mystery tree carvers.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_0_2: Could you catch some Oshawott so we can learn more about them?
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Did you know that Oshawott uses the scalchop on its stomach not only to fight but also to break open hard berries? Gotta love a good multitool.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_1_1: Now that we’ve learned more about Oshawott, I was hoping we could turn our attention to its Evolution, Dewott. Don’t let its cute appearance fool you—Dewott takes itself very seriously.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_1_2: Also known as the Discipline Pokémon, Dewott uses strict training to learn its flowing double-scalchop technique. I’d love to see Dewott’s fighting in action! Can you evolve your Oshawott for me, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_2_0: Wow, Dewott’s double-scalchop technique is incredible! Pokémon truly never cease to amaze, eh, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_2_1: I barely have the coordination to rub my tummy and pat my head at the same time, and here we have Pokémon mastering bespoke battle techniques. It’s inspiring stuff!
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_2_2: I think I’ve gained a better understanding of Dewott—which means we can begin studying its Evolution.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_2_3: Dewott’s Evolution, Samurott, is known to wield swords called seamitars incorporated in its armor. Apparently, Samurott can draw and sheathe its seamitars in the time it takes a foe to blink.
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_2_4: Not hard to see why it’s known as the Formidable Pokémon! Why don’t you evolve Dewott so we can witness Samurott’s majesty for ourselves?
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_3_0: Excellent work, Trainer! That’s a fine Samurott. Its seamitars truly are a sight to behold! Knowing how quickly it can draw and sheathe its blades, I wonder how fast it can dice up berries...
quest_special_dialogue_oshat_3_1: Thanks for all your help today, %PLAYERNAME%. We’ve learned so much about Oshawott, Dewott, and Samurott—and from them, too! I’ll “sea” you next time! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%! You’ll never guess what I saw on my walk earlier. It was a pond full of Poliwag!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_0_1: Poliwag tend to stay in water because they’re unsteady on their newly grown legs.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_0_2: They seem to aspire to land-based locomotion, though, so they do their best to waddle along when they get out of the water.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_0_3: Isn’t that moving? Those little Pokémon, trying their best against the odds to improve themselves... *sniff*
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_0_4: We could all learn something from Poliwag about stepping out of our comfort zones. How about you take the chance to observe some now?
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. How did your observations go? Did you see any Poliwag waddling around?
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_1_1: Some researchers recommend that Trainers bring their Poliwag on walks every day to strengthen its legs.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_1_2: Of course, such regimented training isn’t necessary for Poliwhirl, Poliwag’s Evolution. Its two legs are well developed, and it can be seen marching all over in search of bug Pokémon to eat.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_1_3: Why don’t you try evolving a Poliwag, %PLAYERNAME%? But be careful you don’t look at Poliwhirl’s swirl for too long. I’ll tell you about THAT when you get back!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_1: Do you see the distinctive swirl on its belly? Staring at it causes drowsiness.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_10: So, are you curious to see Poliwhirl’s Evolutions for yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_2: In fact, parents have been known to use it in place of lullabies to help their children go to sleep.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_3: It’s a great Pokémon to have around when you’re struggling with insomnia, but less so when you’re *yaaawn* in the middle of...
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_5: ...Ack! Sorry, %PLAYERNAME%—looking at your Poliwhirl almost put me to sleep! Now, where was I? Ah, yes! Another special trait of Poliwhirl’s is that it can evolve into two different Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_6: First, we have the brawny Poliwrath. Its body is solid muscle.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_7: When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drifting ice and plow forward.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_8: And second, we have the commanding Politoed! It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_2_9: Its cries sound like screams, but they actually served as inspiration for a beautiful ballad. I’d sure love to hear it!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_3_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! What Pokémon did you decide to evolve your Poliwhirl into?
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_3_1: Poliwrath? Politoed? One of each, perhaps?
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_3_2: Whatever the case, remember to approach your research like a Poliwag learning how to walk—one step at a time!
quest_special_dialogue_poliwag_3_3: Thanks for all your help today, %PLAYERNAME%. I’m feeling inspired after seeing your Poliwag’s journey, and I hope you are, too!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_1: Your timing is impeccable. Because you know what? I’ve had enough!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_2: That’s right—I’ve had enough of waiting to see a guardian deity. Everyone but me has managed to glimpse one out of pure serendipity, so I’ve decided to be proactive and embark on a search for Tapu Fini!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_3: Do you think you could lend me a hand? With you involved, I think my chance of success will skyrocket.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_4: Tapu Fini is the guardian deity of Poni Island in the Alola region.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_5: Terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini, so I’m going to think very carefully about how we can successfully—and safely—track it down.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_0_6: In the meantime, can you see what Team GO Rocket is up to? I’d like to avoid any complications in our search.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_1_1: I’ve been busy researching Tapu Fini. My sources say that it can manipulate water, and it lives deep within a thick fog.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_1_2: With that in mind, I’d hazard a guess that we’ll have the most luck uncovering Tapu Fini’s whereabouts if we look in places where other Water-type Pokémon are appearing.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_1_3: I’ll start by visiting every foggy lake I can find. I can hear Blanche’s water safety spiel already...
quest_special_dialogue_poni_1_4: But, personally speaking, a bit of risk is worth it if I finally get to see an island guardian with my own eyes! You remember to be careful, too, okay?
quest_special_dialogue_poni_1_5: Now, let’s get back out there!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_2_1: I was knee-deep in the last lake I thought to check—shoes soggy, Dewpider on all sides—when I finally, FINALLY, saw Tapu Fini!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_2_2: I’d love to tell you more about it, but I need to scribble down all the details in my journal while they’re fresh in my mind.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_2_3: You should head out and see if you can catch a glimpse of Tapu Fini yourself!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_0: Phew! Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. How’d you fare?
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_1: You saw Tapu Fini as well?! That’s fantastic!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_2: Now you’ve seen all four of Alola’s guardian deities. And I’ve seen...all of one.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_3: That’s... Well, it’s one more than I’d seen before, isn’t it!
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_4: Just have to stay positive. No use feeling jealous of others’ good fortune...
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_5: Now that we know all the island guardians are nearby, we should look into why they’ve appeared here.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_6: Were the cause some unsavory act on our part, I think they would have confronted us directly by now—but instead, we’ve been the ones tracking them down.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_7: It’s certainly possible their motives have nothing to do with us. Though I have to assume they’re investigating the area for a reason.
quest_special_dialogue_poni_3_8: But what could that reason be? I suppose all we can do for now is wait and see what happens.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_0_0: Ah, %PLAYERNAME%! Can you believe our luck? It’s a wonder to see so many Popplio gathered in one place.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_0_1: I’ve heard these hardworking Pokémon can inflate balloons with their noses. How fascinating!
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_0_2: They practice diligently so they can learn to make bigger and bigger balloons.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_0_3: Studying the Sea Lion Pokémon will surely be a show. Why don’t you try catching one so we can see these skills up close?
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_1_0: Fantastic job, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m glad to see Popplio’s acrobatic prowess didn’t get the better of you!
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_1_1: Blowing up those balloons isn’t just for show, you know.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_1_2: In battle, the sheer force of the bursting balloons can damage opponents.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_1_3: Popplio’s charm doesn’t end there, either. Try evolving your Popplio into Brionne, and you’ll see what I mean!
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_2_0: You did it, %PLAYERNAME%! Your Brionne has a magnetic stage presence. Just look at it go—it’s quite the performer!
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_2_1: Have you been teaching it some new moves?
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_2_2: Brionne is bound to be an entertaining new companion. I’ve heard that when their Trainers are feeling down, Brionne perform a cheery dance to help perk them up.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_2_3: You know, your Brionne may be ready to take its talents to the next stage. Let’s evolve this dancer into Primarina!
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_3_0: Bravo, %PLAYERNAME%! Just look at your magnificent Primarina. This songstress takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_3_1: I’m feeling quite starstruck by its fantastical appearance, myself! ...Do you think I can get an autograph?
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_3_2: Thank you for helping me fine-tune my research today. I hope you and Primarina finish today on a high note.
quest_special_dialogue_popplio_3_3: I can’t wait to see how far you can take its career—both on and off the stage of battle!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s great to see you again! I’m always grateful to have a helping hand with my research.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_0_1: Speaking of research, have you heard of Porygon, the Virtual Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_0_2: Well, I’m not entirely sure why, but Porygon have been appearing more frequently in the area as of late!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_0_3: I’d like to take this opportunity to learn more about this odd Pokémon. How about it, Trainer? Will you go out and catch some Porygon for me?
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_1: I was able to review the data you collected, and I discovered that Porygon is made entirely of programming code!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_2: Other reports I dug up mention that it was created by a group of scientists using state-of-the-art technology. Can you believe it? A man-made Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_3: Porygon have made a name for themselves by protecting cyberspace from suspicious activity! For something artificial, they sure do seem caring.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_4: Maybe I should keep a Porygon around in case Team GO Rocket tries a digital take-over...
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_5: Well, in the meantime, I’d like to learn more about Porygon’s evolved form, Porygon2.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_1_6: I have a hunch that you’ll need to use an Upgrade to evolve Porygon. Let's get back out there and see if we can't find one!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_1: Thanks to your efforts, I’ve realized just how different Porygon2 is from Porygon.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_2: According to my findings, further research and the implementation of artificial intelligence into its code allowed Porygon2 to develop the ability to learn independent of its programming.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_3: The power of science is just astounding, isn’t it?
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_4: These reports also mention that Porygon2 was upgraded to enable extraterrestrial exploration and planetary development, though it has yet to accomplish much.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_5: I wonder what this means for Porygon’s final Evolution, Porygon-Z?
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_2_6: For your next batch of research, I want you to evolve Porygon2 into Porygon-Z using a Sinnoh Stone. Good luck out there, Trainer!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_0: Congrats on evolving your Porygon2 into a Porygon-Z, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_1: I’ve uncovered some notes about this Pokémon that I thought you’d find interesting.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_2: According to reports, an update was added to Porygon-Z’s programming that was supposed to allow it to move between dimensions. But the upgrade also caused Porygon-Z to become unstable, and it began behaving erratically.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_3: Because the update caused instability, academics can’t seem to agree on whether Porygon-Z should be considered a true Evolution of Porygon2.
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_4: It’s going to take a bit of time to file away all this research, but I’m thrilled we were able to learn more about Porygon and its Evolutions!
quest_special_dialogue_poryt_3_5: Your hard work is always appreciated, %PLAYERNAME%, and I’ll be in touch as soon as I’m in need of another inquisitive eye!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%, you’re not going to believe this!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_1: Have you seen those Poké Ball–like Pokémon rolling about?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_10: This all begs the question: why are Hisuian Voltorb appearing now after being absent for so long? Did they somehow travel to the present from the Sinnoh region of the past?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_11: I have a theory that when Team GO Rocket broke open the mysterious door, it somehow caused these Hisuian Voltorb to appear in our time.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_12: Now why am I suddenly reminded of Celebi, the Time Travel Pokémon...
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_13: Anyway, that’s all I’ve got! Kind of unbelievable, isn’t it?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_14: I’m going to do some more digging on my end, and I’d love your help researching these bygone Pokémon out in the field!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_2: They look an awful lot like Voltorb—a Pokémon native to the Kanto region, among others—but I’ve never seen any Voltorb quite like these.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_3: I reached out to everyone I could think of and pored over all the research documents I could get my hands on, but get this: nothing in modern scholarship mentions this Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_4: However, I did eventually find something. Did you know that the Sinnoh region used to be known as the Hisui region?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_5: Well, I found historical documentation of an old-fashioned Poké Ball developed long ago in the Hisui region, and I realized it greatly resembles this mysterious Pokémon. Or could it be the other way around?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_6: Which came first: the Poké Ball or the Pokémon? Who knows!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_7: Taking all this into consideration, I believe this anomalous Pokémon is, in fact, a Voltorb that once lived in the Hisui region.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_8: Is it still a regional variant if it only existed in the past? Gosh, what a puzzle.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_0_9: For now, I suppose we may as well call this Pokémon Hisuian Voltorb.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_1: Can you believe Pokémon from a different time are now appearing around us?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_10: Anyway. Our research sure has been exciting lately, hasn’t it, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_11: Something tells me we’re in for even more exciting discoveries!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_12: Let’s keep at it and see what else our adventure together brings.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_2: I wonder what this Pokémon has seen in the Hisui region—and what it thinks of the future it’s suddenly seeing now!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_3: Ah, the Hisui region... I wonder what other kinds of Pokémon lived there.
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_4: What I wouldn’t give to go back in time and experience the Hisui region for myself! It’d be a dream come true!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_5: Maybe if I ever meet Celebi, I could ask it for a quick trip back in time, just to sate my curiosity!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_6: ...But I’m sure that’s not possible. It’s nice to dream, though!
quest_special_dialogue_power_jan22_1_7: Anyway, I’ve decided to research whether Hisuian Voltorb can evolve.
