quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_2: I feel confident that when the time comes, you’ll be prepared to encounter any of these amazing Legendary Pokémon—regardless of which forme they appear in.
quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_3: Now—do you remember that strange experience I had where my dream began fading inexplicably? I think I may have finally uncovered the cause.
quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_4: While consulting the Pokédex for possible culprits, I came across an entry for a Pokémon called Munna. It’s known as the Dream Eater Pokémon—so you can see why it caught my eye!
quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_5: Munna is said to eat the dreams of both people and Pokémon, expelling mist as a result. The mist is pink if the dream is pleasant, and black if it’s a nightmare.
quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_6: I was pretty pleased to be dreaming of those Unovan Legendary Pokémon again, so I suspect Munna’s mist was nice and rosy that day!
quest_special_dialogue_season2_4_7: Munna seems like a fascinating Pokémon, and I can’t wait to research it more. I hope you’ll give me a hand when the time comes, Trainer! Now, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m glad you’re here. A new adventure is about to begin!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_1: Not long ago, various Legendary Pokémon began emerging from mysterious rings that suddenly appeared in the sky. After some research, we discovered it was Hoopa, the Mischief Pokémon, that was responsible.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_2: Hoopa’s rings allow it to teleport things—including itself—wherever it wants. That power makes it hard to track down, but for some reason, Hoopa seems to keep returning to this area.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_3: How do I know? Well, I was doing some lab work recently when my glasses were lifted straight off my head. Spark was there assisting me, and he said he saw a small, lavender-colored hand emerge from a ring and snatch my glasses. Pretty cheeky, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_4: Luckily, he and Candela managed to retrieve my spectacles by chasing down the rings that were popping up at random around my mobile lab. So, at least I can still see. Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_5: Needless to say, I’m still not sure why Hoopa’s here. Tracking it down has been difficult, but with your help, I’m sure we’ll crack the case in no time!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_0_6: For now, why don’t you try using an Incense to see what Pokémon you can find in the area?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_1: BOO! Haha, did I scare you? Not too badly, I hope.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_2: Let’s continue our investigation into these eerie events. Don’t worry—I won’t send you into any rickety mansions or foggy forests.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_3: I was actually doing some research near a forest myself recently, and I found a rather odd-looking tree. I’ve learned over the years to trust my gut when something seems strange in the field—chances are it’s a Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_4: I couldn’t help but indulge my curiosity, and I stepped toward the tree to observe it more closely. As soon as I did, the tree pivoted on its roots and stared me down with a single red eye!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_5: It didn’t take long for me to realize I was standing before a Trevenant, the Elder Tree Pokémon. Trevenant will trap people who harm their forest, never allowing them to leave.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_6: It must have sensed that I was just there for research because it turned back around and ignored me. Its attention then turned to the many Phantump gathered around it.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_7: That’s when I realized that Trevenant was harvesting Berries from the nearby trees to feed the Phantump! Trevenant is known to offer great kindness to forest-dwelling Pokémon, and it was lovely to witness it myself.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_8: Ghost-type Pokémon can seem frightening at first glance, but look a little closer and you’ll find they’re full of surprises. I’m sure the same goes for Hoopa!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_10_9: I have a feeling there’s more to Hoopa than its penchant for mischief. Maybe we’ll find some answers after we conduct some more research on Ghost-type Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_11_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! As we close out our spooky investigations, I have a feeling there are some bright things on the horizon for us to explore together soon. I’ll be sure to let you know when I have something to share!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_0: Well hello, %PLAYERNAME%! Welcome back. It’s around this time of year that nights in the Northern Hemisphere begin growing longer and longer. The sun shines brighter while it’s up, though, so it’s a pretty fair trade!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_1: If you ask me, this is a prime opportunity to ponder the power of light and darkness—both literally and metaphorically. I wonder what darkness our little friend Hoopa has had to overcome? I have a feeling its mischievous reputation may hang over it like a shadow at times.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_2: What’s more, I can’t help but wonder how and why its power was confined.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_3: Pokémon are an endless source of mystery. We may never know all their secrets, but it’s a researcher’s job to shine a light into the darkest depths of the unknown and illuminate whatever answers we can!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_4: For me, darkness is an opportunity to learn something new. To make discoveries! We’ve learned so much about Hoopa in our research, and in some ways, I think we may have learned a bit about ourselves, too.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_12_5: But enough of my rambling! How about you head on out there and enjoy the light, %PLAYERNAME%? You’ve earned it.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_13_0: I’m glad to see you again, Trainer! I was out on a walk and got to thinking about your journey with Hoopa thus far.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_13_1: It seems that Hoopa’s really taken a shine to you. Do you think it may show us more of its power soon? A professor can dream, I suppose.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_13_2: Why don’t you check back again in a bit, %PLAYERNAME%, after you’ve spent a tad more time with Hoopa.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_0: I’m glad to see you, %PLAYERNAME%. I wish I had better news, but it looks like Team GO Rocket is stirring up trouble once again!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_1: While out on patrol, Spark and Candela overheard some Team GO Rocket Grunts discussing the organization’s next move. They want to capture Hoopa! It seems their orders came straight from Giovanni himself.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_2: I shudder to think that all this time Giovanni may have been lurking in the shadows just behind us, reaping the benefits of our research. Scheming as we studied Hoopa...
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_3: There’s no time to lose—we have to stop them! Hoopa Unbound is incredibly powerful, and I have no doubt that Giovanni intends to use it for some sinister purpose.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_4: You know better than most, %PLAYERNAME%: Hoopa may be capable of terrifying things, but it’s still a Pokémon. It must be protected!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_14_5: We’ve also gotten word that Giovanni has turned another Legendary Pokémon into a Shadow Pokémon! The team leaders and I will do what we can, but we’ll need your help if we’re to defeat Giovanni, save the Legendary Shadow Pokémon, and keep Hoopa safe.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_15_0: Incredible work, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve successfully defeated Team GO Rocket yet again and saved another Legendary Shadow Pokémon—and Hoopa, too!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_15_1: Speaking of Hoopa, I have a sneaking suspicion that because of your kindness, we might just be lucky enough to witness it as Hoopa Unbound someday soon. What a sight that will be, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_15_2: We’ve come a long way in our research, and unlocking Hoopa’s true power may be the final trial in this mysterious saga. Are you ready, Trainer? Let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_1_0: As with all great mysteries, solving this will take time, patience, and trust. I’ll need to work alone at some points, but I promise I’ll return to share my findings and help propel us forward.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_1_1: You just keep exploring the world as you always do. You never know what you might find!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_1_2: I’ll report back here once I have more information on Hoopa. Thanks in advance for your help, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s so good to see you again. Have you managed to spot Hoopa anywhere?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_1: Although some think of Hoopa as a mischievous troublemaker, really all it wants to do is have fun!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_2: Speaking of fun, it seems Hoopa had a blast filling up my mobile lab with Pinap Berries. Maybe it spotted me happily digging into some during my lunch break and decided I could use a few more.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_3: It was a bit of a surprise when I opened the lab door and piles of Pinap Berries poured out! It took a while to clean everything up—but my lab did smell amazing afterward, so it wasn’t all bad.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_4: It was nice having an excuse to clean—not to mention I have enough Pinap Berries to last me for days. I might even make some jam...
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_5: Anyway, Hoopa sure has seemed a lot friendlier these days, hasn’t it? I think it’s been having lots of fun interacting with us. Maybe that’s why it’s been bringing all sorts of surprises into our world.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_2_6: Who knows—you might be able to catch it now!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_3_0: Wow, %PLAYERNAME%! I can't believe you caught Hoopa!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_3_1: Normally I’d say we’re done with our research, but I wouldn’t be surprised if Hoopa continued to cause mischief.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_3_2: It seems there’s still much for us to learn about this Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_3_3: By the way, I’ve noticed that some Psychic-type Pokémon have been appearing around my lab. Could Hoopa’s presence be the cause?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_3_4: Perhaps we’ll be able to use this as an opportunity to research Psychic-type Pokémon, including Hoopa. I’ll have to investigate this phenomenon further, and I’ll let you know when I’ve learned more. Until next time!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve noticed an increase in the number of Psychic-type Pokémon appearing around my mobile lab of late.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_1: Whenever something like this happens, I can’t help but get excited about researching the cause!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_2: As you may recall, the Mythical Pokémon Hoopa is a Psychic and Ghost type. I have a hunch its recent appearances might be causing the uptick in Psychic-type Pokémon in these parts.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_3: What’s more, I believe we may be able to learn more about Hoopa by researching other Psychic-type Pokémon. There’s one in particular that’s caught my attention: Inkay.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_4: My colleague in the Kalos region told me that Inkay is known as the Revolving Pokémon, and that it evolves in a unique way.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_5: I’m ashamed to say I’ve forgotten the details, but I do remember him saying “upside-down” several times during his explanation. If only I could remember why...
quest_special_dialogue_season4_4_6: Maybe it’s my one-track mind speaking, but I immediately think of Hoopa when I hear “upside-down”—because its appearance turned our world right on its head! Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_5_0: Hey, Trainer! Have you noticed that Hoopa has continued to cause mischief? Its tricks are always unexpected, but I do feel like Hoopa’s brought some welcome color to our lives.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_5_1: Speaking of colorful things, I’ve heard reports that there’s a certain Pokémon nearby that’s known to have multiple appearances. Keep your eyes peeled for me, won’t you?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_5_2: In the meantime, I’m going to analyze everything we’ve learned about Psychic-type Pokémon thus far. Hopefully it’ll point us in the right direction to continue our research on Pokémon forms—and Hoopa!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_6_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve noticed that some Pokémon wearing costumes have been appearing around my lab lately. Isn’t it fun to change up your look every once in a while?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_6_1: Speaking of, have you encountered any Furfrou yet? Also known as the Poodle Pokémon, Furfrou is famous for the variety of looks it can achieve when a Trainer trims its coat—10 in all!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_6_2: Why don’t we stay on the lookout for Furfrou and see if we can learn more about changing its appearance? Who knows—maybe we’ll learn more about other Pokémon along the way!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_0: Great job catching that Furfrou, Trainer! Did you know there are also other Pokémon that’re known to change their appearance? That includes one we’ve spent a lot of time researching lately: Hoopa.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_1: Hoopa is known to have two forms. So far, you and I have seen it as Hoopa Confined, but I hear its power increases astronomically when it becomes Hoopa Unbound.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_2: I wonder if we’ll ever get to witness it ourselves. I suppose all we can do for now is continue our research.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_3: In fact, Blanche has been receiving reports of some spooky occurrences out in the field. We’re not quite sure what the cause is, but like all things lately, we can’t rule out Hoopa’s involvement.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_4: Hoopa’s no stranger to mischief, and you never know how it’ll use its rings next, so I think further investigation is in order.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_7_5: I’ll be sure to share more details with you when I have them, %PLAYERNAME%. Now, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_8_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s nice to see a friendly face—because I’ve been seeing a lot of spooky Pokémon staring at me lately!
quest_special_dialogue_season4_8_1: Do you think this might be Hoopa’s doing? Hoopa’s known to transport Pokémon and people to different places with its rings, so maybe that’s what’s happening here.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_8_2: After all those Legendary Pokémon appeared during this year’s GO Fest—as well as those Pokémon first found in Galar that appeared more recently—I’d say Hoopa’s involvement here is more than likely.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_8_3: Perhaps we can learn more about Hoopa by studying the Ghost-type Pokémon that have begun to show up nearby. Mind giving me a hand, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_season4_9_0: Thanks for conducting that research, Trainer. We certainly know more than we did, but not enough to explain why these spooky occurrences are still...well, occurring.
quest_special_dialogue_season4_9_1: Let’s do a bit more research on Ghost-type Pokémon then, shall we?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_0: Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s great to see you.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_1: I can’t thank you and Rhi enough for bringing me back from beyond the Ultra Wormhole. The two of you are quite the team!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_2: As exhilarating as it was to explore a different dimension, it wasn’t without its challenges. Thoughts of home kept me calm—you, Meltan, the team leaders...
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_3: Maybe it was the sheer strength of those memories, but more than once it seemed almost like I was being surrounded by a protective presence—warm like the sun and calm like the moon.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_4: Who knows—maybe there really was something watching out for me! Our world can’t be the only one full of mysteries, after all.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_5: Speaking of mysteries, I have a new one to share with you, %PLAYERNAME%. Since my return, a small, gaseous Pokémon I’ve never seen before has been hanging around my lab.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_6: It seems friendly, but where did it come from?  Did it follow me from beyond the Ultra Wormhole? Could it be an Ultra Beast?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_0_7: Considering that possibility, I think it would be best if you work with Rhi to raise this Pokémon. Naturally, I’ll be eager to hear anything you may learn in the process.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_0: Greetings, %PLAYERNAME%. So, Professor Willow confirmed he felt a presence like this Legendary Pokémon on the other side of the Ultra Wormhole?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_1: It would seem my theory was correct, then. A Pokémon of its kind protected Professor Willow during his disappearance.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_2: Pokémon are such wonderful creatures. I will have to make note of this behavior.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_3: You’re marvelous too, %PLAYERNAME%—a kind and strong Pokémon Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_4: I am at ease knowing that someone so capable is keeping an eye on the Ultra Beasts.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_5: And more importantly, I am honored to call someone like you a friend.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_6: Ahem. Now, I believe a status report is in order.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_7: This world is sufficiently capable of defending itself against threats from the Ultra Wormholes.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_8: However, we have yet to discern the origin of—or inciting force behind—the Ultra Wormholes. I ran some tests as you conversed with Professor Willow and determined that our Pokémon friend here is not responsible.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_10_9: At least one mystery yet persists. It would seem more adventures lie on the horizon for us, %PLAYERNAME%. Until our next!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_0: Greetings, Pokémon Trainer. With the Ultra Beasts presently at bay, now is an opportune moment to reflect on our time together thus far.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_1: The Ultra Wormholes and the dangers they pose were my primary concerns upon arriving in this world. But now, I find myself equally invested in developing our relationship.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_2: In light of our new rapport, perhaps it is time I reintroduced myself.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_3: I am Rhi of the GO Ultra Recon Squad. It is a pleasure to be your friend, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_4: Is there any objective I may assist you with today?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_5: Your Professor Willow has asked us to rear and study a peculiar Pokémon, is it? Understood.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_6: Ah. I have heard tales of such a Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_7: Its gentle glow is impossible to mistake. I believe this Pokémon is called...Cosmog.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_1_8: Come—let us show Cosmog the beauty of this world.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_0: Hm? You wish to know more of Cosmog?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_1: Some have said that in ages past, it was known as the child of the stars.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_2: Beyond that, few details are known.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_3: Perhaps you and I can shed some light on this peculiar Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_4: Earning its trust seems like a logical first step.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_5: Do you think Cosmog would feel closer to us if it were given a nickname?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_6: Its visage reminds me of outer space... A nebula, perhaps.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_7: But never mind my musings. I will leave the decision to you, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_2_8: No matter the name, I am eager to learn more of Cosmog as we become better acquainted.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_0: Hey, %PLAYERNAME%! Great to see you, as always.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_1: How have you and Rhi been? Have you two learned any more about that mysterious Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_2: Rhi recognizes it, you say? And its name is Cosmog? Incredible! Having a bit of extra-dimensional help really expands our knowledge base.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_3: Still, when it comes to Pokémon research, nothing beats firsthand observation. Have you gleaned anything interesting during your time with Cosmog, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_5: Sounds like Cosmog’s curious, but not very cautious.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_6: I can relate to throwing caution to the wind, but when you’re light enough to be blown away by the slightest breeze... Well.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_7: It’s a good thing you and Rhi are there to make sure Cosmog is safe—just like you were for me!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_3_8: Anyhow, the more time you spend with Cosmog, the more we’ll learn. Let me know when you make more discoveries!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_1: So, Cosmog has evolved into Cosmoem.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_2: Do not be troubled by its current state.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_3: This is its natural biology at work.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_4: Though Cosmoem lies inert, energy is building within its core.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_5: I suspect it is preparing to evolve and will become active again in due time.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_6: Precisely when that will happen is beyond my knowledge, however.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_7: Once Cosmoem evolves, I wonder... Wait. I am struck by a thought. Recall how Willow spoke of a presence “warm like the sun and calm like the moon.”
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_8: I apologize for the abrupt interruption of our conversation, %PLAYERNAME%, but I must make some notes.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_4_9: Please continue your exploration in my absence and apprise Professor Willow of Cosmog’s evolution into Cosmoem.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_5_1: Whoa! Who’s that Pokémon? Did Cosmog evolve?! Just look at that lustrous shell!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_5_2: Rhi’s hypothesis is that this “Cosmoem” will stay in this state until it’s ready to evolve? Excellent theory!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_5_3: It’s definitely easier to get an up-close look at a Pokémon holding still, but what do you think is going on in Cosmoem’s mind? Is it asleep? Maybe it’s dreaming of adventuring with you and Rhi!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_5_4: What else will we learn once it “becomes active,” as Rhi put it? What kind of Pokémon could it become? Unlike our serene friend here, my mind’s buzzing with questions and possibilities!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_5_5: I can’t wait to see what mysteries we’ll unravel, %PLAYERNAME%! Keep taking good care of Cosmoem until then.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_6_0: Still in a holding pattern with Cosmoem, %PLAYERNAME%? Not to worry—sometimes slow and steady is the way to go. I’ll be waiting right here, so come see me when you have an update to share.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_7_2: It appears the time has finally come.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_7_3: We’ll soon be able to observe the splendor of Cosmoem evolving with our own eyes.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_8_1: Splendid! Scintillating, even—to witness such a stunning sight firsthand.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_8_2: This Pokémon holds the power to open Ultra Wormholes. Others of its kind frequently join the GO Ultra Recon Squad in our investigations. They assist us in traversing dimensions.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_8_3: Though it remains to be seen how this particular specimen initially made its way here...
quest_special_dialogue_season8_8_4: I’d like to observe how it acclimates to this world in its new form. Our friend has changed greatly since we first came across it as Cosmog. And you must show Professor Willow this dazzling development.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_8_5: Do be sure to share his impressions with me.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_0: %PLAYERNAME%! Great to see you—and that majestic Pokémon you’ve brought with you!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_1: Unless I’ve gotten my wires crossed, I believe that’s a Legendary Pokémon originally discovered in Alola. How did you come across it?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_3: I’m awestruck! And...struck with the exact same calm, warm feeling I had on the other side of the Ultra Wormhole.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_4: Hmm... Could a Pokémon of this species have been looking out for me?
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_5: Funny, isn’t it? I’m always thinking about how we can protect Pokémon. But it looks like this time, a Pokémon protected me!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_6: I’ve got one more friend to be thankful for, aside from you and Rhi.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_7: I knew leaving Cosmog with you two was the right choice. With your encouragement and guidance, it’s become something truly Legendary!
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_8: Do me a favor, would you? Keep adventuring together and tell me all about your exploits when you have a chance.
quest_special_dialogue_season8_9_9: As for me, well... I think it’s about time I put my old lab coat back on. Don’t you?
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_0_: I’m so glad you’re here. Get this—there’ve been sightings of Shaymin in the area!
Well, it might be more accurate to say “potential sightings,” as I’ve yet to verify the information.
Shaymin lives in common flower patches but is rarely noticed. It’s often mistaken for a flowering plant when curled up—what unique behavior for a Mythical Pokémon!
I can’t help but wonder if we’d know more about Shaymin if only we were a little more observant.
Let’s put that theory to the test and see what we can learn taking a good look around the area, shall we?
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_1_: How did it go, %PLAYERNAME%? Any chance you ran into Shaymin while you were out?
No? Well, that’s OK! I see you got some good snapshots of other Pokémon in the meantime.
Hmm... That gets me thinking. As you might know, the flowers all over Shaymin burst into bloom if it’s lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
I hypothesize that if we take the time to share some thankfulness, we’ll attract Shaymin’s attention.
Not that we need any excuse to celebrate Pokémon, I say! In fact, how about we appreciate them in photo form with some more snapshots, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_2_: Your snapshots look great, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve got a real knack for catching Pokémon—both in Poké Balls and on camera!
And y’know what else you’ve got a knack for? Pokémon battles!
I’m sure you already know that one of the ways you can keep your team in tip-top shape is by powering up your Pokémon. Why don’t you do that and come see me when you’re done?
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_3_: I was just thinking about Shaymin again. One of the many things that makes Shaymin so special is that it has two known forms.
I refer, of course, to its Land Forme and Sky Forme. Land Forme Shaymin is Grass-type, but when it turns into Sky Forme Shaymin, it becomes Grass- and Flying-type.
Some say that it transforms when it takes in the scent of a rare flower.
Perhaps you’re wondering what would happen if a human took a whiff. A researcher from long ago tried just that, but alas, his body remained unchanged.
Ah well. Not all hypotheses hold water. That’s just part of the scientific process!
And speaking of learning, why don’t you spend some time with other Grass-type Pokémon and Flying-type Pokémon? Maybe they’ll inspire you to make some hypotheses of your own!
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_4_: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%. Now you’ve got even more Pokémon to bring along on your journey!
In the spirit of Shaymin being the Gratitude Pokémon, let’s show some gratitude to our old and newfound friends alike.
How about taking some snapshots with your Pokémon or feeding them some tasty Berries? I know my beloved Meltan always enjoys a snack—maybe your Pokémon are the same!
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_5_: Your Pokémon are positively glowing, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m sure they appreciated that extra quality time with you.
The more time I spend with Pokémon, the more I appreciate all their unique qualities.
For example, Torchic is oh-so-cuddly. It has fire burning inside it, so hugging it is lovely and warm. Then there’s Mudkip, who contains amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
I could also wax poetic about Treecko, whose feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
And that’s just a scant three Pokémon! I’d love to hear your observations too, %PLAYERNAME%. What unique Pokémon and traits can you observe?
quest_special_dialogue_shaymin_global_6_: It looks happy—I daresay even grateful—to be in the care of an exemplary Trainer like you!
And as long as we’re on the subject, I want you to know I’m incredibly thankful you helped me with my research.
I know it’s not always easy, but I can’t tell you enough how much I appreciate your contributions to my studies.
Studies that never end, I might add. Haha. So rest up, and I’ll be in contact again soon.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_0_0: Hey there %PLAYERNAME%! Hope you’ve been well.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_0_1: The strangest thing happened last night: I noticed a veritable bevy of bobbing, blinking lights bouncing around at the far end of a nearby park—but by the time I’d run over, the area was empty and dark.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_0_2: I have a feeling those flickering lights may somehow be connected to an Electric-type Pokémon, but I can’t be sure!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_0_3: How about we do a little investigating, hm? Maybe those Pokémon are still nearby.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_0: Well, would you look at that! It’s Shinx, the Flash Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_1: Considering all I’ve heard about this cute little creature, I have a theory.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_2: Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its lit-up tail.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_3: Last night’s anomaly was likely a group of Shinx having a chat!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_4: Now that you’ve caught a Shinx, why don’t we do some research into its Evolution, Luxio?
quest_special_dialogue_shint_1_5: Strong electricity courses through the tips of Luxio’s sharp claws. What a shocking combination! Let’s learn more about it, shall we?
quest_special_dialogue_shint_2_0: Well done, %PLAYERNAME%—you’ve got yourself a Luxio!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_2_1: Also known as the Spark Pokémon, Luxio can receive a bit of other Luxio’s electricity by joining their tails together.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_2_2: So, Shinx can use their tails to communicate with one another, and Luxio can gather their tails together to collectively generate powerful electricity. Fascinating!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_2_3: I wonder what else there is to learn about this Pokémon’s Evolutionary line. How about you evolve your Luxio and we find out for ourselves!
quest_special_dialogue_shint_3_0: Ah, Luxray, the Gleam Eyes Pokémon! When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hidden prey—even through thick walls.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_3_1: But seeing through solid objects uses a lot of its electricity, so Luxray sleep for long periods of time to store up energy.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_3_2: What an electrifying revelation! We’ve learned a lot about Shinx and its Evolutions, but I bet there’s still much to discover.
quest_special_dialogue_shint_3_3: Despite all that hard work, it seems you’ve still got a little spark left in you—so why don’t you head back out and see what other adventures await? Let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_0_0: %PLAYERNAME%! It is fortunate you are here. Alarming events have transpired.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_0_1: As I was observing a slow, pink Pokémon, its tail suddenly fell off. I stooped down to pick up the tail, only to discover that the field was covered in more of these detached appendages.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_0_2: The Pokémon in question did not seem perturbed. However, I am. Could a disease be ailing the Pokémon? Are the fallen extremities separate life-forms?
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_0_3: Please assist me in assessing the situation, %PLAYERNAME%.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_0: Hey, %PLAYERNAME%! I saw you and Rhi running around earlier. What’ve you been up to?
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_1: There were Pokémon with their tails falling off? That does sound concerning, but I’ve got a hunch there’s nothing to worry about. Let me have a look!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_2: Hmm... Yep! You’ll both be relieved to know these are just Slowpoke tails. Their tails fall off naturally. The Slowpoke don’t feel any pain when it happens, and their tails grow back, so they aren’t particularly bothered.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_3: Speaking of their tails, did you know that because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor?
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_4: So I hear, at least—I’ve never tasted one myself. Ooh, maybe we should have a picnic sometime!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_1_5: Ahem. Lunch plans aside, I’ll let Rhi know that there’s no cause for concern. Spend more time with the Slowpoke till I’m back, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. Whoa! Not only have you spent more time with Slowpoke, but you’ve helped some evolve, too!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_1: Slowpoke’s pretty special. Not only can it evolve into one of two different Pokémon—Slowbro and Slowking—but each of its Evolutions has regional variants, too.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_2: Slowpoke become Water- and Psychic-type Slowbro when Shellder latch on to their tails. Though usually dim-witted, they seem to become inspired if those Shellder bite down.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_3: Galarian Slowbro, unlike their non-Galarian counterparts, are Poison types.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_4: When a Shellder bites one of them, it sets off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro’s body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokémon. Pretty wild, huh?
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_2_5: Evolve a couple more Slowpoke, and I’ll have some fun facts about Slowking to share when you’re back!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_0: Back so soon, %PLAYERNAME%? You’re faster than a Slowpoke, that’s for sure! Now for those Slowking facts I promised you.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_1: Slowking undertake research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. They have incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, they remain calm and collected.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_2: Galarian Slowking, on the other hand, have something of a spooky bent. While chanting strange spells, these Pokémon combine their internal toxins with what they’ve eaten, creating strange potions.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_3: What do you think would happen if I drank one of those potions? Maybe I’d turn into a Slowking myself. Who knows what I could accomplish with their level of intellect!
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_4: Ah... You’re right, it might be hard for me to communicate like that. Either way, there’s no end to the discoveries we can make about Pokémon together—even if my noggin remains Shellder-free! Haha.
quest_special_dialogue_slowpoke_3_5: The curiosity of friends like you and Rhi will take us far. I hope you two learned something today. Until next time, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_0_1: I just got back from a lengthy stroll in the sunshine. It’s incredible how much a bit of fresh air can affect your energy and mood!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_0_2: But that’s not the only thing that’s got me feeling chipper. You see, I witnessed something quite interesting while I was out and about.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_0_3: Perhaps in response to the abundant sunlight, a congregation of Snivy appears to have formed nearby.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_0_4: I don’t know about you, but this seems to me like a golden opportunity to research the Grass Snake Pokémon. Could you lend me a hand?
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_0_5: They’re known to be fairly calm, so you shouldn’t have much trouble observing them.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_1_1: I have some information for you on why Snivy are so fond of the sun.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_1_2: These Grass-type Pokémon photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. Much like the sunshine they crave, Snivy are quite bright!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_1_3: They were first encountered in the Unova region, where they were known for their intelligence and calm demeanor. Fascinating!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_1_4: While we continue researching their sudden appearance, could you evolve a Snivy for me? I’d like to document its Evolution, Servine.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_1_5: Take care when you do, however—Servine is known for its masterful whipping techniques.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_2_0: Wonderful work, %PLAYERNAME%! That’s a mighty fine Servine.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_2_1: Like Snivy, Servine is known as the Grass Snake Pokémon. It moves along the ground as if sliding. Though it’s far from sluggish, it won’t hesitate to seek out the shadows of thick foliage to avoid attacks.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_2_2: Now that we’ve properly documented Snivy and Servine, I’d like to move on to Serperior, Snivy’s final Evolution.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_2_3: Serperior is known as the Regal Pokémon, and much like Snivy and Servine, it also has a penchant for sunlight. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_2_4: Could you evolve your Servine into Serperior for me, Trainer? It’ll be a great boon to my research, and you’ll have a powerful Grass-type Pokémon to join your journey as well!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_3_0: Fantastic work, Trainer! I have no doubt Serperior will prove a potent asset on your adventures.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_3_1: It has an incredible ability to stop its opponents’ movements with a single glare. Should the opponent prove bold enough to continue, Serperior will give its all in battle.
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_3_2: Having a Pokémon like that by your side would be pretty inspiring, I’d say!
quest_special_dialogue_snivt_3_3: Anyway, thanks again for all your help in this sun-soaked endeavor. I think I’ll take one more walk before the day’s done—can’t let weather like this go to waste!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_0_0: Hey! %PLAYERNAME%! No time to explain—take this Incubator and follow me, quick!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_0: Phew! Appreciate the hustle, %PLAYERNAME%. Did you use that Incubator I gave you?
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_1: I bet you’re curious why we’re in a hurry.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_2: It’s because Elekid ran off—right as I took my eyes off it to put an Egg in that Incubator!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_3: To be fair, this isn’t the first time my Elekid’s gotten a case of the zoomies. I think it just gets restless sometimes. And hey, chasing after it is a great way to get my daily steps in!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_4: As for that Incubator, I had a feeling you’d be up for helping me track down Elekid and thought, “Why not hatch an Egg along the way?”
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_5: Professor Willow tells me you’re no stranger to hatching Pokémon. I’d love to hear all about your escapades, so c’mon, dish!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_1_6: Actually, hold that thought—I think I see Elekid over thataway! After it, %PLAYERNAME%! We can chat on the way!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_0: Wanna hear more about what I’ve been up to?
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_1: Okay, so, I had this wild idea that exposing Pokémon Eggs to different kinds of music might influence what interests they develop as they grow up.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_2: No results yet, but I’ve been making a lotta playlists. Ooh, you should share some of your favorite tunes with me later!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_3: I’m getting excited. Haha. Thinking about Pokémon always amps me up!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_4: Like, how do they instinctively develop so many unique characteristics? And at the same time, they all have their own personalities!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_5: For example, Elekid are known to rotate their arms to generate electricity, but they supposedly tire easily. And then there’s my Elekid, who’s always running off.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_6: That’s what makes my buddy so charming, though! I wouldn’t have it any other way.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_2_7: What’s your Buddy Pokémon like, %PLAYERNAME%? You should ask it to join us while we track down Elekid. I’m itching to see if your buddy’s personality is anything like yours!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_0: A-HA! Elekid spotted dead ahead! And it looks like it’s tuckered itself out.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_1: Our wild Pokémon chase is finally coming to an end.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_2: Y’know, I bet things only went as smoothly as they did because you were here.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_3: I didn’t even have to worry about Team GO Rocket trying to mess with us!
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_4: Come to think of it, they’ve been weirdly preoccupied lately... But hey, I’m not about to look a gift Horsea in the mouth.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_5: Enough about them, though. Thanks again for being my hero today, %PLAYERNAME%! I dunno how long it would’ve taken me to chase down Elekid without your help.
quest_special_dialogue_spark_may23_3_6: Well, I’ve got places to be and Eggs to hatch, but don’t be a stranger! Let’s chat again real soon!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s great to see you again.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_1: I wanted to tell you about what I saw on my morning walk today—a herd of Spheal rolling across an icy lake!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_2: Did you know that a Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_3: When the season for ice floes arrives, Spheal can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_4: They’re also covered in fluffy fur to keep them from feeling cold in icy climes. And I’ll tell you, seeing them tumble to-and-fro warmed me right up, too!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_0_5: Why don’t you go check out some Spheal for yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! I see you’ve brought some Spheal with you. Aren’t they just the roundest?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_1_1: According to my research, the Evolution of Spheal, Sealeo, seems to agree! Sealeo can occasionally be seen entertaining itself by balancing a Spheal on its nose as if juggling a ball.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_1_2: In fact, when Sealeo sees just about anything for the first time, it tends to try juggling it on its nose! Why don’t you evolve your Spheal and see for yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_2_0: Welcome back, Trainer—and hello there, Sealeo!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_2_1: I have some breaking news for you. Remember that icy lake I told you about earlier?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_2_2: Well, it looks like something’s broken it up, and now all the Spheal are splashing around in the water! They seem to be having fun, but I wonder what Pokémon could have caused this.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_2_3: My best guess is Walrein. Walrein is known to swim through frigid water while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Sounds pretty magnificent, if a bit imposing.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_2_4: Can you evolve your Sealeo so we can research Walrein ourselves?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_3_0: You did it, Trainer! Walrein’s tusks really are magnificent up close, aren’t they?
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_3_1: Did you know that Walrein typically gather in herds of about 20 or 30? When a threat appears, the herd’s leader will do whatever it takes to protect the group.
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_3_2: Nice to know they can look after themselves—though considering those tusks, I don’t think that was ever in doubt. Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_3_3: I’m sure your Walrein will protect you in battle as well. You already look like quite a powerful pair!
quest_special_dialogue_sphet_3_4: Thanks for going on this adventure with me today, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve learned a lot from the research you conducted. Until next time, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_0_0: Oh, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve dropped by just in time.
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_0_1: As I was out on my regular walk one evening, I stumbled upon this odd stone. Something told me to bring it back to my lab for further research, and ever since then, strange things have been happening.
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_0_2: Papers shifting around, water glasses tipping all by themselves...
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_0_3: When I tried using my computer to research it, I got an error message with the number 108 flashing! %PLAYERNAME%, can you help gather some data on nearby Ghost-type Pokémon?
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_0_4: I have to believe we can solve these spooky occurrences with science!
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_1_0: %PLAYERNAME%, thanks so much for your help. I did some research on Ghost-type Pokémon, and I think there’s a Ghost- and Dark-type Pokémon that is bound to a strange stone.
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_1_1: I can’t say for sure just yet, but it seems this Pokémon may actually be composed of 108 spirits bound together. So maybe if we catch 108 Pokémon, it will appear?
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_1_2: Good luck, %PLAYERNAME%!  And...would you keep the light on in the lab for me? All this spooky research is making my hair stand on end.
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_2_0: Wow, %PLAYERNAME%! It seems we’ve had a spooky brush with Spiritomb!
quest_special_dialogue_spiritomb_2_1: I can’t tell if it’s the weather, but I’ve got the shivers! You know, I feel confident that we can solve anything together, %PLAYERNAME%, even when things get scary.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_0: Great to see you, %PLAYERNAME%! I was walking through a forest earlier and saw something amazing—fountains of water, coming out of a river!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_1: At first, I wondered who would install a fountain in the middle of nature.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_2: But I saw the flash of a shell, and I realized our mystery architect must be a Squirtle!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_3: Squirtle hide in their shells to protect themselves, then strike with spouts of water at every opportunity. That must’ve been what I saw!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_4: Squirtle is also known as a Pokémon that aspiring Trainers from the Kanto region can choose to be their first-partner Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_0_5: Why don’t you have a look at the Tiny Turtle Pokémon yourself?
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! While you were observing Squirtle, I happened upon a Wartortle with algae growing out of its shell!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_1_1: Wartortle is Squirtle’s Evolution. Ones with algae on their shells are very old, so imagine what that venerable Wartortle must have seen in its years!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_1_2: Why don’t you evolve one of your Squirtle? It’ll be able to keep you company for a good long while.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_2_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! I wasn’t exaggerating when I said Wartortle could keep you company for a long time—they’re said to live for 10,000 years!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_2_1: Their furry tails are a symbol of longevity and become deeper in color as Wartortle age.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_2_2: Isn’t that fascinating? It’s the opposite of humans!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_2_3: And Wartortle don’t just have incredible endurance—they can also grow even stronger. When they evolve into Blastoise, they grow rocket cannons on their shells!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_2_4: If you evolve a Wartortle, you can see it for yourself!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_0: Look at the rocket cannons on that Blastoise, %PLAYERNAME%! As you can see, Blastoise has spouts extending from the top of its shell.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_1: Once Blastoise takes aim at an enemy, it can blast out water with more force than a fire hose.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_2: That might be a fun way to cool down during a scorching summer, eh?
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_3: Blastoise would have to hold back in a pool party, though—some researchers say the jets of water from Blastoise’s rocket cannons can punch through thick steel.
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_4: But with a Trainer like you, I’m sure everything will be under control, whether you and your Blastoise are out for some summer fun or engaged in a fierce battle!
quest_special_dialogue_squirtle_3_5: And speaking of summer fun, I’ve got to get the inflatable pool set up for Meltan. Thanks for spending the day with me, %PLAYERNAME%. I hope you have a blast!
quest_special_dialogue_st_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! You surprised me, much like the Seedot that just fell from that tree over there.
quest_special_dialogue_st_0_1: It really scared a Pidgey that was foraging nearby, and I’m pretty sure it did that on purpose.
quest_special_dialogue_st_0_2: It’s easy for Seedot to trick people and Pokémon alike because Seedot are almost indistinguishable from acorns.
quest_special_dialogue_st_0_3: Are they appearing in higher numbers right now, or am I seeing double? Could you help me investigate this nutty situation?
quest_special_dialogue_st_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! While you were away, I was just refreshing my memory on Seedot.
quest_special_dialogue_st_1_1: Apparently, it attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head and sucks moisture from the tree it’s hanging from. The more water Seedot drinks, the glossier its body becomes.
quest_special_dialogue_st_1_2: Thanks, Seedot, for reminding us to stay hydrated! Did you know that Seedot can evolve? AHHH! Sorry, I was just startled by another one.
quest_special_dialogue_st_1_3: Why don’t you try evolving Seedot? Maybe it’ll get calmer and stop playing pranks on everyone!
quest_special_dialogue_st_2_0: On the one hand, fantastic work, Trainer. Your little Seedot has evolved into Nuzleaf, the Wily Pokémon. On the other hand, our plan to calm Seedot down by evolving it has backfired.
quest_special_dialogue_st_2_1: Apparently, Nuzleaf can make a flute out of the leaf on its head, and the sound of that flute strikes fear and uncertainty into the hearts of people who hear it.
quest_special_dialogue_st_2_2: I’m sorry. But I have faith that a brave Trainer like yourself can handle Nuzleaf just fine!
quest_special_dialogue_st_2_3: Maybe if we try evolving it again...its next form will be less scary! Personally, I’ve been startled enough for one day of research!
quest_special_dialogue_st_3_0: So...your Nuzleaf has evolved into Shiftry, the Wicked Pokémon. Unfortunately, upon reviewing data on Shiftry, I learned it can be quite fearsome, too.
quest_special_dialogue_st_3_1: Using its leafy fan, Shiftry can create wind gusts with speeds of up to one hundred feet per second. That’s strong enough to level houses! I think I need to go tie my mobile lab down!
quest_special_dialogue_st_3_2: I’d rather be surprised by a Seedot than blown away by a Shiftry! Hah...lesson learned—stay up-to-date with Pokémon, even familiar ones!
quest_special_dialogue_st_3_3: Thank you for your help researching this odd occurrence. Once these winds die down, I’ll be in touch about our next research adventure!
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_0: Greetings, Pokémon Trainer. You have arrived at a convenient time. I would like you to assist me.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_1: I am only beginning to grow familiar with the sounds of this world. The rustling of leaves, the crashing of waves...
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_2: But today I hear a new—there!
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_3: That high-pitched chattering and stirring of air. Is it some sort of natural phenomenon?
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_4: So you believe it to be caused by Pokémon. Intriguing.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_0_5: I am eager to locate the source. Let us proceed.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_0: So the multitude of Starly are the source of this cacophony.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_1: Though diminutive, they flap their wings with great power. And when they form a flock...
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_2: I would not wish to be the target of their displeasure.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_3: The strength of such a small creature is a marvel.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_4: And if it were to evolve, I suspect that strength would only grow.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_5: Evolution affects Pokémon in such splendid ways. How will Starly change, do you think? Not another head, surely?
quest_special_dialogue_starly_1_6: After our experience with Deino, little would surprise me. Nevertheless, I would like to witness this transformation for myself.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_2_0: I am impressed yet again, Pokémon Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_2_1: Staravia might not have grown an additional head, but it did increase in size.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_2_2: My early observations indicate that Staravia, too, prefer to travel in a flock.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_2_3: And when Staravia are not surrounded by their kind, they cry noisily. Perhaps they find comfort and security when together.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_2_5: Ahem. Does it evolve further? What changes might that bring?
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_1: This musculature of this Pokémon—Staraptor, is it?—indicates great strength. It appears more than capable of carrying away its prey.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_2: And, unlike Starly and Staravia, it appears not to travel in flocks. Curious.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_3: The Pokémon of this world have such fascinating social structures. Some are more comfortable with others, and some find contentment alone.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_4: They are like humans in this way, do you not think?
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_5: With each investigation we undertake, my understanding of your world is further illuminated.
quest_special_dialogue_starly_3_6: Thank you for your company, Pokémon Trainer. Until again.
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_0_0: *yawn* Hello, %PLAYERNAME%... You’ll have to forgive my appearance, I was up late last night studying some nearby Rowlet. For as sleepy as they can be during the day, they sure perk right up at night!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_0_1: Maybe it’d help me relax if I had a soft, cute Pokémon to hug... Like Stufful!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_0_2: Stufful has an adorable appearance, but it hates to be hugged or touched in any way. Which is a shame because I’ve heard its fur is a delight to pet!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_0_3: I wonder if I’ll ever get the chance to snuggle one—for science, of course! Maybe you could bring me a Stufful, %PLAYERNAME%? Just to look at!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_1_0: %PLAYERNAME%, you’re back! And you’ve brought a Stufful with you! It looks so soft and fluffy...
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_1_1: Er-hem! Despite their looks, Stufful are incredibly dangerous Pokémon. A touch from anyone except a known friend sends Stufful into a surging frenzy!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_1_2: For both our sakes, maybe we’d better befriend it before we try to cuddle—I mean, continue our research, don’t you think? Why not try feeding Stufful a Berry or two, %PLAYERNAME%. Perhaps we can get closer to it that way.
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_2_0: Your Stufful seems friendlier already, %PLAYERNAME%! Speaking of friendly, have you heard that its Evolution—Bewear—has the habit of hugging its companions?
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_2_1: Once Bewear accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. But letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_2_2: Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug...
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_2_3: While I don’t recommend you go hugging a Bewear anytime soon, there isn’t any harm in trying to meet one! Why don’t you evolve Stufful, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_3_0: What a strong-looking Bewear you’ve come back with, %PLAYERNAME%!
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_3_1: What’s that? You say I look a bit more frazzled than usual? Well...I may have tried to pet Stufful while you were away, and its flailing sent me flying so far someone could’ve mistaken me for a bird Pokémon. Haha—ow...
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_3_2: On the bright side, I did get to both pet Stufful and experience its strength firsthand! Come to think of it, I have a colleague studying Pokémon moves who’d love to hear all about this...
quest_special_dialogue_stufful_3_3: I hope you’ve had more luck bonding with your new Stufful and Bewear companions, %PLAYERNAME%. I think I’m going to bow out and grab an ice pack...or six. Thanks for all your help today! Take care, I’ll be in touch!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_0_0: Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! I was just taking a moment to admire the weather here. Blue skies abound, with the fluffiest of clouds floating by.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_0_1: I’d love to just kick back and enjoy the tranquility of it all, but I’ve observed some of the clouds moving rather...strangely.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_0_2: Believe it or not, I believe some of them are actually flapping—yes, like birds!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_0_3: The first few times I saw it, I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me, but as the motions grew more frequent, I began to suspect a Pokémon was involved.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_0_4: Mind going on a little jaunt to see what you can discover?
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_0: Welcome back, Trainer! What have you discovered?
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_1: Ah—Swablu! The Cotton Bird Pokémon. Hmm... It’s all beginning to make sense.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_2: Swablu’s cotton-like wings are so fluffy and white that, alongside their sky-blue bodies, Swablu can be easily mistaken for clouds in the sky.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_3: At least until you catch them flapping, eh? Haha!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_4: Swablu apparently love to sit on people’s heads. They look like fluffy hats!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_5: Ah, and there it goes! Right on your head. Good timing, Swablu!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_6: Fond as they are of their human perches, Swablu will take flight right away if their wings get dirty. Cleanliness begets comfort, after all.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_7: A fascinating Pokémon through and through, don’t you think?
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_8: Evolving Swablu takes some effort, but I assure you—it’s well worth it! I’m sure a Trainer of your talent could gather the necessary Candy in no time.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_1_9: I’d love to see its Evolution in person, so could you evolve your Swablu for me? Be sure to use Pinap Berries to earn even more Candy!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_0: Incredible work, %PLAYERNAME%! Looks like you’ve been hard at work catching Swablu.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_1: Evolving Swablu is truly an act of patience, isn’t it?
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_2: Patience is often called a virtue in a broad sense, but it really is an integral part of being a great Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_3: As the saying goes: good things come to those who wait!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_4: All your hard work will feel justified once you witness your darling Swablu evolve. Of that, you have my word!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_2_5: Just one more leg of this journey left to go, %PLAYERNAME%. Let's go!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_0: Welcome back, Trainer! I see your efforts have paid off. Well done!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_1: Swablu’s Evolution, Altaria, is called the Humming Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_2: It’s known to wrap its wings around the people it’s bonded with—much like yours is doing with you now.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_3: And humming all the while! You know, people say that Altaria’s humming could enrapture an entire audience with its beauty, and it’s not hard to see why.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_4: Between Altaria’s song and your remarkable bond, I have to say I’m feeling quite moved!
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_5: You truly are an incredible Trainer.
quest_special_dialogue_swabt_3_6: Thanks for your help on this latest adventure, %PLAYERNAME%. I’ll never get tired of learning more about Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_0_1: Have you noticed all the Swinub out today? I wonder if there’s something they find enticing buried around here.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_0_2: After all, Swinub rub their snouts on the ground to find and dig up food. Their favorite food is mushrooms that grow under dead grass.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_0_3: In fact, in ancient times, the people of Hisui relied on this skill.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_0_4: Best we don’t interrupt any Swinub mid-snuffle, but we can still spend some time observing them.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_0: You’re right, some mushroom soup does sound good, Meltan—
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_1: Ah, %PLAYERNAME%! Welcome back! Though I should’ve heard you coming with those sniffing Swinub behind you.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_2: Swinub’s Evolution, Piloswine, also has a sensitive nose. And their thick coat of long hair helps them endure freezing cold.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_3: Sounds cozy, doesn’t it? Maybe I should take a hint and grow my beard out during the winter months...
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_4: Ahem. You’re right—I’m sure their hair is different from mine. The cold is nothing a good parka can’t fix, anyway!
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_1_5: Let’s have a look at Piloswine in person.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_2_0: Is that a walking coat or a Piloswine, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_2_1: Aw, not even a chuckle? I didn’t expect my joke to get such a chilly reception! Haha.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_2_2: I’ll make it up to you with a cool fact—Piloswine’s Evolution, Mamoswine, has tusks made of ice! As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_2_3: What do you think Mamoswine’s tusks will look like on a day like this?
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_0: Great work, %PLAYERNAME%! Mamoswine’s tusks really are impressive!
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_1: It’s hard to imagine anything could get the better of a Pokémon this sturdy. In fact, this Pokémon has been around a long, looong time.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_2: I recently read that a frozen Mamoswine was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years ago. And it woke up, to my amazement!
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_3: In a way, seeing a Mamoswine today is like looking back in time.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_4: What other Pokémon that we see today were also around then? How have they changed?
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_5: All fascinating questions that require further research to answer. But what we’ve observed of Swinub, Piloswine, and Mamoswine today is a great start.
quest_special_dialogue_swinub_cdc_3_6: Think on it as you go about the rest of your day, and come back soon to tell me your theories! But until then, thanks for spending the day with me.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_0: Hi there, %PLAYERNAME%. I can’t help but be impressed by your progress. You’ve done fantastic work in researching Pokémon originally discovered in the Kanto, Johto, Hoenn, and Sinnoh regions.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_1: Now that we’ve researched Pokémon that were found in those regions...
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_2: let’s take a closer look at Pokémon originally discovered in the Unova region!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_3: I think it’s fascinating that even though we know a lot about Pokémon from all over the world, there’s always more to learn!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_4: Speaking of discoveries, I’ve been doing some additional research and heard about an interesting phenomenon that has to do with Meowth in the Galar region.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_5: I was speaking to a researcher who’s the granddaughter of a colleague from Galar, and she shared some intriguing information.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_6: It seems that Galarian Meowth lived with seafaring people, which toughened their bodies so much that parts of them turned to iron.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_7: Maybe I could get a few workout tips—I’ve been looking for some ways to toughen up myself!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_0_8: Anyway...let’s do some more research on Pokémon originally discovered in Unova, but be sure to keep your eyes open for other exciting discoveries.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_1_0: Wonderful work, Trainer. You might be familiar with the tradition in which a Pokémon Trainer selects their very first partner from a group of three Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_1_1: These first-partner Pokémon are normally Fire, Water, or Grass types. In Unova, many Trainers choose the Water-type Oshawott as their first-partner Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_1_2: This Sea Otter Pokémon is known to use the scalchop on its stomach during battle. Isn’t that just adorable? Please continue your research, and let me know your findings.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_2_0: I can’t stop thinking about how cute Oshawott is... Oh! You’re back! Excellent work catching that Darumaka!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_2_1: Now that we’ve researched the Water-type first-partner Pokémon of many Trainers from Unova, let’s shift focus to the Fire-type one—Tepig!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_2_2: I’m a particular fan of Tepig because it uses the fireballs that come from its nose to roast Berries. It’s such a clever use of a skill.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_2_3: I just love roasted Pinap Berries! We should continue our work and see what else we can discover.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_3_0: Being the savvy Trainer you are, I’m sure you know which type of Pokémon we’re going to research next.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_3_1: That’s right—Grass type! In Unova, many Trainers choose the Grass Snake Pokémon Snivy as their first partner. Snivy is intelligent and calm, and being exposed to lots of sunlight makes it move more swiftly.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_3_2: Perhaps there’s a lot we could learn from such a sagacious Pokémon!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_3_3: Anyway, let’s get started on these research tasks. Be sure to listen carefully, as you never know what you might encounter!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_4_0: You’re a natural, %PLAYERNAME%. I’m so glad we could research some of the amazing Pokémon originally discovered in the Unova region.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_4_1: I can’t thank you enough for your hard work. I hope you put this Charged TM and Fast TM to good use!
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_4_2: By the way, I literally stumbled across a mysterious Pokémon I’ve never encountered before.
quest_special_dialogue_tcc_4_3: I think you’re the perfect Trainer to take this Pokémon and help it reach its potential. Best of luck, and I’ll be in touch soon!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Glad to see you.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_1: I was just thinking that it’d be interesting to research more about my Buddy Pokémon and the team leaders’ buddies.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_2: The four of us have powerful bonds with our buddies. Blanche has formed a wonderful relationship with Lapras, Candela has had Rapidash since it was a Ponyta, and Spark has developed an electrifying bond with Elekid.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_3: My buddy is the Mythical Pokémon Meltan. Since Meltan and I met, I’ve been documenting everything I learn about it. And trust me—there’s a lot to learn!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_4: I’ve actually heard some reports of Meltan sightings recently. Maybe you’ll run into one on your adventures?
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_0_5: Definitely something to keep an eye out for as we begin our research. But first, let’s stock up on some supplies!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_0: Welcome back, Trainer! Seems like you’re all set to head out on this research adventure. Why don’t we start by looking at the cool pair that is Blanche and Lapras?
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_1: Known as the Transport Pokémon, Lapras is both Water- and Ice-type. A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_2: Lapras are known to have gentle hearts and can even understand human speech. I completely understand why Blanche chose Lapras as a buddy.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_3: That said, Blanche clearly feels a special connection to Lapras.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_4: Blanche got Lapras by trading with a fellow Team Mystic Trainer. I wonder if that has something to do with it.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_1_5: At any rate, let’s focus our research on Water- and Ice-type Pokémon to learn more about the Pokémon that Blanche holds dear.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_0: Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%. It looks like you have your very own Lapras, just like Blanche!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_1: Be sure to tell your Lapras I said hi! I never miss a chance to greet new Pokémon. Now, let’s move on to our next dynamic duo: Spark and Elekid.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_2: The leader of Team Instinct has always had a soft spot for Pokémon that hatch from Eggs, so it’s only natural that he’d have a buddy like Elekid.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_3: But don’t let this Pokémon’s small stature fool you! Spark’s Elekid is incredibly powerful, making it a fitting buddy for the energetic team leader.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_4: Why hasn’t Spark evolved his Elekid? Well, Evolution should be approached with care.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_5: I’m sure Spark will know when Elekid is ready to evolve.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_6: Spark may seem pretty carefree, but few are more committed to the care and training of Pokémon than him.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_2_7: What do you say we research some Electric-type Pokémon that Spark tends to work with?
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_0: How did your research go, Trainer? I think it’s time to turn our attention to some Fire-type Pokémon—specifically the Fire Horse Pokémon Rapidash.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_1: This Pokémon has a competitive streak, making it a great match for Candela, the leader of Team Valor.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_2: Candela has had her Rapidash since it was a Ponyta, so you can be sure the two of them have been on more than a few adventures.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_3: Rapidash loves to run and gallop, so Candela always makes sure her Buddy Pokémon has plenty of time and space to do just that.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_4: That kind of care is critical for building strong, lasting relationships with your Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_5: Candela’s passion and dedication make her a great role model for her fellow Team Valor members—and everyone, really.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_3_6: Maybe researching Fire-type Pokémon will help you learn more about Candela’s fiery spirit?
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Thanks for conducting that research on Fire-type Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_1: Now that we’ve learned more about the Pokémon that Blanche, Spark, and Candela call their buddies, it’s time to do some research on my Buddy Pokémon: Meltan.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_2: I remember when I first met my Meltan. I was out doing some research when I stumbled upon a group of them. I’d never seen a Pokémon like it before, and I wanted to share my findings with my mentor, Professor Oak.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_3: The group of Meltan eventually departed, but one Meltan stuck around, and we’ve been together ever since!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_4: At first, I assumed Meltan only stayed to snack on all the metal knickknacks in my mobile lab. But as time passed, our bond grew stronger, and now we’re practically inseparable.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_5: Our favorite thing is to go on long walks and look for metallic snacks for Meltan. Which reminds me—we still need to look into those reports of Meltan appearing nearby!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_4_6: Let’s do some investigating and see if we can find any Meltan, Trainer!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_0: Well done, Trainer! Thanks to your hard work, you have your very own Meltan!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_1: I’m sure that if you take the time to build up your relationship, Meltan will evolve into Melmetal in no time!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_2: Melmetal stands over eight feet tall. By using centrifugal force, Melmetal can use its heavy hex-nut arms to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_3: But I’m getting ahead of myself. Now is the time to focus on the friendship between you and your Buddy Pokémon—whether it be Meltan or any other Pokémon that you feel a special bond with.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_4: After studying the bonds the team leaders and I have with our Buddy Pokémon, I hope you feel inspired to find a buddy you can grow with as well.
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_5: I’ve no doubt you and your Buddy Pokémon will achieve some incredible things—and Meltan and I will be cheering you on!
quest_special_dialogue_tcg1_5_6: Thank again for your assistance. Until next time, let’s GO!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_0_0: Hey, %PLAYERNAME%! Good to see you again!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_0_1: You know, I thought I smelled something sweet in the air today.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_0_2: Did I spill Berry juice again, you ask? You wound me, %PLAYERNAME%! As if I’d ruin this snazzy new jacket!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_0_3: Heh. In all seriousness, the smell was coming from outside.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_0_4: Unfortunately, I didn’t have a chance to track down the source of the scent. But now that you’re here, maybe you can sniff it out!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_1_0: Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. Seeing as you’ve got Teddiursa with you, I think I can connect the dots on what I was smelling earlier—honey!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_1_1: Teddiursa likes to lick its palms after soaking them in honey, so it’s no wonder I caught a whiff.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_1_2: That reminds me of a fun fact about Teddiursa’s Evolution, Ursaring.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_1_3: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, Ursaring unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground. If only it was that easy for me to find lunch!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_1_4: Why don’t you help Teddiursa evolve so you can see Ursaring’s sleuthing skills for yourself, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_2_0: I thought I heard something stomping about, and here you are, Ursaring in tow!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_2_1: Here’s the thing about Ursaring—although it has a large body, it’s quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_2_2: Ah, to be an Ursaring... Imagine how much easier that’d make fieldwork—or picking Pinap Berries!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_2_3: Ahem. Snacks aside, have you noticed there’s a full moon out early today?
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_2_4: Looks like Ursaring is staring at it, too. Think you can find out why, %PLAYERNAME%?
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_1: I’ve never seen one in these parts. What an incredible find! Hmm...
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_2: Maybe in the Hisui region of long ago, where Ursaluna was first discovered, the full moon played a part in how Ursaring evolved.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_3: It’s theorized that Hisui's swampy terrain gave Ursaluna its burly physique and ability to manipulate peat at will.
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_4: What kind of food would suit a Pokémon accustomed to living in swamps? Grains? Beans? Cake?
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_5: Maybe I should get baking for some firsthand taste-testing. I bet Teddiursa could lend me some honey!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_6: Ah—listen to me yammering on and on. Researching Pokémon first found in Hisui never fails to pique my curiosity about the past!
quest_special_dialogue_teddiursa_3_7: Thanks again for spending the day learning about Pokémon with me, %PLAYERNAME%. I can always count on you to make my work a little sweeter!
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_0: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Good to see you. Do you have anything fun planned for today?
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_1: I’ll be attending a picnic with the team leaders, myself.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_2: I must say, though, I was having a pretty hard time deciding what I should bring. Candela’s in charge of sandwiches, Spark is handling refreshments, and Blanche is bringing shaved ice, so the bases are all pretty well covered.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_3: Walking always clears my head, so I took a stroll and ended up spotting a large group of Tepig near where I normally pick my go-to snack, Pinap Berries.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_4: And suddenly—inspiration! Did you know Tepig loves to eat roasted Berries, Trainer?
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_5: The Fire Pig Pokémon blows fire balls through its nose and roasts the berries before it eats them.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_0_6: Roasted Berries sound like a great picnic snack, don’t you think? And speaking of, I need to start getting them ready. Why don’t you go check out the Tepig in the meantime?
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_1_1: Ah, I see you’ve caught a Tepig of your own! They make terrific companions in all aspects of life.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_1_2: Tepig evolves into Pignite, which, like Tepig, is known as the Fire Pig Pokémon.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_1_3: When Pignite’s internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. Whatever it eats becomes fuel for the flame in its stomach. Must do wonders for digestion!
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_1_4: Oh! That reminds me—I need to check on my roasted Berries.
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_1_5: While I finish up my picnic preparations, why don’t you see about evolving your Tepig into Pignite?
quest_special_dialogue_tepit_2_0: Hello again, %PLAYERNAME%. The Berry-roasting process is going swimmingly, and the whole place smells delicious!
