timed_challenge_bonus_modal_description: Trainers must work together as a global community to complete this challenge.
timed_challenge_bonus_modal_description_: All Trainers participating in a global challenge will contribute to a global goal. Once Trainers achieve the goal, a timed bonus will activate for all participants.
Trainers must work together as a regional community to complete this challenge.
timed_challenge_work_together: Trainers must work together as a global community to complete this challenge.
timed_challenge_work_together_regional_b: Trainers must work together as a regional community to complete this challenge.
timed_challenge_work_together_v2: Trainers must work together as a global community to complete this challenge.
timed_quest_adventure_adv23_branch_0: I’ve—*wheeze*—just been out for a run—*wheeze*—following one of those maps I found. How about you give it a go while I—*wheeze*—take a little rest?
timed_quest_adventure_adv23_branch_1: No need for you to hustle too, of course! You should adventure in whatever way works best for you. In fact...
timed_quest_adventure_adv23_branch_1_des: Choose this option to receive tasks focused on collecting Pokémon, spinning PokéStops, and hatching Eggs.
timed_quest_adventure_adv23_branch_2: What sounds better? Taking in the sights and catching all the Pokémon you see? Or focusing your research and finding specific Pokémon?
timed_quest_adventure_adv23_branch_2_des: Choose this option to receive tasks focused on catching specific Pokémon and completing Field Research.
timed_quest_cornet23_branch_1_descriptio: Choose this option if you think the professor is describing Snivy!
timed_quest_cornet23_branch_2_descriptio: Choose this option if you think the professor is describing Rowlet!
timed_quest_cornet23_branch_3_descriptio: Choose this option if you think the professor is describing Sudowoodo!
timed_research_pokemon_nidoran: Nidoran♀ and Nidoran♂ featured in Timed Research
timed_research_special: Timed Research from check-in now available
tips_battle_at_gyms_tutorial_body: You can claim a Gym controlled by a rival team by defeating the Pokémon in the Gym. If you reduce the motivation of all Pokémon in the Gym to zero, you’ll be able to claim the Gym for your team.
tips_friends_list_no_friends_body: Pokémon GO is more fun with friends! Add a friend or invite new Trainers to join.
tips_friends_online_status_body:
You can enable online status sharing now or do so later using the Online/Offline toggle on your Friend List.

Your online status indicates to your friends when you are playing.
tips_friends_tutorial_add_body:
Add friends by entering their Trainer Code or scanning their QR Code. Adding friends in Pokémon GO will connect you in all Niantic Games you both play.

You can also add friends by connecting your account to Facebook on the Add Friend screen.
tips_friends_tutorial_battle_body: At level 10, you can battle alongside friends in Gyms and raids. You can also challenge them to Trainer Battles! Become Ultra or Best Friends to battle each other from anywhere in the world.
tips_friends_tutorial_build_friendship_b:
Your Friendship level will increase with each interaction, helping you unlock extra bonuses.

You can raise your Friendship level with a Trainer once per day, and when you do so, that Trainer’s portrait will have a blue glow.
tips_friends_tutorial_gifts_body:
You and a friend can send Gifts to each other once a day.

Add a Gift Sticker to make your Gift extra special!
tips_friends_tutorial_lucky_body:
For a chance to become Lucky Friends with a Trainer, become Best Friends with them and continue interacting with them each day.

Trade with a Lucky Friend to receive a Lucky Pokémon! You can become Lucky Friends again later.
tips_friends_tutorial_lucky_unlocked_bod:
You and your Best Friends can now become Lucky Friends! Continue interacting with them for the chance to do so.
 
When you’re Lucky Friends, the next time you trade with each other, both of the Pokémon you trade will become Lucky Pokémon.
tips_friends_tutorial_trade_body:
At level 10, you can trade Pokémon with your friends to help complete your Pokédex.

You’ll need to be near a friend to trade with them.
tips_gift_tutorial_completion_0: Great work, {0}! Adventures will take you far and wide in this world, and the more friends you make, the better.
tips_gift_tutorial_completion_1: Be sure to interact with them daily, and you might be rewarded for it!
tips_gift_tutorial_introduction_0: Congratulations, {0}! You’ve made your first friend in Pokémon GO!
tips_gift_tutorial_introduction_1: As you play together, you’ll increase your Friendship level and unlock extra bonuses.
tips_gift_tutorial_introduction_2: Open a Gift from a friend to increase your Friendship level!
tips_gift_tutorial_introduction_modal_bo: Now that you have a friend, you can send them Gifts that you collect from PokéStops. Do you want to learn how Gifts work?
tips_gym_pokecoins_tutorial_body:
Earn up to 50 PokéCoins per day when your Pokémon defends a Gym.

You’ll earn these PokéCoins when your Pokémon returns from defending the Gym.
tips_loading_screen_battle_switch_charge: Switch out Pokémon during battle to utilize your battle party’s different Charged Attacks.
tips_loading_screen_curveball_chance: A Curveball Throw will increase your chances of catching a Pokémon.
tips_loading_screen_daily_raid_pass: Collect your daily free Raid Pass by spinning the Photo Disc at any Gym.
tips_loading_screen_discard_all_items: Quickly discard your entire stock of any one item in your Item Bag by tapping the − button on the discard screen.
tips_loading_screen_evolve_knocked_out: When you evolve a Pokémon that’s been knocked out in battle, that Pokémon will automatically return to full health.
tips_loading_screen_friendship_lucky_egg: Use a Lucky Egg to double the XP you earn by increasing your Friendship level with other Trainers.
tips_loading_screen_golden_razz_gym: Feeding a Golden Razz Berry to a Pokémon defending a Gym will fully heal that Pokémon.
tips_loading_screen_raid_egg_hatch: It’s common for Trainers to challenge difficult raids the moment the Raid Egg hatches.
tips_loading_screen_raid_party_prep: Prepare a battle party in advance to lock in your strategy before challenging a Raid Boss.
tips_lucky_trading_modal_body:
A Lucky Trade turns traded Pokémon into Lucky Pokémon!

Lucky Pokémon can be stronger in battle, require less Stardust to power up, and appear with a shimmery effect in the Pokédex and on the Pokémon’s summary page.
tips_lure_tutorial_intro_conversation_0: Hey there, {0}! I’ve been developing a Lure Module to attract wild Pokémon.
tips_lure_tutorial_intro_conversation_1: Lure Modules will help you on your journey to discover and catch more Pokémon!
tips_lure_tutorial_intro_conversation_2: Walk to a nearby PokéStop, place a Lure Module, and see what happens!
tips_lure_tutorial_introduction_body: Lure Modules attract Pokémon to a PokéStop for 30 minutes. The effect will also benefit other nearby Trainers.
tips_lures_locked_conversation_0: This is where you can place a Lure Module, which will attract nearby Pokémon to this PokéStop. Aren’t Pokémon such interesting creatures?
tips_lures_locked_conversation_1: You’ll need more experience before you can use Lure Modules, though. Come back when you’ve reached level {0}!
tips_lures_tutorial_conversation_0: Tap a Lure Module to place it in the empty slot, and wild Pokémon should start appearing around the PokéStop soon after!
tips_potion_revive_tutorial_intro_0: Looks like your Pokémon fainted. Here are some Potions and Revives that you can use to restore your Pokémon’s HP.
tips_potion_revive_tutorial_intro_1: To use these items, open your Item Bag. Hope you find them helpful, {0}! Let’s take care of our Pokémon, just like they take care of us.
tips_potion_revive_tutorial_outro_0: Collect more Potions and Revives by winning Raid Battles and spinning Photo Discs at PokéStops and Gyms!
tips_potion_tutorial_0: Your work doesn’t stop there. You should get your Pokémon to full HP!
tips_potion_tutorial_1: You can use Potions to restore the HP of your Pokémon.
tips_potion_tutorial_2: When using Potions, tap on a Pokémon to restore its HP.
tips_potion_tutorial_3: Just like new! Seeing a Pokémon feel better is one of my favorite things.
tips_potion_tutorial_select_item_toast: Use your Potions to restore the HP of your Pokémon.
tips_potion_tutorial_use_item_toast: Tap on a Pokémon to restore its HP.
tips_raid_tutorial_charged_attack_body: Once your attack meter is full, tap the button to perform a Charged Attack, which can deal a lot of damage.
tips_raid_tutorial_difficulty_body:
The icon indicates a raid’s difficulty. Work with other Trainers to defeat more challenging Raid Bosses!

If you defeat a Mega Raid Boss, you’ll get Mega Energy that you can use to Mega Evolve that Pokémon.
tips_raid_tutorial_dodge_body: Swipe to the left or right to dodge incoming attacks from your opponent.
tips_raid_tutorial_fast_attack_body: Tap anywhere on the screen to perform a Fast Attack. Fast Attacks generate energy for your Charged Attacks.
tips_raid_tutorial_mega_attack_boost_bod: While using a Mega-Evolved Pokémon in a Raid Battle or a Gym battle, the attacks of other Trainers’ Pokémon challenging that same raid or Gym will deal more damage. These attacks will deal even more damage if they’re the same type as your Mega-Evolved Pokémon.
tips_razzberry_tutorial_message: To make a Pokémon easier to catch, give it a Razz Berry or a Golden Razz Berry.
tips_revive_tutorial_0: Use a Revive on a fainted Pokémon to restore half its maximum HP.
tips_revive_tutorial_select_item_toast: Use Revives to revive fainted Pokémon.
tips_revive_tutorial_use_item_toast: Tap on your fainted Pokémon to help revive them.
tips_tagging_tutorial_body_0: As your Pokémon collection grows, try using tags to easily categorize and sort your Pokémon based on specific characteristics.
tips_tagging_tutorial_body_1: Here are some examples of ways you can utilize tags.
tips_tasks_curve_ball_body: Spin the Poké Ball in a circular motion before you release it. Throwing a Curveball increases your chance of catching the Pokémon.
tips_tasks_gifts_body:
Get Gifts by spinning PokéStops. To send a Gift, go to a friend’s Trainer profile.

Add a Gift sticker to make it extra special!
tips_tasks_snapshot_buddy_body: To take a snapshot of your buddy, go to the buddy screen, tap PLAY! to go into AR mode, and then tap the camera button.
tips_tasks_snapshot_buddy_title: Take a Snapshot of Your Buddy
tips_tasks_snapshot_inventory_body: To take a snapshot of your Pokémon, go to its details page, and tap the camera button. You can also go to your Item Bag, select the Camera item, and then choose a Pokémon.
tips_tasks_snapshot_inventory_title: Take a Snapshot of Your Pokémon
tips_tasks_snapshot_wild_body: When encountering a Pokémon in the wild, tap the camera button to take a snapshot.
tips_tasks_snapshot_wild_title: Take a Snapshot of a Wild Pokémon
tips_tasks_throw_type_body: When you’re holding a Poké Ball, a target ring will appear around the Pokémon. If you throw the Poké Ball and it lands inside the target ring, you’ll earn a Nice, Great, or Excellent Throw.
tips_tasks_trade_body: You must be near a friend to trade with them. Then, go to their Trainer profile on your Friends list and tap TRADE.
tips_trading_intro_conversation_1: Hey there, %PLAYERNAME%! Did you know you can trade Pokémon with other Trainers?
tips_trading_intro_conversation_2: Trading is an essential part of being a Pokémon Trainer.
tips_trading_intro_conversation_3: You should give it a try! But remember: before you can trade with a friend, you both must be physically near each other.
tips_trading_intro_modal_body: Trade Pokémon with other Trainers to increase your Friendship Level! To trade a Pokémon, open your Friend List, and then tap the Trainer you wish to trade Pokémon with. Then, tap the Trade button to enter the trading screen.
titan_ar_mapping_scan_cautiously_text:
Be respectful of others while scanning.
Remember to stay safe and be aware of your surroundings.
titan_ar_mapping_warning_too_dark: Too dark. Ensure your camera is unobstructed and there is adequate lighting.
titan_ar_mapping_warning_too_fast: Too fast. Move slowly around the PokéStop.
titan_ar_mapping_warning_too_slow: Movement not detected. Keep moving slowly around the PokéStop.
titan_image_gallery_rpc_failed: Failed to load images. Please try again later.
titan_image_gallery_too_far_add_photo: Walk closer to add a photo to this PokéStop.
titan_image_gallery_too_far_scanning: Walk closer to scan this PokéStop.
titan_poi_ar_data_be_aware: While scanning, be aware of your surroundings and respectful of others.
titan_poi_ar_data_contribute_more: Thank you for your contribution! Will you help us learn more about this PokéStop or Gym?
titan_poi_ar_data_frame_tutorial: Keep the subject of the PokéStop or Gym inside the frame, and slowly walk around it if possible.
titan_poi_ar_data_more_space_required: Your device does not have enough storage space. Please free up space and try again.
titan_poi_ar_data_need_permission: PokéStop Scan requires camera and storage permissions.
titan_poi_ar_data_opt_in_1: We’re developing new AR technology and would like to enlist your help. Would you like to aid our research by using the PokéStop Scan feature to scan PokéStops and Gyms and upload your scan data? If you choose to enable this feature, you can opt out at any time by disabling it via the Settings menu. Learn more.
titan_poi_ar_data_opt_in_2:
You have successfully enabled PokéStop Scan.

You can opt out at any time by disabling PokéStop Scan in the Settings menu.
titan_poi_ar_data_thank_you: Thank you for your contribution! You can upload PokéStop scans via the Settings menu.
titan_poi_ar_data_thank_you_upload_now: Thank you for your contribution! Your PokéStop Scan data will upload in the background.
titan_poi_ar_data_tut_desc_1:
Scan the subject of the PokéStop or Gym by keeping it inside the frame and slowly walking around it if possible.

Please do not scan inside private residences or from locations that are inaccessible to the public.
titan_poi_ar_data_video_too_short: Scan must be more than {0} seconds
titan_poi_ar_data_wait_for_research_enco: Preparing PokéStop Scan Please wait for your PokéStop scan to be ready to preview.
titan_poi_ar_video_exit: Are you sure you want to exit? Your scan will be deleted.
titan_poi_ar_video_preview_disabled: Please wait while your PokéStop scan is processed.
titan_poi_ar_video_upload_prompt: You are about to upload {0} MB of data. If you are not connected to Wi-Fi, data rates may apply.
titan_poi_ar_video_upload_with_size: Would you like to upload? The upload size is {0} MB.
titan_poi_scan_added: You’ll have {0} more scan contribution(s) available tomorrow.
titan_poi_scan_available: You have {0} scan contribution(s) available today.
titan_poi_scan_maxed: You’ve reached your max daily scan contribution(s) of {0}.
titan_scan_validation_failure_reason_too: Too dark. Please scan again, ensuring your camera is unobstructed and there is adequate lighting.
Too fast. Please scan again, ensuring you move slowly around the PokéStop.
Movement not detected. Please scan again, ensuring you move slowly around the PokéStop.
titan_scan_validation_failure_reason_unk: Please scan again, ensuring adequate lighting while you move slowly around the PokéStop.
titan_settings_ar_disable_warning_msg: If you disable PokéStop Scan, all scans on your device will be deleted, so you will lose any scans that you have not uploaded.
titan_settings_ar_disable_warning_title: Are you sure you want to disable PokéStop Scan?
titan_settings_ar_upload_clear_all_warni: This will clear all existing scans on your device. Are you sure?
titan_settings_ar_upload_exit_warning: Exiting will cancel any remaining uploads. Are you sure?

trade_tips_p1|0: Special Trades can only occur once a day, unless you’re at certain special events.

trade_toast_must_connect_first: Please wait for your friend to connect.
trade_tut_candy_bonus_message: You need to be within 100 meters of a friend to start a trade. You can earn a bonus depending on where the Pokémon in the trade were caught. The farther apart their caught locations (up to around 100 km), the more Candy you'll earn!
trade_tut_proximity_message: You can trade with a friend only when you're near each other.
trade_tut_special_trade_message: Legendary Pokémon, Mythical Pokémon, Ultra Beasts, Purified Pokémon, Shiny Pokémon, and Pokémon not currently in your Pokédex all require a Special Trade. You can only make one Special Trade a day.
trade_tut_stardust_needed_message: The amount of Stardust needed for trading varies. Trades for certain Pokémon are called Special Trades and require more Stardust. Increasing your Friendship level will reduce the amount of Stardust required for Special Trades.
trade_tut_strength_adjust: Pokémon CP and HP in Trade
trade_tut_strength_adjust_message: When you trade a Pokémon to a friend, you can see the range of CP and HP that it could have. This range adjusts based on your friend's level and will also be affected by your Friendship level. After you complete the trade, the stats of both Pokémon will change randomly to reflect the new range.
trade_tutorial_complete_1: Great work! It’s always a little sad to say good-bye, but look on the bright side: your friend has a new Pokémon friend, and so do you!
trade_tutorial_complete_2: Continue trading with your friends to increase your Friendship Level. Trade enough times, and you may even become Lucky Friends!

troydisk.1_description: A module that attracts Pokémon to a PokéStop for 30 minutes. The effect benefits other people nearby.
troydisk.8_description: A pack of 8 Lure Modules, which attract Pokémon to a PokéStop for 30 minutes. The effect benefits other people nearby.
troydisk_glacial.1_description: A frosty Lure Module that attracts Pokémon for 30 minutes—especially ones that love the cold. It can also cause some Pokémon to evolve.
troydisk_magnetic.1_description: An electronic Lure Module that attracts Pokémon for 30 minutes—especially ones that possess a magnetic field. It can also cause some Pokémon to evolve.
troydisk_mossy.1_description: A natural Lure Module that attracts Pokémon for 30 minutes—especially ones that love mossy scents. It can also cause some Pokémon to evolve.
troydisk_rainy.1_description: A wet Lure Module that attracts Pokémon for 30 minutes, especially ones that love the rain. It can also cause some Pokémon to evolve.

tutorial_level_40_plus_info: Now that you’ve reached level 40, you’ll have some new challenges you’ll have to complete in order to progress to the next level.
tutorial_level_40_plus_intro: Congratulations on your remarkable progress, Trainer!
tutorial_route_bonus_1: Incense attracts more Pokémon on new Routes
tutorial_route_bonus_2: Unusual Pokémon may appear on Routes
tutorial_route_play_body_0:
Discover your local community and earn rewards by exploring Routes!

To start:
1. Choose a Route from the list or map.
2. Go to the start point.
3. Follow the Route to its end point.
tutorial_route_play_body_1: When you’re within {0} m of the Route’s path, you will earn special bonuses.
tutorial_route_play_body_2:
• You will earn a new Route Badge the first time you complete a Route.
• Follow a Route multiple times to progress your badge and improve the rewards you receive from that Route.
tutorial_route_play_body_3:
1. Stay near the Route’s path to ensure your progress is recorded.
2. You can complete a Route without traveling the full length of the Route, but you may earn reduced rewards by doing so.
tutorial_sinistea_intro|1: %PLAYERNAME%, have you heard of the mysterious Ghost-type Pokémon Sinistea? I’ve heard it has more than one form!
tutorial_sinistea_intro|2: It seems that they make their homes in different types of teacups. I’ll bet your team leader can help you appraise yours.
tutorial_sinistea_intro|3: See if you can catch another one so we can learn more!
tutorial_vivillon_postcard_body_0: If you pin multiple Postcards from a certain region, you’ll have a chance to encounter a Pokémon!
tutorial_vivillon_postcard_body_1: The pattern on Vivillon’s wings is affected by the climate of their habitat. You can check the Vivillon map from the Pokédex and the Vivillon medal page to see where different Vivillon can be found.
tutorial_vivillon_postcard_body_2: When you pin a Postcard you receive from a friend, you’ll make progress on the Vivillon medal associated with that location. If you collect several Postcards from a certain part of the world, you can encounter a Scatterbug specifically from that habitat.
tutorial_vivillon_postcard_header: Catch Vivillon from all around the world!
tutorial_xl_candy_1: It looks like you found a Candy XL! I’ve heard you can use these to help your Pokémon become even stronger than what ordinary Candies alone can achieve!
tutorial_xl_candy_2: There’s a chance that you can find Candies XL after you catch Pokémon. The stronger the Pokémon, the more likely you are to find Candies XL.

v2_catch_rewards|1: Well done! It looks like you’ve earned some Stardust and Candy. Both of these items can be used to make your Pokémon stronger.
v2_egg_incubation_complete|1: Excellent! You’ve successfully put the Egg in the Incubator. Keep walking and it’ll hatch soon enough!
v2_egg_incubation|1: Looks like you got an Egg from a PokéStop!
v2_egg_incubation|2: You can put the Egg inside an item called an Incubator and walk to hatch it. After the Egg hatches, you’ll see what Pokémon is inside!
v2_egg_incubation|3: Let’s put this Egg into an Incubator!
v2_first_time_encounter|1: Hello again—you’re just in time! There’s a Pokémon nearby!
v2_first_time_encounter|2: Here are some Poké Balls. I’m here to help you with your first encounter, so throw as many Poké Balls as you need to catch the Pokémon!
v2_onboard_name_registered|1:
Oh, what a cool nickname!
Nice to meet you!
v2_onboard_welcome_screen|1:
Hello there!
I am Professor Willow.
v2_onboard_welcome_screen|2: Did you know that this world is inhabited by creatures known as Pokémon, which thrive in practically every habitat? It’s incredible!
v2_onboard_welcome_screen|3: I’ve dedicated my life to studying the behaviors and migration patterns of hundreds of unique species of Pokémon. So, will you help me with my research?
v2_onboard_welcome_screen|4: That’s great to hear! You’ll need to find and collect Pokémon from just about everywhere. So, go ahead and choose your style, and let’s start your adventures!
v2_pokedex_intro|1: Now that you’re a Pokémon Trainer, take this Pokédex to help you on your adventures.
v2_pokedex_intro|2: The Pokédex will provide you with all sorts of useful information about Pokémon. Let’s give it a try!
v2_pokedex_tutorial|1: As you can see, there are many Pokémon to discover.
v2_starter_caught|1:
Amazing work!
You’ve caught your first Pokémon!
v2_tutorial_catch2_pretext|1: A few more just appeared around you. Catch one!
v2_tutorial_catch3_pretext|1: Hey, you're a natural. Let's catch another!
v2_tutorial_catch4_posttext|1: Looks like you’ve got the hang of it, {0}! Here are some more Poké Balls so you can continue your adventures.
v2_tutorial_catch4_pretext|1: You’re making great progress on your Pokédex. Let’s catch one more.
v2_tutorial_complete_prelude|1: As you explore the world and encounter more Pokémon, you’ll need more Poké Balls and other useful items.
v2_tutorial_complete|1: Collect these items at PokéStops, which you’ll find at interesting places around you. They look like this on your map.
v2_tutorial_complete|2: From now on, you’ll be off exploring all over the world to discover the wonder of Pokémon.
v2_username_prompt|1: Trainer! I was so excited to meet you that I forgot to ask for your name! What should I call you?

verbose_logs_disable_body: {1} game logs you haven’t uploaded will be deleted if you choose to stop saving.
verbose_logs_disable_title: Do you want to stop saving these game logs?
verbose_logs_info_body:
Game logs contain valuable information that can help Niantic improve certain aspects of Pokémon GO. If you allow your game logs to be saved, you can then upload them and share them with Niantic.

Game logs for each activity are stored for 24 hours or until you participate in that activity again. You can upload game logs at any time via the Settings menu.

waina_confirm_unpair: Are you sure you want to unpair your Pokémon GO Plus +?
waina_confirm_unpair_description: Any sleep data stored on your Pokémon GO Plus + will be erased the next time it’s paired.
waina_reward_time_change_warning: Are you sure you want to change your reward time?
waina_reward_time_change_warning_descrip: You may miss out on rewards for sleep you tracked within the last 24 hours if you change your reward time.
waina_tips_1_text: With Quick-Reconnect Mode enabled, you can reconnect your nearby Pokémon GO Plus + to your paired smart device by simply tapping the Pokémon GO Plus + icon on the Map view or in Settings. If this feature is disabled, you’ll need to press the main button on your Pokémon GO Plus + to reconnect it.
waina_tips_2_text: With Auto-Throw enabled, your Pokémon GO Plus + can automatically attempt to catch Pokémon you pass. Auto-Throw only uses Poké Balls—not Great Balls or Ultra Balls—and it will not work if you have no Poké Balls in your Item Bag. Auto-Throw will not attempt to catch a Pokémon that you haven’t caught yet. Adventure Sync must be enabled to use Auto-Throw.
waina_tips_3_text: With Button-Throw, you can choose to use any type of Poké Ball, including Great Balls and Ultra Balls. You can update this selection at any time in Settings. If no selection is made, Button-Throw will only use Poké Balls. Button-Throw will not work if you run out of whatever type of Poké Ball you selected.
waina_tips_4_text: With Auto-Spin enabled, your Pokémon GO Plus + can automatically attempt to spin any PokéStops you come within range of. Auto-Spin will not work if your Item Bag is full. Adventure Sync must be enabled to use Auto-Spin.
waina_user_dialog_first_connect: Would you like to finish pairing and connect this Pokémon GO Plus +?
waina_user_dialog_first_connect_descript: This Pokémon GO Plus + is now associated with your account. If someone else was using this Pokémon GO Plus + before you, their sleep data will be erased if you proceed with pairing.
waina_user_dialog_press_two_buttons: Please press the main button and the side button at the same time.
waina_user_dialog_reconnect: Do you want to clear this Pokémon GO Plus + and try to pair it again?
waina_user_dialog_reconnect_description: This Pokémon GO Plus + was associated with your account but is no longer configured properly. This Pokémon GO Plus + will need to be cleared of all sleep data before you can continue.
waina_user_dialog_reconnect_reject: Do you want to clear this Pokémon GO Plus + and try to pair it again?
waina_user_dialog_reconnect_reject_descr: This Pokémon GO Plus + was associated with an account in the past. The associated account could not be verified, so this Pokémon GO Plus + will need to be cleared of all sleep data before you can continue.
waina_user_dialog_white_indicator_light_: The indicator light on your Pokémon GO Plus + should now be solid white.
